English: Now these are the names of the children of Israel who came to Egypt; each man and his household came with Jacob
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael rim 'nu kơ lu sư đei chông ba hnam dơnŏ kơdih kiơ̆ Jakôp tơ dêh Êyiptơ

English: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah
Bahnar: Rubên, Simêôn, Lêwi păng Juđa

English: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin
Bahnar: Isakar, Sabulôn păng Bênjamin

English: Dan, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
Bahnar: Đan, Neptali, Gat păng Aser.

English: All those who were descendants of Jacob were seventy persons (for Joseph was in Egypt already).
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng adrĕch Jakôp, đei tơpơh-jĭt 'nu; Jôsep sư đei oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And Joseph died, all his brothers, and all that generation.
Bahnar: Jôsep lôch păng 'nhŏng oh sư hăm lu bơngai arih lăm jơhnơr 'noh lu sư kư̆m lôch đĭ-đăng.

English: But the children of Israel were fruitful and increased abundantly, multiplied and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon sâu Isơrael pơjing rai lơ, rai kơdrâ̆m hlĭch chrơp tơpă, rai đunh jing mơdrŏng pran kơtang, oei 'bĕnh-'bang jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh 'noh.

English: Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who did not know Joseph.
Bahnar: Tơ char Êyiptơ, đei minh 'nu pơtao 'nao pơgơ̆r, sư ưh kơ băt kơ Jôsep.

English: And he said to his people, “Look, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ kon pơlei sư: Kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael rai lơ kơdrâ̆m păng pran hloh kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: come, let us deal shrewdly with them, lest they multiply, and it happen, in the event of war, that they also join our enemies and fight against us, and so go up out of the land.”
Bahnar: Na bơ̆n athei iŏk đon hlôh wao gơh hơgei wă pơm kơ lu sư, hli kơ lu sư rai lơ, tơ anăp kơnh tơdah đei tơdrong tơblah lu sư pơgơ̆p hăm lu ayăt kơ bơ̆n blah bơ̆n păng kơdâu jăk hloi đơ̆ng dêh 'nâu.

English: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh supply cities, Pithom and Raamses.
Bahnar: Lei na pơtao ăn bơngai Êyiptơ wei-lăng tơdrong jang chă athei lu sư, wă rôp pơgŏ ăn tơdrong jang gleh trăp kơ kon pơlei Isơrael; lu sư man pơm pơlei Phithom păng Ramse wă pơm hnam tah mong tơmam kơ Pharaôn.

English: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were in dread of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Mă tơpă lu bơngai Êyiptơ rai wă rôp pơgŏ pơmat lu sư, kon pơlei Isơrael rai lơ rai jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char, lăm jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai Êyiptơ hli kơ kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: So the Egyptians made the children of Israel serve with rigor.
Bahnar: Lei na bơngai Êyiptơ rôp pơgŏ bơngai Isơrael jang gleh hrat pơmat-tat tơpă.

English: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage—in mortar, in brick, and in all manner of service in the field. All their service in which they made them serve was with rigor.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơmat kon pơlei Isơrael hăm tơdrong jang hrat pơjuă teh pơm găch păng lơ tơdrong jang nai lăm mir chŭn. Dôm tơdrong jang lu bơngai Êyiptơ rôp pơgŏ kon pơlei Isơrael jang gleh pơmat-tat dêh.

English: Then the king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of one was Shiphrah and the name of the other Puah
Bahnar: Pơtao dêh Êyiptơ khan kơ lu yă kơ'mĭn bơngai Hêbrơ tơpŭ, minh 'nu anăn Sipra păng minh 'nu anăn Phuah.

English: and he said, “When you do the duties of a midwife for the Hebrew women, and see them on the birthstools, if it is a son, then you shall kill him; but if it is a daughter, then she shall live.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: Tơdah lu iĕm kơ'mĭna lu bơngai drŏ-kăn Hêbrơ tơpŭ, mưh tơpŭ kon drŏ-nglo, iĕm ket pơlôch lê̆ hŏ, mưh bơngai drŏ-kăn iĕm rong arih.

English: But the midwives feared God, and did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the male children alive.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu yă kơ'mĭn đe tơpŭ mă băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r pơtao Êyiptơ pơkă pơkăm, sư rong đĭ lu nge drŏ-nglo arih ngăl.

English: So the king of Egypt called for the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, and saved the male children alive?”
Bahnar: Pơtao dêh Êyiptơ krao lu yă kơ'mĭn ei khan: Liơ mă lu iĕm pơm thoi noh, rong lu kon drŏ-nglo arih ngăl?

English: And the midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women; for they are lively and give birth before the midwives come to them.”
Bahnar: Lu yă kơ'mĭn đe tơpŭ ei tơl: “'Noh yua kơ lu bơngai drŏ-kăn Hêbrơ ưh kơ thoi lu bơngai drŏ-kăn Êyiptơ ôh; lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m pran ngăl lu sư tơpŭ hlôi adrol kơ lu nhôn truh.”

English: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied and grew very mighty.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong 'lơ̆ng kơ lu yă kơ'mĭn; kon pơlei rai tŏk păng jing rai lơ kơdrâ̆m.

English: And so it was, because the midwives feared God, that He provided households for them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu yă kơ'mĭn đei jơhngơ̆m hli yom tơpă kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ hnam dơnŏ lu sư hiôk jơnap

English: So Pharaoh commanded all his people, saying, “Every son who is born you shall cast into the river, and every daughter you shall save alive.”
Bahnar: Pharaôn khan tơtă kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư kơdih thoi âu: Mưh iĕm 'bôh lu bơngai Hêbrơ 'nao tơpŭ kon drŏ-nglo iĕm klơ̆m lê̆ tơ đak krong Nil; kon drŏ-kăn iĕm rong sư arih.

English: And a man of the house of Levi went and took as wife a daughter of Levi.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu lăm adrĕch adrung Lêwi rôp bơngai adruh Lêwi pơm akăn.

English: So the woman conceived and bore a son. And when she saw that he was a beautiful child, she hid him three months.
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn ei anăp, na tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo; 'bôh kon drŏ-nglo 'lơ̆ng dêh tơpă, na ôn lê̆ lăm pêng khei.

English: But when she could no longer hide him, she took an ark of bulrushes for him, daubed it with asphalt and pitch, put the child in it, and laid it in the reeds by the river’s bank.
Bahnar: Mă sư 'maih ôn đunh hloh kơ noh ră mă-lei ưh kơ gơh boih, na duch ei iŏk minh pôm bai hre, pik chai hơngo, na tơ'bĭch kon nge lăm noh, năm ming ôn sư 'bơ̆t 'nhĕt trang tơter jih lăm đak krong.

English: And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
Bahnar: Mŏ bơngai nge ei sư dơ̆ng tơmang đơ̆ng ataih wă kơ băt đei thoi yơ.

English: Then the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe at the river. And her maidens walked along the riverside; and when she saw the ark among the reeds, she sent her maid to get it.
Bahnar: Na truh kon adruh pơtao Pharaôn năm jur hum tơ đak krong, dôm lu đam sư dăr ngôi kiơ̆ jih đak krong ei; kon adruh pơtao 'bôh bai hre noh tơ lăm 'nhĕt trang na sư krao lu đam sư ei pôk iŏk hơtŏk kơ sư.

English: And when she opened it, she saw the child, and behold, the baby wept. So she had compassion on him, and said, “This is one of the Hebrews’ children.”
Bahnar: Kon adruh pơtao pơih bai 'bôh kon nge drŏ-nglo oei nhơ̆m, sư 'brơ̆k mơnat khan: Âu boih minh 'nu kon lu bơngai Hêbrơ.

English: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and call a nurse for you from the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for you?”
Bahnar: Mŏ bơngai nge ei năm roi khan hloi hăm kon adruh pơtao: Ih hăm wă kơ inh năm krao minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Hêbrơ tơmŏm nge âu dah ưh?

English: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Go.” So the maiden went and called the child’s mother.
Bahnar: Kon adruh pơtao sư drơ̆ng: “Lei jah năm wăi.” Na mŏ bơngai nge ei năm krao mĕ bơngai nge noh.

English: Then Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child away and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed him.
Bahnar: Kon adruh pơtao khan kơ sư: “Iŏk bĕ nge âu tơ hnam wei rong tơmŏm sư ăn kơ inh; inh gô apah ih jên wei rong.” Sư pôk kơ'mĭn iŏk nge ei na tơmŏm hloi.

English: And the child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. So she called his name Moses, saying, “Because I drew him out of the water.”
Bahnar: Truh wơ̆ 'lŏ wao boih, mĕ sư chông ba sư năm ăn kơ kon adruh pơtao, kon adruh pơtao iŏk pơm kon, sư krao anăn noh Môisa yua kơ sư khan: Đêl inh iŏk pơklaih sư đơ̆ng đak.

English: Now it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown, that he went out to his brethren and looked at their burdens. And he saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr, Môis 'lŏ hlôh băt tôm tơdrong boih. Sư năm ngôi tơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư, sư 'bôh tơdrong jang lu 'nhŏng oh sư pơmat-tat; na 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai Êyiptơ tôn teh bơngai Hêbrơ lăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih

English: So he looked this way and that way, and when he saw no one, he killed the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
Bahnar: sư chă lăng jum dăr ưh kơ đei 'bôh bơngai bu, na sư pơlôch bơngai Êyiptơ klaih kơ noh sư 'bŭ ôn lê̆ lăm chuơh.

English: And when he went out the second day, behold, two Hebrew men were fighting, and he said to the one who did the wrong, “Why are you striking your companion?”
Bahnar: Truh năr đơ̆ng rŏng, Môis năm tơ noh dơ̆ng, sư 'bôh 'bar 'nu bơngai Hêbrơ tơteh băl, sư khan hăm bơngai mă pơm yoch ei thoi âu: Liơ mă măr iĕm tơteh băl tơduă buăl kơdih?

English: Then he said, “Who made you a prince and a judge over us? Do you intend to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” So Moses feared and said, “Surely this thing is known!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai noh tơl khan: Bơngai bu pôk ih pơm pơtao, pơm tih sek tơlang kơ lu nhôn? Hăm trŏ ih wă pơlôch nhôn thoi lĕ ih pơlôch bơngai Êyiptơ 'noh hă? Môis hli, na khan: Trŏ tơpă, Tơdrong 'nâu rŏ lăng đe băt boih.

English: When Pharaoh heard of this matter, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh and dwelt in the land of Midian; and he sat down by a well.
Bahnar: Pharaôn kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh, sư chă wă pơlôch Môis; Mă-lei Môis klĕnh kơ Pharaôn năm oei tơ dêh Mađian păng tơ noh sư hơ-oei jê̆ đak sơlŭng.

English: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. And they came and drew water, and they filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, đei tơpơh 'nu kon adruh 'bok soi dêh Mađian; năm tơ đak sơlŭng noh sŏ đak tuh tơ bơng wă ăn khŭl kon triu 'bă sư nhă.

English: Then the shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei lu bơngai wei triu nai truh sư pơpuh lê̆ lu adruh ei tơ nai; Môis gruih iung, sư năm dŏng lu adruh 'noh păng pơnhă ăn hloi khŭl triu ei.

English: When they came to Reuel their father, he said, “How is it that you have come so soon today?”
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon adruh sư wih tơ hnam Jêthrô 'bă lu sư, jet lu sư: Liơ mă năr 'nâu lu iĕm wih tơ hnam hrôih dêh?

English: And they said, “An Egyptian delivered us from the hand of the shepherds, and he also drew enough water for us and watered the flock.”
Bahnar: Lu sư tơl: Đei minh 'nu bơngai Êyiptơ sư dŏng lu nhôn đơ̆ng lu khŭl bơngai wei triu păng sư kư̆m sŏ đak tơgŭm nhôn pơnhă ăn kơ khŭl triu hloi.

English: So he said to his daughters, “And where is he? Why is it that you have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.”
Bahnar: 'Bă lu sư dơ̆ng: Bơngai noh dang ei sư tơ yơ? Liơ mă lu iĕm achăng lê̆ sư? Krao pơtơm sư sŏng sa hăm bơ̆n.

English: Then Moses was content to live with the man, and he gave Zipporah his daughter to Moses.
Bahnar: Môis chu oei hơdai hăm lu sư, 'bă lu sư ăn hloi kon adruh sư oei kơ Môis. Anăn sư Sêpôra

English: And she bore him a son. He called his name Gershom, for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”
Bahnar: Sêpôra tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Môis krao anăn sư Gersôm,b yua kơ đei pơma khan: Inh oei tơ lăm char tơmoi.

English: Now it happened in the process of time that the king of Egypt died. Then the children of Israel groaned because of the bondage, and they cried out; and their cry came up to God because of the bondage.
Bahnar: Đunh 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh, Pơtao dêh Êyiptơ lôch; Kon pơlei Isơrael ôr krao yua kơ tơdrong pơm đĭch bơ̆jang gleh pơmat-tat: Nơ̆r krao ôr pơmat-tat truh tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: So God heard their groaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtơ̆ng tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon pơmat-tat lu sư, 'blŏk hơdơ̆r tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp.

English: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God acknowledged them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bôh mơnat kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, băt kơ tơdrong truh kơ lu sư pơmat-tat.

English: Now Moses was tending the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian. And he led the flock to the back of the desert, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
Bahnar: Môis wei triu Jêthrô tơnei sư, 'bok soi tơm dêh Mađian; sư wei chông ba khŭl triu tơ tơmăn 'nhĕt char glă, truh tơ kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, kông 'noh đe krao Hôrêp.

English: And the Angel of the LORD appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush. So he looked, and behold, the bush was burning with fire, but the bush was not consumed.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang tơ'bôh akâu kơ sư lăm pla ŭnh tŏk-bŏk jơ'bôt Jơla 'noh. Sư lăng 'bôh đĭ jơ'bôt jơla ŭnh oei sa, mă-lei ŭnh ưh kơ đei sa jơ'bôt jơla.

English: Then Moses said, “I will now turn aside and see this great sight, why the bush does not burn.”
Bahnar: Môis khan: Inh năm rai jê̆ wă lăng pơnhen tơdrong hlĭch tih 'nâu, yua kơ kiơ tơnơm jơla 'nâu mă ŭnh sa ưh kơ đei păt hloi.

English: So when the LORD saw that he turned aside to look, God called to him from the midst of the bush and said, “Moses, Moses!” And he said, “Here I am.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'bôh sư năm lăng rai jê̆, Kră Yang pơma đơ̆ng lăm jơla noh krao: Ơ Môis, Ơ Môis! Sư tơl khan: Đei inh tơ âu!

English: Then He said, “Do not draw near this place. Take your sandals off your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: 'Nĕ năm jê̆ tơ âu, plôh chơkhŏ ih bĕ, yua kơ anih ih oei dơ̆ng 'noh anih teh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Moreover He said, “I am the God of your father—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma dơ̆ng: Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok ih, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isăk păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp. Môis đơ̆p măt sư hloi yua kơ sư hli ưh kơ pơ̆n lăng tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And the LORD said: “I have surely seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt, and have heard their cry because of their taskmasters, for I know their sorrows.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inh 'bôh boih tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat kon pơlei Inh tơ dêh Êyiptơ păng Inh kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r lu sư krao ôr yua kơ tơdrong jang pơmat, Inh băt hơđăl đĭ dôm tơdrong jang pơmat-tat lu sư

English: So I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up from that land to a good and large land, to a land flowing with milk and honey, to the place of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites.
Bahnar: lei Inh jur wă pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti bơngai Êyiptơ, chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng dêh 'noh năm tơ dêh 'lơ̆ng rŏ, glă rơhơi, đei tơmam sa mah rơkah rơkai dêh char đak toh, đak sut, 'noh char Kanaan, đei kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Amôrit, kon pơlei Phêrêsit, kon pơlei Hêwit păng kon pơlei Jêbus oei tơ noh.

English: Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel has come to Me, and I have also seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r krao ôr đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael kơtơ̆ng truh tơ Inh păng Inh 'bôh boih kon pơlei Êyiptơ pơgŏ pơđep lu sư thoi yơ

English: Come now, therefore, and I will send you to Pharaoh that you may bring My people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt.”
Bahnar: na dang ei, năm bĕ tơ âu, Inh wă wơh ih năm tơ Pharaôn, wă chông tơlĕch kon pơlei Inh, wă khan kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh, and that I should bring the children of Israel out of Egypt?”
Bahnar: Môis sư tơl khan: Inh âu bu, mă pơ̆n năm truh tơ Pharaôn wă chông kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ?

English: So He said, “I will certainly be with you. And this shall be a sign to you that I have sent you: When you have brought the people out of Egypt, you shall serve God on this mountain.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: Inh gô oei hơdai hăm ih; 'nâu tơdrong wă kơ ih băt tơdra Inh wơh ih năm: Lăp ih chông kon pơlei lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ boih, na lu iĕm gô kơkuh awih awăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kơpal kông 'nâu.

English: Then Moses said to God, “Indeed, when I come to the children of Israel and say to them, ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they say to me, ‘What is His name?’ what shall I say to them?”
Bahnar: Môis tơl Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: Mưh inh năm truh tơ kon pơlei Isơrael, roi kơ lu sư: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm wơh inh năm truh tơ lu iĕm; mă-lei mưh lu sư jet: Anăn Sư bu? Lei inh tơl lu sư thoi yơ?

English: And God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM.” And He said, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel, ‘I AM has sent me to you.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: Inh boih Kră Yang Đei Kơdih Tơ'ngla Pơjing păng Tơ'ngla Arih Ling-Lang; Sư khan dơ̆ng: Khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: Kră Yang Tơ'ngla Đei Kơdih Arih Ling-lang wơh inh năm tơ lu iĕm.

English: Moreover God said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: ‘The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you. This is My name forever, and this is My memorial to all generations.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Môis dơ̆ng. Ih khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isăk, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp wơh inh năm tơ lu iĕm, Kră Yang khan: 'Noh jơ̆ anăn Inh oei oei ling-lang, 'noh boih wă kơ đe 'blŏk kơ Inh rim jơhnơr.

English: Go and gather the elders of Israel together, and say to them, ‘The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared to me, saying, “I have surely visited you and seen what is done to you in Egypt
Bahnar: Ih năm akŭm pơpôi bĕ lu kră bơngai Isơrael, khan kơ lu sư: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isăk, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp, tơ'bôh boih kơ inh păng khan: Tơpă Inh năm tơmang lu iĕm, 'bôh dôm tơdrong lu sư pơm kơ lu iĕm lăm dêh Êyiptơ

English: and I have said I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.” ’
Bahnar: na Inh khan: Inh gô iŏk tơlĕch iĕm đơ̆ng pơmat-tat lăm dêh Êyiptơ, wă anhăk ba iĕm tơ dêh Kanaan, đei kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Amôrit, kon pơlei Phêrêsit, kon pơlei Hêwit păng kon pơlei Jêbus, wă khan minh dêh char đak toh, đak sut.

English: Then they will heed your voice; and you shall come, you and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt; and you shall say to him, ‘The LORD God of the Hebrews has met with us; and now, please, let us go three days’ journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.’
Bahnar: Kon pơlei gô chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r ih, lei na ih hăm lu kră bơngai Isơrael năm tơ'bơ̆p pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, na roi kơ sư khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Hêbrơ, đei tơ'bôh kơ lu nhôn. Na dang ei, apinh ih ăn kơ lu nhôn lĕch năm tơ char glă, ataih dang pêng năr kơ trong, wă năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.

English: But I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not even by a mighty hand.
Bahnar: Tơpă, Inh băt mă đơ̆ng iĕm iŏk jơhngơ̆m apinh pơgŏ pơtao Êyiptơ, sư kư̆m ưh kơ ăn iĕm năm!

English: So I will stretch out My hand and strike Egypt with all My wonders which I will do in its midst; and after that he will let you go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh gô chro ti pơm kơ dêh Êyiptơ hăm tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch tơ lăm dêh 'noh, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh sư gô ăn kơ iĕm năm.

English: And I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians; and it shall be, when you go, that you shall not go empty-handed.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ kon pơlei 'nâu đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp măt lu bơngai Êyiptơ, truh năr lu iĕm năm, na ưh kơ đei, lĕch năm tơpang ti hoh đĕch ôh

English: But every woman shall ask of her neighbor, namely, of her who dwells near her house, articles of silver, articles of gold, and clothing; and you shall put them on your sons and on your daughters. So you shall plunder the Egyptians.”
Bahnar: rim 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn Isơrael gô apinh đơ̆ng bơngai drŏ-kăn Êyiptơ rông 'bôt sư, hăm lu bơngai tơmoi oei hơdai lăm hnam dơnŏ, dôm tơmam thoi maih, hu, truh tơ hơbĕn ao, iŏk pơhrŭk ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn lu iĕm kơdih. Lu iĕm gô plôh iŏk pơđĭ đơ̆ng akâu kon pơlei Êyiptơ thoi noh.

English: Then Moses answered and said, “But suppose they will not believe me or listen to my voice; suppose they say, ‘The LORD has not appeared to you.’ ”
Bahnar: Môis drơ̆ng khan: Mă-lei kon pơlei noh ưh kơ lui păng ưh kơ chu nơ̆r inh, lu sư gô khan: Kră Yang ưh kơ đei tơbang tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih ôh.

English: So the LORD said to him, “What is that in your hand?” He said, “A rod.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Ti ih chĕp kiơ? Môis tơl khan: Minh pôm 'long jra.

English: And He said, “Cast it on the ground.” So he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moses fled from it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng: Klơ̆m sư tơ teh. Sư klơ̆m hloi tơ teh, 'long jra noh jing minh dăng 'bih; Môis kơdâu weh đơ̆ng sư.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Reach out your hand and take it by the tail” (and he reached out his hand and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand)
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Iŏk ti ih rôp kiĕng sư 'noh. Môis chro ti năm rôp na 'bih ei jing hloi 'long jra chĕp lăm ti dơ̆ng.

English: “that they may believe that the LORD God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has appeared to you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: 'Noh wă kơ lu sư lui kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok sư, wă khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isăk, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp, đei tơ'bôh boih kơ ih.

English: Furthermore the LORD said to him, “Now put your hand in your bosom.” And he put his hand in his bosom, and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous, like snow.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng: Dan ti ih tơ kơtơh. Na sư dan hloi, klaih kơ 'noh sư hiŏng ti. Na, 'bôh ti sư 'bơm chin kok hmông thoi prĕl.

English: And He said, “Put your hand in your bosom again.” So he put his hand in his bosom again, and drew it out of his bosom, and behold, it was restored like his other flesh.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng: Dan ti ih tơ kơtơh dơ̆ng; na sư dan hloi tơ kơtơh, achăng ti sư lăng 'bôh sĕch akar sư thoi so.

English: “Then it will be, if they do not believe you, nor heed the message of the first sign, that they may believe the message of the latter sign.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng: Tơdah layơ kon pơlei 'noh ưh kơ lui kơ ih păng ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơdra mă blŭng-a, lei sư gô lui kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơdra mă 'bar.

English: And it shall be, if they do not believe even these two signs, or listen to your voice, that you shall take water from the river and pour it on the dry land. The water which you take from the river will become blood on the dry land.”
Bahnar: Tơdah kon pơlei ưh kơ lui kơ đĭ 'bar tơdra 'nâu păng ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r ih, lei chhŏ đak krong Nil tuh tơ teh hrĕng kro; đak mă ih iŏk đơ̆ng đak krong noh gô jing pham jơ̆p kơ teh hrĕng kro noh.

English: Then Moses said to the LORD, “O my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither before nor since You have spoken to Your servant; but I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”
Bahnar: Môis tơl Kră Yang thoi âu: Ơ! Kră Yang bơnê kơkuh kơ Ih, đơ̆ng năr brei năr mơsơ̆, mă đơ̆ng krô Ih pơma bơtho đĭch đam Ih, inh ưh tam trŏ bơngai pơma gơh hơgei, yua kơ 'bơ̆r păng hơpiĕt inh pơma arăk ưh kơ hơđăl.

English: So the LORD said to him, “Who has made man’s mouth? Or who makes the mute, the deaf, the seeing, or the blind? Have not I, the LORD?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng: Bu pơjing kơ 'bơ̆r adrĕch kon bơngai? Dah bu pơm kơmlo, pơm klĭk, pơm kơ măt hơdah păng ưh kơ bang? Hăm trŏ kơ Inh Kră Yang?

English: Now therefore, go, and I will be with your mouth and teach you what you shall say.”
Bahnar: Thoi ei, na năm bĕ; inh gô oei hơdai lăm 'bơ̆r păng bơtho ih dôm nơ̆r trŏ wă pơma.

English: But he said, “O my Lord, please send by the hand of whomever else You may send.”
Bahnar: Môis tơl khan: Ơ! Kơkuh kơ Ih Kră Yang Ih wă wơh bu năm, wơh bĕ.

English: So the anger of the LORD was kindled against Moses, and He said: “Is not Aaron the Levite your brother? I know that he can speak well. And look, he is also coming out to meet you. When he sees you, he will be glad in his heart.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ Môis na khan: Hăm trŏ Arôn bơngai Lêwi, 'nhŏng ih dah kiơ? Inh băt bơngai 'noh sư gơh pơma hơgei păng to, sư oei năm wă sơng ih; lăp sư 'bôh ih, lăm jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk dêh.

English: Now you shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth. And I will be with your mouth and with his mouth, and I will teach you what you shall do.
Bahnar: Lei na ih pơma hăm sư păng hơmet lê̆ dôm nơ̆r wă pơma lăm 'bơ̆r sư, kơplah măr iĕm pơma. Inh gô oei hơdai lăm 'bơ̆r ih păng 'bơ̆r 'nhŏng ih, bơtho iĕm dôm tơdrong kiơ wă pơm.

English: So he shall be your spokesman to the people. And he himself shall be as a mouth for you, and you shall be to him as God.
Bahnar: 'Noh boih sư gô pơma hăm kon pơlei tơplih kơ ih, yua pơm 'bơ̆r ih, na ih gô nhen thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ sư noh mơ̆n.

English: And you shall take this rod in your hand, with which you shall do the signs.”
Bahnar: Ih chĕp 'long jra 'nâu wă yua pơm tôm tơdrong hlĭch.

English: So Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law, and said to him, “Please let me go and return to my brethren who are in Egypt, and see whether they are still alive.” And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”
Bahnar: Môis wih tơ tơnei sư Jêthrô na khan: Apinh 'bă ăn kơ inh wih brŏk tơ lu 'nhŏng oh inh tơ dêh Êyiptơ, wă lăng lăng lu sư hăm oei arih ưh. Jêthrô khan hloi kơ Môis: Kon yak mă 'lơ̆ng bĕ.

English: Now the LORD said to Moses in Midian, “Go, return to Egypt; for all the men who sought your life are dead.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan hăm Môis tơ Mađian thoi âu: Wih bĕ tơ dêh Êyiptơ, yua kơ dôm lu bơngai mă chă wă pơlôch ih lôch đĭ boih.

English: Then Moses took his wife and his sons and set them on a donkey, and he returned to the land of Egypt. And Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
Bahnar: Môis sư pôk hơtŏk akăn păng kon sư tơ kơpal kơdŭ aseh iĕ, wih brŏk tơ dêh Êyiptơ. Sư chĕp ba 'long jra đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “When you go back to Egypt, see that you do all those wonders before Pharaoh which I have put in your hand. But I will harden his heart, so that he will not let the people go.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Mưh wih tơ dêh Êyiptơ, kơchăng kơ tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch Inh đei pơjao 'bơ̆t ti ih mă ih pơm 'bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn; mă-lei Inh gô pơm ăn kơ sư arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ ăn kon pơlei năm.

English: Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Israel is My son, My firstborn.
Bahnar: Lei ih roi tơbăt kơ Pharaôn: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Isơrael jơ̆ kon drŏ-nglo Inh wă khan kon kơdră Inh

English: So I say to you, let My son go that he may serve Me. But if you refuse to let him go, indeed I will kill your son, your firstborn.” ’ ”
Bahnar: mă Inh đei khan hăm ih: Ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo Inh năm, wă kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ Inh. Mưh ih ưh kơ chu ăn kơ lu sư năm. 'Nâu Inh gô pơlôch kon kơdră drŏ-nglo ih.

English: And it came to pass on the way, at the encampment, that the LORD met him and sought to kill him.
Bahnar: Kơplah oei năm rok trong, Kră Yang tơ'bơ̆p Môis tơ anih hnam đe mơdro păng wă pơlôch lê̆ sư.

English: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone and cut off the foreskin of her son and cast it at Moses’ feet, and said, “Surely you are a husband of blood to me!”
Bahnar: Sêpôra iŏk tơmo tơ noh pơm săng, kăt tơdra akar kơ kon sư păng klơ̆m lê̆ tơ ala jơ̆ng Môis na sư khan: Tơpă, ih jing klo inh đơ̆ng pham kon ba âu!

English: So He let him go. Then she said, “You are a husband of blood!”—because of the circumcision.
Bahnar: Kră Yang lê̆ klo sư arih; Kơplah noh akăn sư khan: Ih jing klo inh tơpă! Yua kơ đơ̆ng kăt tơdra akar kon ba na ih arih hiôk.

English: And the LORD said to Aaron, “Go into the wilderness to meet Moses.” So he went and met him on the mountain of God, and kissed him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Arôn thoi âu: Năm bĕ tơ char glă sơng Môis. Arôn năm hloi, tơ'bơ̆p Môis tơ kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng sư chŭm Môis.

English: So Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD who had sent him, and all the signs which He had commanded him.
Bahnar: Môis roi ăn kơ Arôn băt dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang wơh sư păng dôm tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch mă Kră Yang bơtho athei sư pơm.

English: Then Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Na Môis hăm Arôn năm hơdai tơ dêh Êyiptơ, krao akŭm dôm lu kră bơngai Isơrael.

English: And Aaron spoke all the words which the LORD had spoken to Moses. Then he did the signs in the sight of the people.
Bahnar: Arôn ră roi đĭ dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang đei pơma hăm Môis păng Môis kư̆m pơm tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei.

English: So the people believed; and when they heard that the LORD had visited the children of Israel and that He had looked on their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshiped.
Bahnar: Lu sư lui kơ nơ̆r 'noh, băt kơ Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm kon pơlei Isơrael păng 'bôh dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat lu sư; na lu sư kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh kơ Kră Yang hloi.

English: Afterward Moses and Aaron went in and told Pharaoh, “Thus says the LORD God of Israel: ‘Let My people go, that they may hold a feast to Me in the wilderness.’ ”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, Môis păng Arôn năm apinh Pharaôn khan thoi âu: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Isơrael đei khan: Ăn bĕ kon pơlei Inh năm, wă kơ lu sư năm kơkuh kơ Inh tơ char glă.

English: And Pharaoh said, “Who is the LORD, that I should obey His voice to let Israel go? I do not know the LORD, nor will I let Israel go.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pharaôn tơl: Kră Yang noh bu? Mah athei inh chu kơ nơ̆r Sư, ăn kon pơlei Isơrael năm? Inh ưh kơ băt Kră Yang ôh; kư̆m ưh kơ ăn kon pơlei năm mơ̆n.

English: So they said, “The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Please, let us go three days’ journey into the desert and sacrifice to the LORD our God, lest He fall upon us with pestilence or with the sword.”
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Hêbrơ đei tơ'bôh kơ lu nhôn. Na dang ei apinh ih ăn kơ lu nhôn lĕch năm tơ char glă, ataih dang pêng năr kơ trong, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, dah ưh kơnh hli kơ Kră Yang pơm kơ nhôn lôch hơbuh dah lôch kơ đao

English: Then the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you take the people from their work? Get back to your labor.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao dêh Êyiptơ khan kơ lu sư: Ơ Môis păng Arôn, liơ mă măr iĕm pơtơm kon pơlei achăng hŭt lê̆ tơdrong jang lu sư thoi noh? Iĕm jah năm jang tơdrong jang iĕm kơdih đĕch!

English: And Pharaoh said, “Look, the people of the land are many now, and you make them rest from their labor!”
Bahnar: Pharaôn khan: Kon pơlei lăm dêh char dang ei kơdrâ̆m lơ dêh, na măr iĕm pơgăn pơm kơ lu sư pơdơh kơ jang hă!

English: So the same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people and their officers, saying
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Pharaôn tơtă nơ̆r, kơ lu bơngai Êyiptơ mă wei-lăng tơdrong jang păng lu bơngai Isơrael mă tơrô̆ bơngai jang thoi âu

English: “You shall no longer give the people straw to make brick as before. Let them go and gather straw for themselves.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ pă asong kon pơlei hơnong 'ba pơm gŏch thoi lĕ adrol ki dơ̆ng hŏ; lê̆ lu sư năm chă kơdih.

English: And you shall lay on them the quota of bricks which they made before. You shall not reduce it. For they are idle; therefore they cry out, saying, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm athei hơgăt pơm mă tôm dôm kơsô̆ thoi so, 'nĕ kơ tơjur hơtŭch kơ so; yua kơ lu sư alah dêh, lu sư chă đon krao ôr khan: Bĕ bơ̆n! Năm pơyơ̆r kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n.

English: Let more work be laid on the men, that they may labor in it, and let them not regard false words.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm tơpŭ ăn tơdrong jang trăp kơ lu sư wă kơ lu sư jang hrat na ưh pă 'blŏk nơ̆r pơma hơlĕnh dơ̆ng.

English: And the taskmasters of the people and their officers went out and spoke to the people, saying, “Thus says Pharaoh: ‘I will not give you straw.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei-lăng păng lu bơngai tơrô̆ tơdrong jang sư lĕch năm pơma hăm kon pơlei pơla khan: Pharaôn đei khan: Inh ưh pă ăn kơ lu iĕm hơnong 'ba dơ̆ng

English: Go, get yourselves straw where you can find it; yet none of your work will be reduced.’ ”
Bahnar: lu iĕm năm chă kơdih hơnong đei tơ yơ iĕm năm tơ noh; mă-lei ưh kơ gơh tơjur hơtuch lê̆ tơdrong jang lu iĕm ôh.

English: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, kon pơlei năm chă hơnong jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Êyiptơ, lu sư wă dônh akŭm tơm 'ba tơplih kơ hơnong 'ba.

English: And the taskmasters forced them to hurry, saying, “Fulfill your work, your daily quota, as when there was straw.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei-lăng gơnhĕk khan: Jang mă keh tơdrong jang lu iĕm, tôm thoi hơgăt, năr ayơ keh tôm năr 'noh, kư̆m thoi kơplah mă oei đei asong iĕm hơnong 'ba.

English: Also the officers of the children of Israel, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten and were asked, “Why have you not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and today, as before?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael mă jang lăm khŭl wei-lăng tơrô̆ kon pơlei Isơrael, đe teh lu sư păng hil khan: Liơ năr brei păng năr 'nâu, lu iĕm ưh kơ jang keh mă đêl hơgăt kơ iĕm man gŏch dôm thoi lĕ adrol ki?

English: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried out to Pharaoh, saying, “Why are you dealing thus with your servants?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael bơ̆jang tơrô̆ lăng lăm kon pơlei Isơrael, lu sư năm ôr krao tơ Pharaôn: Liơ pơtao pơm kơ lu đĭch đam ih thoi noh?

English: There is no straw given to your servants, and they say to us, ‘Make brick!’ And indeed your servants are beaten, but the fault is in your own people.”
Bahnar: Đe ưh pă asong lu nhôn hơnong 'ba, na hrăn athei lu nhôn: Iĕm pơm gŏch bĕ! Lu nhôn 'nâu đĭch đam ih; đe teh tôn, ưh kơ brĕ đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla ih 'mơ̆i.

English: But he said, “You are idle! Idle! Therefore you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to the LORD.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao tơl: Lu iĕm bơngai răm alah, lu bơngai alah! Na hrăn apinh. Ăn kơ lu nhôn năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang!

English: Therefore go now and work; for no straw shall be given you, yet you shall deliver the quota of bricks.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei kư̆ kơ năm jang bĕ, đe ưh kơ đei asong hơnong 'ba ôh, mă-lei lu iĕm pơjao gŏch mă tôm 'long đêl hơgăt.

English: And the officers of the children of Israel saw that they were in trouble after it was said, “You shall not reduce any bricks from your daily quota.”
Bahnar: Lei na, lu bơngai Isơrael bơ̆jang tơrô̆ lăm kon pơlei Isơrael, lu sư hơwơ̆l hơwang, yua kơ đe khan kơ lu sư: Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh tơjur hơtŭch 'long gŏch hơgăt ăn kơ iĕm jang năr ayơ athei keh tôm năr 'noh.

English: Then, as they came out from Pharaoh, they met Moses and Aaron who stood there to meet them.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng Pharaôn na lu sư tơ'bơ̆p Môis păng Arôn oei gô 'bơ̆t noh

English: And they said to them, “Let the LORD look on you and judge, because you have made us abhorrent in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to kill us.”
Bahnar: na khan; “măr iĕm pơm kiơ kơ lu nhôn. Apinh Kră Yang lăng păng phak măr iĕm. Yua kơ kiơ măr iĕm ăn kơ Pharaôn păng linh bơ̆jang kơ sư hil areh kơ lu nhôn, thoi ăn đao gưm lăm ti lu sư wă kơ pơlôch lu nhôn.”

English: So Moses returned to the LORD and said, “Lord, why have You brought trouble on this people? Why is it You have sent me?
Bahnar: Môis wih dơ̆ng tơ Kră Yang păng khan: “Bơnê kơkuh kơ Ih, ơ Kră Yang yua kơ kiơ Ih ăn đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ kon pơlei 'nâu? Yua kơ kiơ Ih wơh inh năm lĕ?

English: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has done evil to this people; neither have You delivered Your people at all.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr inh năm tơ'bơ̆p Pharaôn wă yua anăn Ih na pơma, sư rai pơm kơnê̆ kơ kon pơlei âu, mă-lei Ih ưh kơ wă dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei Ih.”

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh. For with a strong hand he will let them go, and with a strong hand he will drive them out of his land.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơma hăm Môis khan: Dang ei ih gô 'bôh dôm tơdrong Inh wă pơm kơ Pharaôn; yua đơ̆ng ti mơsêh mơyang Inh athei pơtao 'noh sư gô achăng kon pơlei păng puh tơlĕch hloi kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh sư.

English: And God spoke to Moses and said to him: “I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma dơ̆ng hăm Môis khan: Inh boih Kră Yang iĕm.

English: I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty, but by My name LORD I was not known to them.
Bahnar: Inh pơdah tơ'bôh ăn kơ Abraham kơ Isăk păng Jakôp, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh mơyang;a mă-lei Anăn Inh Kră Yang,b Inh ưh tam đei layơ tơbăt kơ lu sư.

English: I have also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, in which they were strangers.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m pơsĭt tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư, wă ăn kơ lu sư dêh Kanaan, mă dêh lu sư wă oei tơ noh thoi lĕ lu bơngai tơmoi.

English: And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r krao ôr pơmat-tat đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng bơngai Êyiptơ rôp pơgŏ pơm đĭch păng Inh 'blŏk kơ tơdrong Inh pơgơ̆p.

English: Therefore say to the children of Israel: ‘I am the LORD; I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, I will rescue you from their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with great judgments.
Bahnar: Na ih khan bĕ hăm kon pơlei Isơrael: Inh boih Kră Yang, Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm rơngei đơ̆ng tơdrong jang gleh pơmat Inh gô dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng pơm đĭch đam Inh gô chro tơpang ti mơsêh mơyang Inh, wă phak bơngai Êyiptơ mă trăp.

English: I will take you as My people, and I will be your God. Then you shall know that I am the LORD your God who brings you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk lu iĕm pơm kon pơlei Inh păng Inh gô pơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm; lu iĕm gô băt kơ Inh jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, pơklaih rơngei lu iĕm đơ̆ng pơm đĭch đam kơ lu bơngai Êyiptơ.

English: And I will bring you into the land which I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and I will give it to you as a heritage: I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô chông ba lu iĕm mơ̆t lăm dêh mă Inh pơkă wă ăn kơ Abraham, kơ Isăk păng Jakôp inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm dêh 'noh wă kơ jang sa, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: So Moses spoke thus to the children of Israel; but they did not heed Moses, because of anguish of spirit and cruel bondage.
Bahnar: Môis pơma khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi noh; mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Môis ôh yua kơ lu sư ơh sơ'ngon kơtơ̆ng đĭch đam pơmat-tat dêh tơpă.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Go in, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the children of Israel go out of his land.”
Bahnar: Năm mơ̆t tơ'bơ̆p roi bĕ kơ Pharaôn, pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, wă kơ sư ăn kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh sư.

English: And Moses spoke before the LORD, saying, “The children of Israel have not heeded me. How then shall Pharaoh heed me, for I am of uncircumcised lips?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis tơl Kră Yang: Inh âu minh 'nu bơngai 'bơ̆r pơma sa ưh kơ hlôh wao; kon pơlei Isơrael ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh pơma kơ Pharaôn sư dai ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh ôh?

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, and gave them a command for the children of Israel and for Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơma khan kơ Môis păng Arôn. Inh pơjao ăn kơ măr iĕm năm truh tơ kon pơlei Isơrael păng Pharaôn, pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, wă chông anhăk kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: These are the heads of their fathers’ houses: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi. These are the families of Reuben.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung kon pơlei Isơrael: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Rubên, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră Isơrael, Hanok, Palu, Hêsrôn păng Karmi. 'Noh boih lu adrĕch adrung Rubên.

English: And the sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman. These are the families of Simeon.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Simêôn, Jêmuel, Jamin, Ôhat, Jakin, Sôhar păng Sul kon mă akăn đơ̆ng Kanaan. 'Noh boih lu adrĕch adrung Simêôn.

English: These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. And the years of the life of Levi were one hundred and thirty-seven.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi, kiơ̆ lăm adrĕch lu sư: Gersôn, Kôhat păng Mêrari. Lêwi arih sot đei minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơpơh sơnăm.

English: The sons of Gershon were Libni and Shimi according to their families.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Gersôn kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch lu sư kơdih Lipni păng Simei. Kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch lu sư.

English: And the sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were one hundred and thirty-three.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Kôhat. Amram, Ishar, Hêbrôn păng Usiêl. Kôhat arih sot đei minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt pêng sơnăm.

English: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of Levi according to their generations.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari: Mali păng Musi. 'Noh boih lu adrĕch Lêwi, kiơ̆ lu adrĕch adrung lu sư.

English: Now Amram took for himself Jochebed, his father’s sister, as wife; and she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were one hundred and thirty-seven.
Bahnar: Na, Amram iŏk akăn anăn Jôkêbêt, duch sư kơdih, pơm akăn; duch ei tơpŭ kơ sư Arôn păng Môis. Amram arih sot đei minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơpơh sơnăm.

English: The sons of Izhar were Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Ishar: Kôrê, Nêphek păng Sikri.

English: And the sons of Uzziel were Mishael, Elzaphan, and Zithri.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Usiêl: Misael, Êlsaphan păng Sihri.

English: Aaron took to himself Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Nahshon, as wife; and she bore him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Bahnar: Arôn oei kơ Êlisêba, kon drŏ-kăn Aminađap, oh Nahasôn; duch ei tơpŭ kơ sư Nađap, Abihu, Êlêasar păng Ithamar.

English: And the sons of Korah were Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These are the families of the Korahites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Kôrê: Assir, Êlkana păng Abiasap 'noh boih lu adrĕch Kôrê.

English: Eleazar, Aaron’s son, took for himself one of the daughters of Putiel as wife; and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites according to their families.
Bahnar: Êlêasar, kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, oei kơ kon adruh Phutiel; duch ei tơpŭ kơ sư Phinêhas. 'Noh boih lu kơdră lăm khŭl adrĕch bơngai Lêwi, kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư.

English: These are the same Aaron and Moses to whom the LORD said, “Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch, Arôn păng Môis, wă khan bơngai mă Kră Yang bơtho khan: Athei chông anhăk kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: These are the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are the same Moses and Aaron.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn bre sư năm tơ'bơ̆p Pharaôn, pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, wă chông anhăk kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And it came to pass, on the day the LORD spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă Kră Yang pơma hăm Môis tơ dêh Êyiptơ

English: that the LORD spoke to Moses, saying, “I am the LORD. Speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say to you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Inh boih Kră Yang, năm khan bĕ kơ Pharaôn pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, đĭ-đăng dôm nơ̆r Inh gô pơma hăm ih.

English: But Moses said before the LORD, “Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh heed me?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis tơl Kră Yang khan: Inh âu bơngai 'bơ̆r ưh kơ hon đon ưh kơ hơgei: Liơ Pharaôn 'maih mơ̆ng inh?

English: So the LORD said to Moses: “See, I have made you as God to Pharaoh, and Aaron your brother shall be your prophet.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơma hăm Môis khan: Lăng, Inh pôk ih nhen thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ Pharaôn, na Arôn 'nhŏng ih gô thoi bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ăn kơ ih.

English: You shall speak all that I command you. And Aaron your brother shall tell Pharaoh to send the children of Israel out of his land.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơma dôm nơ̆r Inh đei tơtă kơ ih, na Arôn, 'nhŏng ih sư gô năm apinh Pharaôn, wă kơ sư achăng lê̆ kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh sư.

English: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply My signs and My wonders in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ Pharaôn jơhngơ̆m arăng ưh kơ chu păng Inh pơthim lơ tơdra mơsêh hlĭch chrơp Inh tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: But Pharaoh will not heed you, so that I may lay My hand on Egypt and bring My armies and My people, the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pharaôn ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng ih ôh; Inh gô yơ̆r ti dan kơpal teh Êyiptơ, yua lơ tơdrong phak tih, wă iŏk tơlĕch lu khŭl linh Inh, lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I stretch out My hand on Egypt and bring out the children of Israel from among them.”
Bahnar: Layơ mă Inh pơm kơ dêh Êyiptơ păng dui iŏk kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei Êyiptơ, lei lu sư gô băt kơ Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Then Moses and Aaron did so; just as the LORD commanded them, so they did.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn pơm kiơ̆ lei-lăi thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă kơ bre sư.

English: And Moses was eighty years old and Aaron eighty-three years old when they spoke to Pharaoh.
Bahnar: Kơplah, bre sư năm apinh Pharaôn, noh Môis đei tơhngam-jĭt sơnăm păng Arôn tơhngam-jĭt pêng sơnăm.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “When Pharaoh speaks to you, saying, ‘Show a miracle for yourselves,’ then you shall say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod and cast it before Pharaoh, and let it become a serpent.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah Pharaôn athei măr iĕm pơm tơdrong mơsêh iĕm; ih athei khan kơ Arôn: 'Nhŏng ih athei iŏk 'long jra, klơ̆m 'bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn, 'long jra 'noh gô jing minh dăng 'bih.

English: So Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh, and they did so, just as the LORD commanded. And Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
Bahnar: Na, Môis păng Arôn năm 'bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn păng pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă boih. Arôn klơ̆m 'long jra sư 'bơ̆t anăp măt Pharaôn păng lu đam sư, 'long jra noh jing minh dăng 'bih.

English: But Pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers; so the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their enchantments.
Bahnar: Na Pharaôn krao hloi lu 'bok hơgei păng 'bok pơjâu; lu bơngai gơh pơm tơwir lăm char Êyiptơ kư̆m pơm lei-lăi thoi lu sư gơh tơwir.

English: For every man threw down his rod, and they became serpents. But Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu lu sư klơ̆m 'long jra tă kơ jing 'bih ngăl; mă-lei 'long jra Arôn luăn lê̆ đĭ 'long jra lu sư.

English: And Pharaoh’s heart grew hard, and he did not heed them, as the LORD had said.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ră mă-lei jơhngơ̆m Pharaôn oei ưh kơ chu, ưh kơ mơ̆ng Môis păng Arôn, lei-lăi thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan lê̆ adrol.

English: So the LORD said to Moses: “Pharaoh’s heart is hard; he refuses to let the people go.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Pharaôn arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ chu ăn kon pơlei năm.

English: Go to Pharaoh in the morning, when he goes out to the water, and you shall stand by the river’s bank to meet him; and the rod which was turned to a serpent you shall take in your hand.
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning Pharaôn sư gô lĕch ngôi tơ đak krong, ih athei năm 'bơ̆t anăp sư tơ cheng đak krong păng chĕp ba 'long jra mă jing 'bih noh.

English: And you shall say to him, ‘The LORD God of the Hebrews has sent me to you, saying, “Let My people go, that they may serve Me in the wilderness”; but indeed, until now you would not hear!
Bahnar: Ih athei tơbăt kơ sư: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Hêbrơ, wơh inh năm tơ ih, khan thoi âu: Athei achăng ăn kon pơlei Inh năm, wă kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ Inh tơ tơmăn glă; na truh dang ei ih ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng Inh hơya tŏ sĕt.

English: Thus says the LORD: “By this you shall know that I am the LORD. Behold, I will strike the waters which are in the river with the rod that is in my hand, and they shall be turned to blood.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Đơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu, ih gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang: Na iŏk 'long jra Inh teh tơ đak krong Nil, đak krong gô jing pham.

English: And the fish that are in the river shall die, the river shall stink, and the Egyptians will loathe to drink the water of the river.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Ka lăm đak krong Nil gô lôch păng đak krong gô 'bâu ôm, bơngai Êyiptơ ưh kơ pơ̆n nhă đak noh.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt, over their streams, over their rivers, over their ponds, and over all their pools of water, that they may become blood. And there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in buckets of wood and pitchers of stone.’ ”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, athei Arôn, iŏk 'long jra ih bĕ, yơ̆r ti ih tơ kơpal đak glung tih, tơ đak krong iĕ, đak dơnâu jơ̆p kơ anih đei đak lăm dêh Êyiptơ wă kơ đak jing pham ngăl; jơ̆p-jang lăm get mong đak sư pơm hăm 'long, hăm tơmo, kư̆m gô đei pham đĭ-đăng.

English: And Moses and Aaron did so, just as the LORD commanded. So he lifted up the rod and struck the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his servants. And all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
Bahnar: Na, Môis păng Arôn pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă ăn kơ bre sư. 'Bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn păng đam sư; Arôn hiŏng 'long jra tơ kơpal na teh đak krong Nil na đak krong Nil jing pham hloi.

English: The fish that were in the river died, the river stank, and the Egyptians could not drink the water of the river. So there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Ka lăm đak krong Nil lôch đĭ-đăng, đak krong jing 'bâu ôm, lu bơngai Êyiptơ ưh kơ gơh nhă; đei pham tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ đak lăm dêh Êyiptơ hloi.

English: Then the magicians of Egypt did so with their enchantments; and Pharaoh’s heart grew hard, and he did not heed them, as the LORD had said.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu 'bok pơjâu tơwir bơngai Êyiptơ kư̆m gơh pơm tơwir lei-lăi thoi noh, na jơhngơ̆m Pharaôn, oei arăng ưh kơ chu, ưh kơ mơ̆ng Môis păng Arôn tŏ sĕt, trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan.

English: And Pharaoh turned and went into his house. Neither was his heart moved by this.
Bahnar: Pharaôn wih brŏk tơ hnam sư jơhngơ̆m sư ưh kơ đei hiơ̆k tơchĕng kiơ kơ tơdrong noh.

English: So all the Egyptians dug all around the river for water to drink, because they could not drink the water of the river.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Êyiptơ ưh kơ gơh nhă đak krong Nil noh, na lu sư sir 'bơ̆t cheng đak krong wă kơ đei đak gơh nhă.

English: And seven days passed after the LORD had struck the river.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dang tơpơh năr.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Năm tơ'bơ̆p bĕ Pharaôn păng roi tơbăt kơ sư, Kră Yang đei khan thoi âu: Athei achăng kon pơlei inh năm, wă kơ lu sư awih awăn kơkuh kơ inh.

English: But if you refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all your territory with frogs.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih ưh kơ achăng lu sư năm lei inh gô ăn tơdrong truh đei kit tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: So the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into your house, into your bedroom, on your bed, into the houses of your servants, on your people, into your ovens, and into your kneading bowls.
Bahnar: Tơ đak krong Nil gô 'bĕnh kơ kit, lu kit gô mơmŏ mơ̆t lăm hnam pơtao tơ anih bơ̆jang, anih tep păng tŏk kơpal giơng ih, mơ̆t hloi lăm hnam đĭch đam păng kon pơlei ih, lăm anih gŏ, lăm kơthŭng ih jrâu tơpŭng pơm 'bĕng.

English: And the frogs shall come up on you, on your people, and on all your servants.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kit ei gô mơmŏ tŏk tơ akâu ih, akâu kon pơlei păng rim 'nu kơ đĭch đam ih.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your hand with your rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.’ ”
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Khan bĕ kơ Arôn: Athei chĕp 'long jra yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal thong đak tih iĕ, đak dơnâu, wă kơ kit tŏk đơ̆ng noh năm tơ jơ̆p kơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: So Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Na, Arôn yơ̆r ti sư tơklă đak krong dêh Êyiptơ, kit tih iĕ mơmŏ tŏk lanh 'bĕnh jơ̆p-jang hloi dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And the magicians did so with their enchantments, and brought up frogs on the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơjâu tơwir kư̆m pơm lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n, wă pơm kơ kit tih iĕ mơmŏ tŏk jơ̆p kơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Entreat the LORD that He may take away the frogs from me and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice to the LORD.”
Bahnar: Pharaôn krao hloi Môis păng Arôn na khan: Krao khan bĕ kơ Kră Yang wă kơ Sư puh kit weh đơ̆ng inh păng đơ̆ng kon pơlei inh; na inh gô achăng kon pơlei Hêbrơ năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: And Moses said to Pharaoh, “Accept the honor of saying when I shall intercede for you, for your servants, and for your people, to destroy the frogs from you and your houses, that they may remain in the river only.”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Pharaôn: Apinh ih đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk tơbăt ăn kơ inh layơ ih wă kơ kit weh đơ̆ng ih đơ̆ng hnam ih đơ̆ng đĭch đam hăm đơ̆ng kon pơlei ih, na inh krao khan apinh Kră Yang wă kơplah noh kit lôch đĭ păng oei pă lăm đak krong đĕch.

English: So he said, “Tomorrow.” And he said, “Let it be according to your word, that you may know that there is no one like the LORD our God.
Bahnar: Pơtao tơl khan: Năr dơning, Môis khan: Lei ăn kơ nơ̆r ih pơma noh jing thoi noh, wă kơ ih băt ưh kơ đei bơngai bu thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.

English: And the frogs shall depart from you, from your houses, from your servants, and from your people. They shall remain in the river only.”
Bahnar: Na kit gô weh đơ̆ng ih, đơ̆ng hnam ih, đơ̆ng đĭch đam hăm đơ̆ng kon pơlei ih; lu sư oei pă tơ lăm đak krong Nil đĕch.

English: Then Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh. And Moses cried out to the LORD concerning the frogs which He had brought against Pharaoh.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn lĕch đơ̆ng Pharaôn; Môis krao apinh Kră Yang kơ tơdrong kit mă sư đei pơkă boih kơ Pharaôn.

English: So the LORD did according to the word of Moses. And the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courtyards, and out of the fields.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm lei-lăi thoi nơ̆r Môis apinh; kit tih iĕ đơ̆ng lăm hnam lăm pơlei, tơ bri, mir tơ 'nguaih lôch đĭ-đăng.

English: They gathered them together in heaps, and the land stank.
Bahnar: Lu đe dônh akŭm kit tih iĕ hơlôk hơlak thoi pôi tih păng 'bâu ôm jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh sư.

English: But when Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he hardened his heart and did not heed them, as the LORD had said.
Bahnar: Na Pharaôn lăp sư 'bôh tơdrong truh hlôi boih, sư arăng jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ chu dơ̆ng, ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Môis păng Arôn, lei-lăi thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan boih.

English: So the LORD said to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your rod, and strike the dust of the land, so that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Athei Arôn: Yơ̆r bĕ 'long jra ih, tôn tơteh: Wă kơ 'mui teh noh jing sơmĕch jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And they did so. For Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod and struck the dust of the earth, and it became lice on man and beast. All the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu bre sư pơm thoi noh. Na Arôn chĕp 'long jra yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal tôn tơ teh, 'mui teh jing hloi sơmĕch, kôp 'bĕnh-'bang kơ bơngai păng sem dơrong; đĭ-đăng 'mui teh jing kon sơmĕch ngăl jơ̆p lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Now the magicians so worked with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not. So there were lice on man and beast.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơjâu kư̆m 'maih tơwir pơm lei-lăi, wă kơ 'mui teh jing kon sơmĕch, mă-lei lu sư pơm ưh kơ gơh, na sơmĕch 'bĕnh kơ bơngai păng sem dơrong lu sư.

English: Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, “This is the finger of God.” But Pharaoh’s heart grew hard, and he did not heed them, just as the LORD had said.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơjâu khan kơ Pharaôn, 'Nâu boih hơnglâu ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; mă-lei Pharaôn oei arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ chu, ưh kơ mơ̆ng Môis păng Arôn thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan boih.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Rise early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh as he comes out to the water. Then say to him, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, Pharaôn sư gô lĕch ngôi jê̆ đak krong, ih athei iung mă hrôih năm tơ'bơ̆p sư na roi tơbăt ăn kơ sư, Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ăn kon pơlei inh năm, wă kơ lu sư gơh kơkuh kơ inh.

English: Or else, if you will not let My people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies on you and your servants, on your people and into your houses. The houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground on which they stand.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih ưh kơ achăng ăn lu sư năm, lei Inh gô ăn roi wŏng truh lơ iam tơ ih, tơ đĭch đam ih, tơ kon pơlei păng tơ lăm hnam ih; tơ hnam bơngai Êyiptơ, roi wŏng iam 'bĕnh-'bang, jơ̆p-jang kơpal teh hloi.

English: And in that day I will set apart the land of Goshen, in which My people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there, in order that you may know that I am the LORD in the midst of the land.
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr noh, lăm tơring Gôsen, anih kon pơlei Inh oei, ưh kơ đei roi wŏng iam, wă kơ ih băt kơ Inh, Kră Yang oei lăm dêh 'nâu.

English: I will make a difference between My people and your people. Tomorrow this sign shall be.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lei Inh gô klah kon pơlei Inh hăm kon pơlei ih pha. Truh năr dơning, tơdra hlĭch 'nâu gô đei.

English: And the LORD did so. Thick swarms of flies came into the house of Pharaoh, into his servants’ houses, and into all the land of Egypt. The land was corrupted because of the swarms of flies.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm thoi nơ̆r Sư, Đei roi wŏng lơlap mơ̆t 'bĕnh lăm hnam Pharaôn, lăm hnam dơnŏ đĭch đam sư, roi wŏng kăp pơrăm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Go, sacrifice to your God in the land.”
Bahnar: Pharaôn krao hloi Môis păng Arôn na khan: Năm bĕ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm tơ lăm dêh âu

English: And Moses said, “It is not right to do so, for we would be sacrificing the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God. If we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, then will they not stone us?
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis khan: Pơm thoi noh ưh kơ gơh ôh; yua kơ dôm tơmam soi mă lu nhôn wă soi pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn jing minh tơdrong krưp dêh kơ bơngai Êyiptơ. Tơdah lu nhôn pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sơmah mă lu sư areh. Hăm trŏ lu sư gô klơ̆m nhôn hăm tơmo?

English: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness and sacrifice to the LORD our God as He will command us.”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn athei năm tơ char glă, dang pêng năr kơ trong, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sơmah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Sư gô bơtho tơ'bôh tơtă kơ lu nhôn.

English: So Pharaoh said, “I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only you shall not go very far away. Intercede for me.”
Bahnar: Pharaôn khan: Inh gô ăn lu iĕm năm, wă kơ iĕm năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sơmah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, tơ char glă, mă-lei lu iĕm 'nĕ năm ataih hloh kơ noh. Krao khan bĕ kơ inh hai!

English: Then Moses said, “Indeed I am going out from you, and I will entreat the LORD, that the swarms of flies may depart tomorrow from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. But let Pharaoh not deal deceitfully anymore in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.”
Bahnar: Môis drơ̆ng khan: Inh gô krao khan apinh Kră Yang tơgŭm ih; dơning roi wŏng gô weh ataih đơ̆ng ih, đơ̆ng đĭch đam ih păng kon pơlei lu iĕm. Mă-lei apinh ih, 'Nĕ pă hơlĕnh kơ lu nhôn dơ̆ng, na ưh kơ ăn kon pơlei nhôn năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sơmah kơ Kră Yang nhôn.

English: So Moses went out from Pharaoh and entreated the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis lĕch hloi đơ̆ng Pharaôn păng Krao khan kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; He removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. Not one remained.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm lei-lăi thoi nơ̆r Môis apinh, na roi wŏng weh ataih hloi đơ̆ng Pharaôn, đơ̆ng đĭch đam păng đơ̆ng kon pơlei sư, ưh pă đei minh pôm dơ̆ng.

English: But Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also; neither would he let the people go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pharaôn oei arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ chu dơ̆ng mơ̆n, ưh kơ ăn kon pơlei năm ôh.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh and tell him, ‘Thus says the LORD God of the Hebrews: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, năm bĕ tơ Pharaôn tơbăt kơ sư, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Hêbrơ, đei khan: Achăng bĕ lê̆ kon pơlei Inh năm, wă kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ Inh

English: For if you refuse to let them go, and still hold them
Bahnar: Tơdah ih ưh kơ ăn năm, oei pơkơ̆ng lu sư.

English: behold, the hand of the LORD will be on your cattle in the field, on the horses, on the donkeys, on the camels, on the oxen, and on the sheep—a very severe pestilence.
Bahnar: Lei ti mơsêh Kră Yang gô pơm kơ lu sem dơrong ih oei tơ tơmăn glă, pơm kơ aseh, aseh iĕ, lăk-đa, rơmo, bơbe păng triu: Gô lôch kơ toi.

English: And the LORD will make a difference between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt. So nothing shall die of all that belongs to the children of Israel.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô klah lê̆, sem dơrong lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei minh pôm lôch kơ toi, sem dơrong lu bơngai Êyiptơ đei lôch kơ toi đĭ.

English: Then the LORD appointed a set time, saying, “Tomorrow the LORD will do this thing in the land.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Truh năr dơning, Kră Yang gô pơm tơdrong 'noh tơ lăm char.

English: So the LORD did this thing on the next day, and all the livestock of Egypt died; but of the livestock of the children of Israel, not one died.
Bahnar: Lăp truh năr dơning, na Kră Yang pơm tơdrong 'noh; đĭ-đăng sem dơrong lu bơngai Êyiptơ lôch ngăl; mă-lei lu sem dơrong lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei lôch minh pôm.

English: Then Pharaoh sent, and indeed, not even one of the livestock of the Israelites was dead. But the heart of Pharaoh became hard, and he did not let the people go.
Bahnar: Na Pharaôn wơh bơngai năm lăng, 'bôh ưh kơ đei minh pôm sem dơrong, lu bơngai Isơrael lôch ôh. Mă-lei Pharaôn oei arăng kơ̆l, ưh kơ chu ăn kon pơlei năm.

English: So the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “Take for yourselves handfuls of ashes from a furnace, and let Moses scatter it toward the heavens in the sight of Pharaoh.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn, Athei chup tơnuh ŭnh 'bĕnh tơpang ti măr iĕm, na Môis gô săi pơđông tơnuh ŭnh 'noh tơ kơpal plĕnh. 'Bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn.

English: And it will become fine dust in all the land of Egypt, and it will cause boils that break out in sores on man and beast throughout all the land of Egypt.”
Bahnar: Tơnuh ŭnh gô jing 'mui păr jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Êyiptơ păng pơtôch pơchah đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai păng sem dơrong jơ̆p-jang lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Then they took ashes from the furnace and stood before Pharaoh, and Moses scattered them toward heaven. And they caused boils that break out in sores on man and beast.
Bahnar: Na bre sư chup tơnuh đơ̆ng tơnuh ŭnh, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn, Môis săi tơnuh ŭnh tơ kơpal, jing pơtôch pơchah lĕch đak đuh đơ̆ng akâu bơngai păng sem dơrong lu sư.

English: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils, for the boils were on the magicians and on all the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơjâu yua kơ pơtôch đuh lĕch ưh kơ gơh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Môis yua kơ lu bơngai pơjâu kư̆m đei pơtôch lei-lăi thoi đĭ-đăng bơngai Êyiptơ.

English: But the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh; and he did not heed them, just as the LORD had spoken to Moses.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm kơ Pharaôn, arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ chu mơ̆ng Môis păng Arôn. Trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan bơih kơ Môis.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Rise early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘Thus says the LORD God of the Hebrews: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, ih athei iung mă hrôih năm tơ'bơ̆p Pharaôn na khan kơ sư: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Hêbrơ, đei khan: Athei achăng lê̆ kon pơlei Inh năm, wă kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ inh

English: for at this time I will send all My plagues to your very heart, and on your servants and on your people, that you may know that there is none like Me in all the earth.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t jơ 'nâu, Inh gô tuh tơdrong pơmat jĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m ih đĭch đam ih; păng kon pơlei ih, wă kơ ih băt, jơ̆p kơ teh đak ưh kơ đei bu thoi Inh.

English: Now if I had stretched out My hand and struck you and your people with pestilence, then you would have been cut off from the earth.
Bahnar: Tơdah, Inh yơ̆r ti, teh tôn ih kon pơlei ih hăm tơdrong jĭ apoh, lôch hiong đĭ-đăng lăm teh âu.

English: But indeed for this purpose I have raised you up, that I may show My power in you, and that My name may be declared in all the earth.
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ tơdrong 'nâu Inh rong ih arih wă kơ ih 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh Inh, wă kơ anăn Inh đei ră roi kơtơ̆ng ư-ang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.

English: As yet you exalt yourself against My people in that you will not let them go.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih oei pơang wă pơgăn, ưh kơ ăn kon pơlei inh năm

English: Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause very heavy hail to rain down, such as has not been in Egypt since its founding until now.
Bahnar: Lei dơning trŏ jơ 'nâu, inh gô ăn plĕnh đei 'mi prĕl tih, lăm dêh Êyiptơ mă đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei ưh tam mă đei 'mi prĕl tih lei-lăi thoi năr noh.

English: Therefore send now and gather your livestock and all that you have in the field, for the hail shall come down on every man and every animal which is found in the field and is not brought home; and they shall die.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lei na mă tĕnh dang ei athei bơngai năm dui puh akŭm sem dơrong ih păng đĭ-đăng lu tơmam ih đei đơ̆ng mir chŭn wih tơ hnam wă huay truh kơ sư. Yua kơ 'mi prĕl gô jruh huŏng 'bơm bơngai păng sem dơrong tơ tơmăn glă tơ mir noh tơdah ưh kơ đei bu puh brŏk tơ hnam lei lu sư gô lôch đĭ.

English: He who feared the word of the LORD among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his livestock flee to the houses.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ Pharaôn đei jơhngơ̆m hli kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan, lu sư hăt hot puh đĭch đam athei puh sem dơrong rơmo, triu sư wih tơ hnam

English: But he who did not regard the word of the LORD left his servants and his livestock in the field.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei lu bơngai mơ'nah ưh kơ hiơ̆k ôh kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan, lê̆ lu đĭch đam păng sem dơrong lu sư oei tơ bri tơ mir tơ tơmăn glă noh.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt—on man, on beast, and on every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, athei yơ̆r ti ih tơ plĕnh, wă kơ 'mi prĕl đơ̆ng kơpal jruh jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Êyiptơ, 'bơm tơ akâu bơngai 'bơm tơ sem dơrong păng đĭ-đăng hla 'nhot sa mă đe pơtăm tơ mir mă tơ jơ̆p-jang dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And Moses stretched out his rod toward heaven; and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and fire darted to the ground. And the LORD rained hail on the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Na Môis yơ̆r hloi 'long jra sư tơ plĕnh, Kră Yang ăn đei grơ̆m glaih 'mi prĕl jruh, glaih taih jơ̆p kơpal teh. Na Kră Yang ăn plĕnh 'mi prĕl jruh jơ̆p kơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, so very heavy that there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
Bahnar: Đei 'mi prĕl jruh tih tơpă păng glaih taih rŏng anăp, kư̆m dêh, đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ tơ dang ei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ tam mă đei tơdrong truh thoi noh.

English: And the hail struck throughout the whole land of Egypt, all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail struck every herb of the field and broke every tree of the field.
Bahnar: Prĕl jruh jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Êyiptơ 'mi prĕl pơrăm đĭ sem dơrong tơmam tơ tơmăn glă, 'bơm kon bơngai, 'bơm sem dơrong, 'bơm 'nhot sa, lăm mir păng kư̆m 'bơm truh tơ đĭ-đăng lu 'long păk tơgơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, there was no hail.
Bahnar: Lăp pă minh tơring Gôsen đĕch anih kon pơlei Isơrael oei mă ưh kơ đei 'mi prĕl truh tơ noh.

English: And Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “I have sinned this time. The LORD is righteous, and my people and I are wicked.
Bahnar: Pharaôn wơh đe krao hloi Môis păng Arôn khan: Wơ̆t 'nâu inh yoch boih; Kră Yang jơ̆ Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; inh păng kon pơlei inh yoch tơpă.

English: Entreat the LORD, that there may be no more mighty thundering and hail, for it is enough. I will let you go, and you shall stay no longer.”
Bahnar: Krao khan bĕ kơ Kră Yang, wă kơ jah huay kơ grơ̆m glaih păng 'mi prĕl; na inh gô lê̆ lu iĕm năm, ưh pă gô đunh dơ̆ng boih.

English: So Moses said to him, “As soon as I have gone out of the city, I will spread out my hands to the LORD; the thunder will cease, and there will be no more hail, that you may know that the earth is the LORD’s.
Bahnar: Môis tơl khan kơ sư: Lăp mưh inh lĕch hlôi tơ 'nguaih kơ pơlei, inh gô yơ̆r ti tơ Kră Yang; grơ̆m glaih gô pơdơh, 'mi prĕl gô pă đei dơ̆ng, wă kơ ih băt kơ plĕnh teh đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: But as for you and your servants, I know that you will not yet fear the LORD God.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh băt kơ ih păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ ih ưh tam mă hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mơ̆i.

English: Now the flax and the barley were struck, for the barley was in the head and the flax was in bud.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah bơyan, 'ba tơ'bâu huăt, 'long jơla đei bluh pơkao, lei na 'ba hăm 'long jơla păk răm đĭ.

English: But the wheat and the spelt were not struck, for they are late crops.
Bahnar: Mă-lei oei pă 'ba mi mă huăt klui đĕch huay kơ 'bơm păk răm.

English: So Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh and spread out his hands to the LORD; then the thunder and the hail ceased, and the rain was not poured on the earth.
Bahnar: Môis lĕch đơ̆ng Pharaôn, năm tơ 'nguaih pơlei; sư yơ̆r ti tơ Kră Yang, grơ̆m glaih păng 'mi prĕl pơdơh na đak 'mi kư̆m prăng hloi ưh pă kơtoh tơ teh dơ̆ng boih.

English: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain, the hail, and the thunder had ceased, he sinned yet more; and he hardened his heart, he and his servants.
Bahnar: Kơplah Pharaôn 'bôh, 'mi prĕl păng grơ̆m glaih pơdơh đĭ boih, sư păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ sư arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ chu păng lu sư oei pơm yoch dơ̆ng

English: So the heart of Pharaoh was hard; neither would he let the children of Israel go, as the LORD had spoken by Moses.
Bahnar: Pharaôn arăng kơ̆l, ưh kơ 'maih achăng kon pơlei Isơrael năm, trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan bơih kơ Môis păng yua 'bơ̆r Môis pơma.

English: Now the LORD said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh; for I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his servants, that I may show these signs of Mine before him
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, năm bĕ tơ Pharaôn yua kơ Inh pơm kơ sư păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ sư đei jơhngơ̆m arăng, wă kơ Inh pơm tơ'bôh dôm tơdrong mơsêh Inh tơ lăm lu sư

English: and that you may tell in the hearing of your son and your son’s son the mighty things I have done in Egypt, and My signs which I have done among them, that you may know that I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: wă kơ ih gô roi kơ kon sâu ih mơsêh tih-tin Inh pơm kơ kon pơlei Êyiptơ, dôm tơdrong mơsêh Inh pơm bơih lăm lu sư, wă kơ lu sư băt kơ Inh Kră Yang.

English: So Moses and Aaron came in to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says the LORD God of the Hebrews: ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn năm hloi tơ Pharaôn păng khan kơ sư: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pơlei Hêbrơ, đei khan thoi âu: Ih ưh kơ chu drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Inh dĭng truh dang yơ? Achăng bĕ lê̆ kon pơlei Inh năm, wă kơ lu sư năm kơkuh kơ Inh.

English: Or else, if you refuse to let My people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your territory.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih ưh kơ chu ăn kon pơlei inh năm, lei dơning inh gô ăn lep truh tơ jơ̆p-jang lăm char ih

English: And they shall cover the face of the earth, so that no one will be able to see the earth; and they shall eat the residue of what is left, which remains to you from the hail, and they shall eat every tree which grows up for you out of the field.
Bahnar: lep gô jruh 'bĕnh-'bang kơpal teh lăng teh mah ưh pă 'bôh sư gô kăp pơđĭ dôm tơmam kiơ mă oei đei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'mi prĕl preh; sư kư̆m kăp pơđĭ dôm lu 'long chăt tơ mir na ih

English: They shall fill your houses, the houses of all your servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians—which neither your fathers nor your fathers’ fathers have seen, since the day that they were on the earth to this day.’ ” And he turned and went out from Pharaoh.
Bahnar: lep gô mơ̆t 'bĕnh lăm hnam ih, lăm hnam đĭch đam ih păng lăm hnam dơnŏ lu bơngai Êyiptơ: Lu đe yă, 'bok, kư̆m ưh tam lah 'bôh ôh đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei đei tơdrong truh thoi 'nâu. Na Môis lĕch wih đơ̆ng Pharaôn.

English: Then Pharaoh’s servants said to him, “How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, that they may serve the LORD their God. Do you not yet know that Egypt is destroyed?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ Pharaôn khan kơ sư. Truh dĭng dang yơ bơngai âu mă lê̆ hơ'năk hơđong kơ lu bơ̆n? Jah achăng lê̆ lu kon pơlei noh năm bĕ, wă kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư! Pơtao ưh tam băt hă dêh Êyiptơ đei tơdrong răm đĭ boih.

English: So Moses and Aaron were brought again to Pharaoh, and he said to them, “Go, serve the LORD your God. Who are the ones that are going?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh đe krao dơ̆ng Môis păng Arôn năm tơ Pharaôn; na Pharaôn khan kơ bre sư: Năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm bĕ; đe bu wă năm?

English: And Moses said, “We will go with our young and our old; with our sons and our daughters, with our flocks and our herds we will go, for we must hold a feast to the LORD.”
Bahnar: Môis tơl khan: Lu nhôn năm, gô chông đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn 'lơ̆p 'lŏ hơmuh hơmŏng păng lu kră, khŭl triu, rơmo, yua kơ lu nhôn, wă hơmet tơmam et sa tih kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then he said to them, “The LORD had better be with you when I let you and your little ones go! Beware, for evil is ahead of you.
Bahnar: Pharaôn khan, apinh Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm! Mưh mah inh đei ăn kơ lu iĕm năm pơđĭ kon hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-kăn kơchăng bĕ, yua kơ lu iĕm đei chă đon kơnê̆ dêh!

English: Not so! Go now, you who are men, and serve the LORD, for that is what you desired.” And they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ gơh ôh, dôm lu iĕm drŏ-nglo đĕch năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, kiơ̆ kơ lu iĕm apinh. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư puh hloi Môis păng Arôn lĕch đơ̆ng Pharaôn.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land—all that the hail has left.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis yơ̆r ti ih tơklă tơ dêh Êyiptơ wă kơ lep năm jơ̆p kơ dêh 'noh, kăp đĭ hla 'nhĕt hla 'nhot păng dôm tơmam kiơ tơ kơpal teh mă đơ̆ng 'mi prĕl oei lon.

English: So Moses stretched out his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind on the land all that day and all that night. When it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis yơ̆r hloi 'long jra sư tơklă tơ dêh Êyiptơ, Kră Yang ăn kial đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch dơhlu tơ dêh Êyiptơ prăt năr prăt măng. Truh pơgê dơning kial đơ̆ng hơlĕch tơthu anhăk ba lep truh tơ 'noh hloi.

English: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt and rested on all the territory of Egypt. They were very severe; previously there had been no such locusts as they, nor shall there be such after them.
Bahnar: Lep jruh jơ̆p-jang lăm dêh Êyiptơ, sư jur 'bĕnh-'bang tơ lăm dêh noh. Lơlap lơlang, ưh tam mă đei ôh lep đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ ning-mônh đei lơ thoi noh.

English: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they ate every herb of the land and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left. So there remained nothing green on the trees or on the plants of the field throughout all the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lep 'bĕnh-'bang jơ̆p-jang kơpal teh tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ. Păng đei lăm dêh char jing găm ngăl, kăp sa đĭ lu hla 'nhĕt 'nhot sa tơ anih tơmăn glă păng plei 'long sa mă đơ̆ng 'mi prĕl oei lon; jơ̆p tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ ưh pă đei hla 'nhĕt 'nhot hla 'long tơ mir, tơmăn glă gơh bluh dơ̆ng boih.

English: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste, and said, “I have sinned against the LORD your God and against you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Pharaôn hăt hot krao Môis păng Arôn na khan: Inh pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm păng hăm măr iĕm hai.

English: Now therefore, please forgive my sin only this once, and entreat the LORD your God, that He may take away from me this death only.”
Bahnar: Dang ei, apinh ih mơnat ăn kơ inh pă minh wơ̆t 'nâu; păng krao khan bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, wă kơ sư iŏk lê̆ đơ̆ng inh tơdrong pơrăm krưp 'nâu.

English: So he went out from Pharaoh and entreated the LORD.
Bahnar: Môis lĕch hloi đơ̆ng hnam Pharaôn păng krao khan kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD turned a very strong west wind, which took the locusts away and blew them into the Red Sea. There remained not one locust in all the territory of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kial đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t truh tih tơpă, dơhlu anhăk lep tơhuŏng lê̆ tơ đak dơsĭ 'brê; jơ̆p kơ anih lăm dêh Êyiptơ ưh pă đei minh pôm lep ayơ dơ̆ng.

English: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ Pharaôn oei arăng kơ̆l, sư kư̆m ưh kơchăng lê̆ ăn kon pơlei Isơrael năm ôh.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, darkness which may even be felt.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Athei yơ̆r ti ih tơ plĕnh, wă kơ tơ jơ̆p-jang dêh Êyiptơ đei tơdrong măng mu hơ'bơ̆l gueo truh kơ lu sư chă hơbơ̆ pă bang

English: So Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven, and there was thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.
