Bahnar: Na Môis yơ̆r ti sư tơ plĕnh, đei măng mu măng klăm gueo dêh hloi lăm pêng năr tơ dêh Êyiptơ

English: They did not see one another; nor did anyone rise from his place for three days. But all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
Bahnar: lăm pêng năr noh lu đe ưh kơ gơh 'bôh dih băl ưh kơ đei bu gơh chă rơrĭ tơ nai. Mă-lei lăm tơring kon pơlei Isơrael oei tơ noh đei hơdah jơ̆p-jang.

English: Then Pharaoh called to Moses and said, “Go, serve the LORD; only let your flocks and your herds be kept back. Let your little ones also go with you.”
Bahnar: Pharaôn krao hloi Môis păng khan: Lu iĕm năm kơkuh bĕ kơ Kră Yang: Chông ba lu kon hơ'lơ̆p lu iĕm năm hơdai; oei pă khŭl kon triu, kon rơmo đĕch lê̆ tơ âu.

English: But Moses said, “You must also give us sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis tơl khan: Ih ăn bĕ kơ lu nhôn kon sem dơrong pơm tơmam soi sơmah pơyơ̆r 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.

English: Our livestock also shall go with us; not a hoof shall be left behind. For we must take some of them to serve the LORD our God, and even we do not know with what we must serve the LORD until we arrive there.”
Bahnar: Lu khŭl sem dơrong kư̆m gô kiơ̆ lu nhôn mơ̆n, ưh kơ đei wă lê̆ minh kơchôp jơ̆ng ayơ; yua kơ lu nhôn wă iŏk pơyơ̆r sem dơrong 'noh wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn; lu nhôn băt rơih iŏk kiơ wă yua kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, mưh lu nhôn truh tơ noh.

English: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang pơm kơ Pharaôn arăng kơ̆l, na sư ưh kơ chu ăn ôh kon pơlei Isơrael năm.

English: Then Pharaoh said to him, “Get away from me! Take heed to yourself and see my face no more! For in the day you see my face you shall die!”
Bahnar: Pharaôn khan kơ Môis lĕch wih bĕ đơ̆ng inh! Kơchăng bĕ! 'Nĕ pă năm tơ'bơ̆p inh dơ̆ng. Năr ayơ ih năm tơ'bơ̆p inh, năr 'noh inh gô pơlôch Ih!

English: So Moses said, “You have spoken well. I will never see your face again.”
Bahnar: Môis khan: Ih pơma trŏ boih; inh ưh pă wă tơ'bơ̆p ih dơ̆ng ôh.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “I will bring one more plague on Pharaoh and on Egypt. Afterward he will let you go from here. When he lets you go, he will surely drive you out of here altogether.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Inh gô ăn tơdrong truh dơ̆ng kơ Pharaôn păng dêh Êyiptơ; đơ̆ng noh sư gô achăng lê̆ lu iĕm năm. Mưh sư ăn kơ lu iĕm năm, sư kư̆m gô pơpuh lu iĕm lĕch đĭ đơ̆ng anih 'nâu.

English: Speak now in the hearing of the people, and let every man ask from his neighbor and every woman from her neighbor, articles of silver and articles of gold.”
Bahnar: Na athei roi bĕ kơ kon pơlei păng pơkă khan wă kơ rim 'nu lu sư mă drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn athei apinh lu bơngai jih 'ma sư dôm tơmam gĭt păng hu, dah maih.

English: And the LORD gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants and in the sight of the people.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm ăn kon pơlei pơla đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Êyiptơ; Môis kư̆m minh 'nu bơngai đe băt ư-ang lăm dêh Êyiptơ, 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ Pharaôn păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei noh.

English: Then Moses said, “Thus says the LORD: ‘About midnight I will go out into the midst of Egypt
Bahnar: Môis khan: Kră Yang đei khan thoi âu; kơplah tŏk-bŏk măng kơnh inh gô năm jơ̆p tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: and all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, even to the firstborn of the female servant who is behind the handmill, and all the firstborn of the animals.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon kơdră drŏ-nglo lăm dêh Êyiptơ gô lôch, iŏk đơ̆ng kon drŏ-nglo Pharaôn mă oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao, truh tơ đĭ-đăng kon đĭch, đam drŏ-kăn lu sư mă ala hloh păng đĭ lu kon sem dơrong sư su blŭng-a kư̆m lôch.

English: Then there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as was not like it before, nor shall be like it again.
Bahnar: Lăm jơ̆p dêh Êyiptơ gô đei ôr krao nhơ̆m hmoi, đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei ưh tam mă đei păng kư̆m ưh kơ wă layơ gô đei thoi âu dơ̆ng.

English: But against none of the children of Israel shall a dog move its tongue, against man or beast, that you may know that the LORD does make a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei, lăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael hiôk-hian mă đơ̆ng kon kŏ kư̆m gô ưh kơ kuăl, mă kon bơngai, mă sem dơrong; wă kơ lu iĕm băt kơ Kră Yang ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael hăm bơngai Êyiptơ phara.

English: And all these your servants shall come down to me and bow down to me, saying, ‘Get out, and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will go out.” Then he went out from Pharaoh in great anger.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu đĭch đam ih gô năm truh tơ inh, kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp inh khan: Năm bĕ, ih hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kiơ̆ ih! Đơ̆ng noh inh gô năm. Môis lĕch hloi đơ̆ng Pharaôn lăm jơhngơ̆m sư ơh blĕk dêh tơpă.

English: But the LORD said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, so that My wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Pharaôn ưh wă chu ôh, wă lê̆ kơ Inh pơm tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch pơthim lơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: So Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh; and the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn pơm tơdrong mơsêh 'nâu 'bơ̆t anăp Pharaôn; mă-lei yua kơ Kră Yang pơm kơ Pharaôn arăng kơ̆l, na sư ưh achăng lê̆ kon pơlei Isơrael năm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh sư.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying
Bahnar: Tơ dêh Êyiptơ, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “This month shall be your beginning of months; it shall be the first month of the year to you.
Bahnar: Khei 'nâu wă pơm khei blŭng-a kơ lu iĕm; wă khan khei mônh lăm sơnăm.

English: Speak to all the congregation of Israel, saying: ‘On the tenth of this month every man shall take for himself a lamb, according to the house of his father, a lamb for a household.
Bahnar: Athei roi ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kơ lu bơngai Isơrael thoi âu: Truh năr mơjĭt khei 'nâu, rim 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo lăm hnam dơnŏ athei rôp minh pôm triu kon. Rim hnam dơnŏ minh pôm kon triu kon.

English: And if the household is too small for the lamb, let him and his neighbor next to his house take it according to the number of the persons; according to each man’s need you shall make your count for the lamb.
Bahnar: Tơdah hnam ayơ mă bơngai tŏ sĕt sa ưh kơ đĭ minh pôm triu kon, athei rôp minh pôm hơdai hăm hnam dơnŏ lăm bôl buăl rông 'bôt iĕm, kiơ̆ kơ̆l bơngai; păng athei jô̆ hơdôm tŏ triu kon kiơ̆ kơ bơngai kĕ sa pơđĭ.

English: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year. You may take it from the sheep or from the goats.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei rôp lăm khŭl kon triu dah kon bơbe tơno mă 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ đei rơka rơkĕch kiơ. Tôm minh sơnăm.

English: Now you shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month. Then the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at twilight.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu iĕm rong lê̆ truh năr mơjĭt-puăn khei 'nâu; na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael athei rôp ba 'bet pơlôch til kơsơ̆ măng.

English: And they shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and on the lintel of the houses where they eat it.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô iŏk pham pik 'bar pah jrăng dơ̆ng 'măng păng 'long găn kơpal lăm hnam ayơ mă sa 'nhĕm triu kon 'noh.

English: Then they shall eat the flesh on that night; roasted in fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
Bahnar: Măng 'noh lu sư gô sa 'nhĕm kon triu 'buh phang hăm 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih păng hla 'nhot tăng.

English: Do not eat it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roasted in fire—its head with its legs and its entrails.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm lê̆ kơ sa 'nhĕm oei adrih dah pai hăm đak, mă-lei iĕm athei 'buh kơpal ŭnh ngăl mă kơ̆l, jơ̆ng păng klak sư.

English: You shall let none of it remain until morning, and what remains of it until morning you shall burn with fire.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ sa 'măn truh tơ pơgê dơning; mă-lei tơdah oei đei rơkah athei 'buh pơđĭ lê̆

English: And thus you shall eat it: with a belt on your waist, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand. So you shall eat it in haste. It is the LORD’s Passover.
Bahnar: Lei iĕm sa 'nhĕm noh thoi âu: Gơhret tơlei tơ̆n mă kơjăp, jơ̆ng 'bot chơkhŏ, ti chĕp 'long jra, sa hăt hot; 'noh wă khan năr giĕng Kră Yang Năm Brih.

English: ‘For I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night, and will strike all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm măng noh inh gô năm tơ jơ̆p-jang dêh Êyiptơ, pơrăm rim kon kơdră drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng kon bơngai truh tơ kon sem dơrong; păng Inh gô sek phak lu rup yang lăm dêh Êyiptơ; Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Now the blood shall be a sign for you on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you; and the plague shall not be on you to destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Pham pik wă kơnăl tơ hnam lu iĕm oei, tơdah Inh 'bôh pham 'noh, lei gô năm yoh, ưh kơ đei tơdrong jĭ apoh truh pơrăm lu iĕm. Kơplah Inh pơrăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: ‘So this day shall be to you a memorial; and you shall keep it as a feast to the LORD throughout your generations. You shall keep it as a feast by an everlasting ordinance.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei chih răk năr âu wă kơ iĕm 'blŏk ling-lang; truh tơ rim jơhnơr athei wei pơm giĕng ăn kơ Kră Yang, wă khan minh tơdrong giĕng pơjing tơtă ling-lang.

English: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses. For whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr athei sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông Lăm năr blŭng-a, athei iŏk hŭt lê̆ 'buih đơ̆ng lăm hnam lu iĕm; tơdah bơngai bu sa 'bĕng đei păng 'buih pông đơ̆ng năr blŭng-a mă truh tơ năr tơpơh, lei đe gô puh tơweh bơngai 'noh đơ̆ng lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation, and on the seventh day there shall be a holy convocation for you. No manner of work shall be done on them; but that which everyone must eat—that only may be prepared by you.
Bahnar: Năr blŭng-a, lu iĕm athei đei năr akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng truh năr tơpơh lu iĕm gô akŭm lei-lăi mơ̆n. Lăm năr noh ưh gơh jang tơdrong kiơ, lăp gơh pai hơmet tơmam sa ăn kơ rim 'nu sa đĕch.

English: So you shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread, for on this same day I will have brought your armies out of the land of Egypt. Therefore you shall observe this day throughout your generations as an everlasting ordinance.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu iĕm athei wei pơm giĕng sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông, yua kơ năr âu mơ̆n Inh chông lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ; yua kơ thoi noh na lu iĕm athei wei răk năr 'nâu truh rim jơhnơr thoi minh tơdrong tơtă ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread, until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
Bahnar: Năr mơjĭt-puăn lăm khei mônh, tơtil kơsơ̆, lu iĕm gô sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông truh tơ năr 'bar-jĭt mônh khei 'noh.

English: For seven days no leaven shall be found in your houses, since whoever eats what is leavened, that same person shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he is a stranger or a native of the land.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr 'nĕ ăn đei 'buih pông tơ hnam lu iĕm; yua kơ bơngai bu, bơngai dêh iĕm, tơdah bơngai tơmoi bu sa 'bĕng đei 'buih pông gô puh tơweh sư đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael.

English: You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your dwellings you shall eat unleavened bread.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ sa 'bĕng đei 'buih pông; jơ̆p kơ anih lu iĕm oei athei sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông ngăl.

English: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Pick out and take lambs for yourselves according to your families, and kill the Passover lamb.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Môis krao akŭm lu kră bơngai Isơrael na khan kơ lu sư. “Năm bĕ rôp minh pôm triu kon đơ̆ng lăm khŭl kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ lu iĕm păng pơlôch sư pơm giĕng Năm Brih.

English: And you shall take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two doorposts with the blood that is in the basin. And none of you shall go out of the door of his house until morning.
Bahnar: Na athei iŏk minh hơchô̆ hla bơngăl, djrŭ lăm pham đe mong lăm kơthao, na pik tơ jrăng 'bar pah 'măng hnam păng jrăng găn kơpơ̆ng, na lăm lu iĕm 'nĕ ăn bơngai bu lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ 'măng hnam truh tơ pơgê dơning.

English: For the LORD will pass through to strike the Egyptians; and when He sees the blood on the lintel and on the two doorposts, the LORD will pass over the door and not allow the destroyer to come into your houses to strike you.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang gô năm wă pơlôch bơngai Êyiptơ; mưh sư 'bôh pham tơ jrăng găn kơpơ̆ng 'măng păng 'bar pah jrăng dơ̆ng 'măng, Kră Yang gô năm yoh hloi; ưh kơ ăn linh jang mơ̆t pơlôch lăm hnam lu iĕm.

English: And you shall observe this thing as an ordinance for you and your sons forever.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei bơwei tơdrong giĕng 'nâu thoi lĕ tơdrong juăt tơtă ling-lang ăn kơ lu iĕm păng kon sâu lu iĕm.

English: It will come to pass when you come to the land which the LORD will give you, just as He promised, that you shall keep this service.
Bahnar: Layơ lu iĕm mơ̆t boih lăm dêh mă Kră Yang ăn kơ lu iĕm, thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă, lei iĕm athei bơwei tơdrong giĕng 'nâu.

English: And it shall be, when your children say to you, ‘What do you mean by this service?’
Bahnar: Mưh kon sâu lu iĕm apinh khan: Tơdrong giĕng 'nâu wă khan kiơ?

English: that you shall say, ‘It is the Passover sacrifice of the LORD, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt when He struck the Egyptians and delivered our households.’ ” So the people bowed their heads and worshiped.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei tơl khan: ‘'Noh wă khan tơdrong pơm giĕng Năm Brih đơ̆ng Kră Yang, kơplah Kră Yang pơrăm lu bơngai Êyiptơ na Kră Yang năm brih rim hnam kon pơlei Isơrael păng pơklaih hnam lu bơ̆n tơpă.’ ” Lăp kon pơlei kơtơ̆ng na kŭp kơ̆l drap kơkuh.

English: Then the children of Israel went away and did so; just as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă boih kơ Môis păng Arôn.

English: And it came to pass at midnight that the LORD struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the firstborn of livestock.
Bahnar: Kơplah tŏk-bŏk măng Kră Yang pơlôch đĭ lu kon kơdră drŏ-nglo dêh Êyiptơ, iŏk đơ̆ng kon kơdră pơtao Pharaôn oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ truh tơ kon kơdră đe rôp pơm bơnă kon pơlei hmă păng đĭ-đăng lu kon sem dơrong tuh blŭng-a.

English: So Pharaoh rose in the night, he, all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
Bahnar: Pharaôn iung kơplah oei măng, hăm lu bơngai jang kơ sư păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Êyiptơ, đei nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi rơông rơang lăm dêh Êyiptơ, yua ưh kơ đei minh pôm hnam ayơ mă ưh kơ đei bơngai lôch.

English: Then he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, “Rise, go out from among my people, both you and the children of Israel. And go, serve the LORD as you have said.
Bahnar: Lĕch đơ̆ng Êyiptơ lăm măng noh mơ̆n, Pharaôn krao hloi Môis păng Arôn na khan: Iung bĕ, măr iĕm păng kon pơlei Isơrael jah weh đơ̆ng kon pơlei inh, năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, kiơ̆ thoi lu iĕm apinh.

English: Also take your flocks and your herds, as you have said, and be gone; and bless me also.”
Bahnar: Na chông puh ba rơmo păng triu kư̆m năm, thoi lu iĕm đei khan na năm bĕ; păng krao khan kơ inh đei pŭn hiôk mơ̆n.

English: And the Egyptians urged the people, that they might send them out of the land in haste. For they said, “We shall all be dead.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Êyiptơ pơpuh kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh sư mă tĕnh tĕnh, yua kơ lu sư khan: Lu nhôn gô lôch đĭ. Tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ năm.

English: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, having their kneading bowls bound up in their clothes on their shoulders.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael chĕp ba hloi tơpŭng pơm 'bĕng hlôi jrâu boih mă ưh tam đei păng 'buih pông păng chĕp pơđĭ dôm kơthŭng jrâu tơpŭng tah lăm ao 'mi tôi tơ hơngiĕng kơdih lu sư.

English: Now the children of Israel had done according to the word of Moses, and they had asked from the Egyptians articles of silver, articles of gold, and clothing.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei Isơrael pơm kiơ̆ lei-lăi thoi nơ̆r Môis tơtă. Lu sư apinh dôm tơmam gĭt, hu dah maih truh kơ ao tai đơ̆ng lu bơngai Êyiptơ.

English: And the LORD had given the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they granted them what they requested. Thus they plundered the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Êyiptơ, na ăn kơ lu sư. Kiơ̆ thoi lu sư apinh. Thoi noh kon pơlei Isơrael tơgar iŏk đĭ-đăng tơmam đơ̆ng bơngai Êyiptơ.

English: Then the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, besides children.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael năm đơ̆ng pơlei Ramse truh tơ pơlei Sukôt, ưh kơ đei jô̆ lu bơngai drŏ-kăn păng lu hơ'lơ̆p, đĭ-đăng đei tơdrâu-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo.

English: A mixed multitude went up with them also, and flocks and herds—a great deal of livestock.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lơ adrĕch adrung nai năm hơdai, hăm lu sư kư̆m đei chông ba lơ kon triu, rơmo păng sem dơrong.

English: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they had brought out of Egypt; for it was not leavened, because they were driven out of Egypt and could not wait, nor had they prepared provisions for themselves.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông tơpŭng mă lu sư chĕp ba đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ. Tơpŭng ưh kơ đei hrâu 'buih pông ôh yua kơ đe puh lu sư hăt hot dêh lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, ưh kơ gơh hiơ̆ păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei hơmet hiă lê̆ tơmam sa kơdih.

English: Now the sojourn of the children of Israel who lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael oei tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ đunh đei puăn-hrĕng pêng-jĭt sơnăm.

English: And it came to pass at the end of the four hundred and thirty years—on that very same day—it came to pass that all the armies of the LORD went out from the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lăp tôm puăn-hrĕng pêng-jĭt sơnăm boih, lăm năr noh boih, lu linh Kră Yang lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: It is a night of solemn observance to the LORD for bringing them out of the land of Egypt. This is that night of the LORD, a solemn observance for all the children of Israel throughout their generations.
Bahnar: Măng noh Kră Yang dui pơklaih kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ; yua kơ thoi noh rim jơhnơr, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael athei răk 'blŏk lăm măng noh, wă kơkuh pơyom kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “This is the ordinance of the Passover: No foreigner shall eat it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn: 'Nâu boih tơdrong juăt gah giĕng Năm Brih: Bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ gơh sa giĕng noh ôh.

English: But every man’s servant who is bought for money, when you have circumcised him, then he may eat it.
Bahnar: Na gah lu bơngai đĭch, iĕm 'nao răt păng jên păng athei kăt tơdra akar kơ sư, na lu sư gơh sa.

English: A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat it.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơmoi păng bơngai bơ̆jang apah kư̆m ưh kơ gơh sa giĕng 'noh ôh.

English: In one house it shall be eaten; you shall not carry any of the flesh outside the house, nor shall you break one of its bones.
Bahnar: Giĕng noh 'nhĕm gơh sa lăm hnam đĕch; ih 'nĕ chĕp 'nhĕm lĕch tơ 'nguaih păng kư̆m 'nĕ pơm tơgơ̆ minh pôm kơting ayơ.

English: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
Bahnar: Ăn đĭ-đăng Isơrael athei akŭm bơwei 'blŏk giĕng Năm Brih.

English: And when a stranger dwells with you and wants to keep the Passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as a native of the land. For no uncircumcised person shall eat it.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai tơmoi ayơ oei hơdai lăm hnam iĕm, mă 'maih pơm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r giĕng Năm Brih Kră Yang, lei lu bơngai drŏ-nglo lu sư athei kăt tơdra akar; đơ̆ng noh na lu sư gơh năm pơm giĕng Năm Brih 'nâu păng gơh jô̆ thoi bơngai tơpŭ lăm char Isơrael. Mă-lei bơngai bu ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar, lei ưh kơ gơh sa ôh.

English: One law shall be for the native-born and for the stranger who dwells among you.”
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lei-lăi minh tơdrong juăt ăn lu bơngai tơpŭ lăm dêh iĕm hăm bơngai tơmoi ayơ truh oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm.

English: Thus all the children of Israel did; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael lu sư pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh; kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang tơtă ăn kơ Môis păng Arôn boih.

English: And it came to pass, on that very same day, that the LORD brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt according to their armies.
Bahnar: Kŭm lăm năr 'noh Kră Yang chông tơlĕch pơklaih kon pơlei Isơrael, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl linh, lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Consecrate to Me all the firstborn, whatever opens the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and beast; it is Mine.”
Bahnar: Lăm kon pơlei Isơrael mă bơngai dah sem dơrong, athei pơyơ̆r 'măn lê̆ kơ Inh dôm kon kơdră yua kơ kon kơdră noh gah Inh.

English: And Moses said to the people: “Remember this day in which you went out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out of this place. No leavened bread shall be eaten.
Bahnar: Môis pơma hăm kon pơlei, iĕm athei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ năr 'nâu, yua năr 'nâu năr Kră Yang yua ti mơsêh Sư pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, klaih đơ̆ng teh đak pơm đĭch đam; na 'nĕ sa 'bĕng đei 'buih pông.

English: On this day you are going out, in the month Abib.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu, trŏ khei mônh, lu iĕm lĕch.a

English: And it shall be, when the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, which He swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, that you shall keep this service in this month.
Bahnar: Mưh layơ Kră Yang ba lu iĕm tơ dêh kon pơlei Kanaan, kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Amôrit, kon pơlei Hêwit păng kon pơlei Jêbus boih, dêh teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng thoi đak sut đak toh păng dêh Kră Yang mă pơkă hăm lu 'bok iĕm, na truh lăm khei 'nâu ih athei wei răk tơdrong giĕng 'nâu.

English: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a feast to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr ih athei sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông, truh năr tơpơh gô đei et sa bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days. And no leavened bread shall be seen among you, nor shall leaven be seen among you in all your quarters.
Bahnar: Athei sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông lăm tơpơh năr, lăm tơring iĕm 'nĕ ăn kơ đei 'bôh 'buih pông.

English: And you shall tell your son in that day, saying, ‘This is done because of what the LORD did for me when I came up from Egypt.’
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh athei roi ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo iĕm, bơ̆n pơm tơdrong 'noh yua kơ Kră Yang pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ inh, kơplah inh lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: It shall be as a sign to you on your hand and as a memorial between your eyes, that the LORD’s law may be in your mouth; for with a strong hand the LORD has brought you out of Egypt.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh iĕm athei pơm tơ'bôh minh tơdra tơ ti iĕm, pơm minh tơdrong 'blŏk hơdơ̆r chih tơ klĕng, wă kơ tơ'blŏk tơdrong juăt Kră Yang oei tơ lăm 'bơ̆r iĕm, yua kơ hăm ti mơsêh mơyang Kră Yang pơklaih iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: You shall therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm, truh bơyan, iĕm athei bơwei nơ̆r tơtă tơdrong 'nâu ling-lang.

English: “And it shall be, when the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites, as He swore to you and your fathers, and gives it to you
Bahnar: Layơ Kră Yang chông iĕm mơ̆t tơ dêh Kanaan, kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơkă pơ'ngam bơih hăm ih păng 'bok ih, sư gô pơjao dêh noh kơ ih

English: that you shall set apart to the LORD all that open the womb, that is, every firstborn that comes from an animal which you have; the males shall be the LORD’s.
Bahnar: na ih athei pơyơ̆r ăn Kră Yang lu kon kơdră drŏ-nglo hăm lu kon tơno tuh blŭng-a lăm sem dơrong, yua kơ lu sư gô jing gah Kră Yang ngăl.

English: But every firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb; and if you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. And all the firstborn of man among your sons you shall redeem.
Bahnar: Mă-lei rim kon aseh iĕ blŭng-a, iĕm athei rôp triu kon dah bơbe kon huai tơplih, tơdah ưh, athei wĕch hơko sư, kư̆m athei huai iŏk rim kon kơdră kon drŏ-nglo iĕm.

English: So it shall be, when your son asks you in time to come, saying, ‘What is this?’ that you shall say to him, ‘By strength of hand the LORD brought us out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Bahnar: Na tơdah dơning dơmônh kon drŏ-nglo iĕm apinh iĕm: Tơdrong noh wă khan kiơ? Lei ih athei roi kơ sư: 'Noh yua kơ Kră Yang yua ti mơsêh pơklaih lu nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, dêh mă nhôn pơm đĭch

English: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh was stubborn about letting us go, that the LORD killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man and the firstborn of beast. Therefore I sacrifice to the LORD all males that open the womb, but all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.’
Bahnar: yua kơ kơplah Pharaôn arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ ăn kơ lu nhôn năm, Kră Yang pơlôch đĭ hloi lu kon kơdră lăm dêh Êyiptơ, đơ̆ng kon kơdră drŏ-nglo kon bơngai truh tơ kon sem dơrong tuh blŭng-a, yua tơdrong noh, inh pơyơ̆r ăn Kră Yang dôm kon sem dơrong tơno tuh blŭng-a păng inh huai iŏk kon kơdră kon drŏ-nglo inh.

English: It shall be as a sign on your hand and as frontlets between your eyes, for by strength of hand the LORD brought us out of Egypt.”
Bahnar: 'Noh gô pơm minh tơdrong tơdra tơ ti ih păng chơ̆m tơ klĕng ih, wă tơbăt tơ'blŏk Kră Yang yua ti mơsêh pơklaih lu nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Then it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, “Lest perhaps the people change their minds when they see war, and return to Egypt.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Pharaôn achăng kon pơlei Isơrael năm, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei chông ba kon pơlei noh năm rok trong gah dêh Philistin, noh trong jăl jê̆ hloh; yua kơ Kră Yang khan: Hli kơ kon pơlei tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong tơblah wang, lu sư wih brŏk hơlơ̆k đơ̆ng tơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: So God led the people around by way of the wilderness of the Red Sea. And the children of Israel went up in orderly ranks out of the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chông ba lu kon pơlei năm dăr rok kiơ̆ trong lăm char glă, gah Đak Dơsĭ 'Brê. Kon pơlei Isơrael chĕp khêl đao lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for he had placed the children of Israel under solemn oath, saying, “God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”
Bahnar: Môis chĕp anhăk ba kơting Jôsep; yua kơ Jôsep đei athei kon sâu Isơrael pơkă pơkăm anhăk ba kơting sư: Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm; na lu iĕm athei anhăk ba kơting inh lĕch đơ̆ng dêh 'nâu.

English: So they took their journey from Succoth and camped in Etham at the edge of the wilderness.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm đơ̆ng Sukôt oei pơdơh pơm bơsŭn tơ Êtham tôch kơ char glă.

English: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of cloud to lead the way, and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light, so as to go by day and night.
Bahnar: Kră Yang năm adrol kơ kon pơlei, tơ kơ'năr hăm minh pôm jrăng hơmơ̆l, wă ba trong yak năm; tơ kơmăng hăm minh pôm jrăng ŭnh, wă pơchrang ăn kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu sư gơh năm ling-lang kơ'năr păng kơmăng.

English: He did not take away the pillar of cloud by day or the pillar of fire by night from before the people.
Bahnar: Kơ'năr jrăng hơmơ̆l ưh kơ đei layơ weh đơ̆ng kon pơlei, jrăng ŭnh tơ kơmăng kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, that they turn and camp before Pi Hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, opposite Baal Zephon; you shall camp before it by the sea.
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael athei năm wơ̆t tơ rŏng pơm anih pơdơh tơ jê̆ Pi Hahirôt, sơlam Mikdôl păng đak dơsĭ, tơklă Baal Sêphôn lu iĕm athei oei pơdơh pơm anih, jê̆ đak dơsĭ.

English: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, ‘They are bewildered by the land; the wilderness has closed them in.’
Bahnar: Pharaôn khan lu kon pơlei Isơrael gô wơ̆l kơ trong, chă wih wơ̆t lăm char glă.

English: Then I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, so that he will pursue them; and I will gain honor over Pharaoh and over all his army, that the Egyptians may know that I am the LORD.” And they did so.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ Pharaôn arăng kơ̆l ưh kơ chu, sư gô druh kon pơlei Isơrael Inh gô đei ư-ang yua kơ đơ̆ng Pharaôn păng lu linh sư; na bơngai Êyiptơ gô băt Inh bơih Kră Yang. Kon pơlei Isơrael mă pơm thoi noh.

English: Now it was told the king of Egypt that the people had fled, and the heart of Pharaoh and his servants was turned against the people; and they said, “Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?”
Bahnar: Kơplah đe roi kơ pơtao Êyiptơ khan kon pơlei Hêbrơ kơdâu jăk đĭ boih, jơhngơ̆m Pharaôn păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ sư, tơplih hloi, lu sư khan: Lu bơ̆n pơm thoi âu, achăng lê̆ kon pơlei Isơrael năm, ưh pă bơ̆jang kơ bơ̆n dơ̆ng.

English: So he made ready his chariot and took his people with him.
Bahnar: Pharaôn tŏk gre aseh hloi păng chông ba lu linh kiơ̆ sư.

English: Also, he took six hundred choice chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt with captains over every one of them.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk chĕp ba tơdrâu-hrĕng tŏ gre aseh mă 'lơ̆ng hloh păng đĭ-đăng gre aseh nai dơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm dêh Êyiptơ, rim kơ gre aseh noh đei lu yŏng linh kiơ̆ pơgơ̆r.

English: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued the children of Israel; and the children of Israel went out with boldness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm kơ Pharaôn pơtao dêh Êyiptơ, arăng kơ̆l, druh kon pơlei Isơrael; mă-lei kon pơlei Isơrael nuih yak năm tơpăt tơ anăp hloi.

English: So the Egyptians pursued them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, his horsemen and his army, and overtook them camping by the sea beside Pi Hahiroth, before Baal Zephon.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êyiptơ druh lu sư păng đĭ-đăng aseh gre aseh, lu linh chĕp gre aseh păng lu linh Pharaôn, druh tam kon pơlei Isơrael, oei pơdơh tơ jê̆ đak dơsĭ, Phihahirôt, tơklă Baal Sêphôn.

English: And when Pharaoh drew near, the children of Israel lifted their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians marched after them. So they were very afraid, and the children of Israel cried out to the LORD.
Bahnar: Wă lăp 'bôh Pharaôn păng lu linh dêh Êyiptơ druh wă tam đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư, na lu kon pơlei Isơrael hli dêh krao ôr apinh Kră Yang.

English: Then they said to Moses, “Because there were no graves in Egypt, have you taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why have you so dealt with us, to bring us up out of Egypt?
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Môis: “Tơ dêh Êyiptơ ưh kơ đei anih 'bŭ bơngai ôh hă, na ih ngĕ kơ chông ba lu nhôn năm lôch tơ char glă? Ih wă pơm kiơ kơ nhôn, ăn kơ lu nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ?

English: Is this not the word that we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us alone that we may serve the Egyptians’? For it would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than that we should die in the wilderness.”
Bahnar: Kơplah oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ lu nhôn đei khan kơ ih bơih. Lê̆ lu nhôn pơm đĭch đam kon pơlei Êyiptơ, chu bơ̆jang ăn lu sư đĕch hiôk hloh kơ wă lôch tơ char glă!”

English: And Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid. Stand still, and see the salvation of the LORD, which He will accomplish for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall see again no more forever.
Bahnar: Môis drơ̆ng kon pơlei khan: 'Nĕ kơ hli ôh, oei mă kơjăp bĕ, na lăng lu iĕm gô 'bôh tơdrong dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng Kră Yang năr âu, lu bơngai Êyiptơ mă lu iĕm 'bôh lu sư năr 'nâu, lu iĕm ưh pă đei layơ wă 'bôh lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: The LORD will fight for you, and you shall hold your peace.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô tơblah tơgŭm iĕm, lu iĕm kư̆ oei mă hơđơ̆ng.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Why do you cry to Me? Tell the children of Israel to go forward.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Liơ lu iĕm ôr krao chă Inh? Khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael kư̆ yak tơ anăp

English: But lift up your rod, and stretch out your hand over the sea and divide it. And the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
Bahnar: Na ih athei yơ̆r 'long jra tơ kơpal, chro ti tơ đak dơsĭ, tơklah lê̆ đak 'bar pah, na kon pơlei Isơrael gô jur lăm đak dơsĭ yak năm thoi kơpal teh hrĕng.

English: And I indeed will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall follow them. So I will gain honor over Pharaoh and over all his army, his chariots, and his horsemen.
Bahnar: Na Inh gô pơm kơ kon pơlei Êyiptơ kơ̆l arăng gô jur druh kiơ̆ kon pơlei Isơrael lăm đak dơsĭ, đơ̆ng noh Anăn Inh gô đei ư-ang yua kơ Pharaôn păng đĭ-đăng lu linh sư, lu bơngai chĕp gre aseh sư.

English: Then the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have gained honor for Myself over Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.”
Bahnar: Anăn Inh gô ư-ang yua kơ Pharaôn, gre aseh sư, lu linh chĕp gre aseh sư, lei na bơngai Êyiptơ gô băt kơ Inh Kră Yang.

English: And the Angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, moved and went behind them; and the pillar of cloud went from before them and stood behind them.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei năm adrol kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael kơplah noh păng hơlơ̆k yak kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư; na jrăng hơmơ̆l kư̆m năm đơ̆ng rŏng kơ kon pơlei

English: So it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel. Thus it was a cloud and darkness to the one, and it gave light by night to the other, so that the one did not come near the other all that night.
Bahnar: Jrăng hơmơ̆l dơ̆ng sơlam khŭl linh bơngai Êyiptơ păng khŭl linh kon pơlei Isơrael, đei hơmơ̆l găn măng mu tơ minh pah âu, na minh pah to hơdah na prăt măng 'bar khŭl ưh kơ đei gơh năm tơ jê̆ băl.

English: Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea into dry land, and the waters were divided.
Bahnar: Môis yơ̆r ti sư tơ đak dơsĭ Kră Yang pơm kial tih đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch tơthu tơ đak dơsĭ pơm kơ đak akŭm tơklah asong 'bar pah jing teh hrĕng

English: So the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea on the dry ground, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.
Bahnar: kon pơlei Isơrael jur lăm đak dơsĭ, yak năm thoi kơpal teh hrĕng; na đak pĕng thoi bơnơ̆ tơ 'bar pah gah 'ma păng gah 'ngiĕo kơ lu sư.

English: And the Egyptians pursued and went after them into the midst of the sea, all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Êyiptơ druh kiơ̆ lu sư; đĭ-đăng aseh, gre aseh sư păng lu chĕp gre aseh Pharaôn, lu sư mơ̆t kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng jur lăm tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ.

English: Now it came to pass, in the morning watch, that the LORD looked down upon the army of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and cloud, and He troubled the army of the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lăp măng wă đĭ, Kră Yang đơ̆ng lăm jrăng hơmơ̆l păng jrăng ŭnh, lăng tơ khŭl linh bơngai Êyiptơ, pơm hloi kơ lu sư hli hơwơ̆l hơwang.

English: And He took off their chariot wheels, so that they drove them with difficulty; and the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the face of Israel, for the LORD fights for them against the Egyptians.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm kơ lu jơ̆ng gre lu sư, tơplôh lu sư tŭn hor pơmat-tat gre aseh pă gơh kơdâu. Na bơngai Êyiptơ khan dih băl: Bĕ bơ̆n kơdâu weh đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael, yua kơ Kră Yang tơblah bơngai Êyiptơ dŏng lu sư.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians, on their chariots, and on their horsemen.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Yơ̆r bĕ ti ih tơ đak dơsĭ, wă kơ đak dơsĭ lơ̆p lu bơngai Êyiptơ păng khŭl linh chĕp gre aseh lu sư.

English: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and when the morning appeared, the sea returned to its full depth, while the Egyptians were fleeing into it. So the LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis yơ̆r ti sư hloi tơ đak dơsĭ, kiơ̆ pơgê oei hrôih, na đak dơsĭ hơlơ̆k klơ̆p thoi đêl, lu bơngai Êyiptơ kơdâu weh ră mă-lei Kră Yang tơlơ̆ pơlôch đĭ lu sư lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: Then the waters returned and covered the chariots, the horsemen, and all the army of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them. Not so much as one of them remained.
Bahnar: Na đak lơ̆p klơ̆p đĭ hloi khŭl linh chĕp gre aseh, hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh Pharaôn lu druh jur kiơ̆ kon pơlei Isơrael lăm đak dơsĭ, ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu klaih.

English: But the children of Israel had walked on dry land in the midst of the sea, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu kon pơlei Isơrael năm yak tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ thoi kơpal teh kông hrĕng; đak pơm bơnơ̆ pĕng gah 'ma păng gah 'ngiĕo.

English: So the LORD saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.
Bahnar: Lăm năr 'noh, Kră Yang pơklaih kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng ti bơngai Êyiptơ; kon pơlei Isơrael 'bôh hnơ̆k hnăk bơngai Êyiptơ lôch cheng đak dơsĭ.

English: Thus Israel saw the great work which the LORD had done in Egypt; so the people feared the LORD, and believed the LORD and His servant Moses.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael 'bôh bơih tơdrong tih mă Kră Yang đei pơm kơ bơngai Êyiptơ, na lu kon pơlei Isơrael hli yom gơnang kơ Kră Yang păng lui kơ Môis, đĭch đam Sư.

English: Then Moses and the children of Israel sang this song to the LORD, and spoke, saying: “I will sing to the LORD, For He has triumphed gloriously! The horse and its rider He has thrown into the sea!
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Môis păng kon pơlei Isơrael hơri 'bai 'nâu kơ Kră Yang, khan: Inh gô hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư mơsêh mơyang tih. Kră Yang klơ̆m lê̆ aseh păng bơngai hao aseh lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: The LORD is my strength and song, And He has become my salvation; He is my God, and I will praise Him; My father’s God, and I will exalt Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang bơih jơhngơ̆m pran kơtang inh păng tơdrong hơri inh: Sư bơih tơ'ngla pơklaih inh. Sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, inh wă hơri ư-ang kơ Sư; Sư jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ 'bok yă inh, na inh đĭ jơhngơ̆m gô kơkuh pơyom kơ sư.

English: The LORD is a man of war; The LORD is His name.
Bahnar: Kră Yang thoi linh tơblah; Anăn Sư Kră Yang.

English: Pharaoh’s chariots and his army He has cast into the sea; His chosen captains also are drowned in the Red Sea.
Bahnar: Kră Yang, sư klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ bơih khŭl linh păng đĭ-đăng gre aseh; Lu yŏng linh bơngai mă Pharaôn rơih iŏk lôch hiong đĭ lăm đak dơsĭ 'Brê

English: The depths have covered them; They sank to the bottom like a stone.
Bahnar: Đak jrŭ klơ̆p gom lu sư; Lu sư krăm truh tơ kơđĕl đak dơsĭ thoi minh pôm tơmo.

English: “Your right hand, O LORD, has become glorious in power; Your right hand, O LORD, has dashed the enemy in pieces.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Ti gah 'ma Ih pran kơtang mơsêh mơyang. Ơ Kră Yang! Ti gah 'ma Ih pơrăm boih lu linh ayăt.

English: And in the greatness of Your excellence You have overthrown those who rose against You; You sent forth Your wrath; It consumed them like stubble.
Bahnar: Hăm tơdrong pran kơtang mơsêh mơyang tih krưp Ih, pơrăm boih lu bơngai blah Ih; tơdrong Ih hil mĭl, Soh pơrăm lu sư thoi ŭnh sa hơnong ba.

English: And with the blast of Your nostrils The waters were gathered together; The floods stood upright like a heap; The depths congealed in the heart of the sea.
Bahnar: Hơyuh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Ih tơthu bơ̆ lê̆ đak khơ̆t tŏk thoi bơnơ̆; Anih đak jrŭ jing arăng lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: The enemy said, ‘I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; My desire shall be satisfied on them. I will draw my sword, My hand shall destroy them.’
Bahnar: Linh ayăt khan: Bơ̆n druh, bơ̆n gô druh tam, Bơ̆n gô hiôk asong băl tơmam đơ̆ng bơ̆n blah iŏk; Inh toh đao gưm pơlôch lu sư.

English: You blew with Your wind, The sea covered them; They sank like lead in the mighty waters.
Bahnar: Ih tơthu kial lĕch, kial đơ̆ng Ih đak dơsĭ lơ̆p lê̆ lu sư boih; lu sư krăm thoi kơtuăl bơlơ̆k tơ kơđĕl đak jrŭ.

English: “Who is like You, O LORD, among the gods? Who is like You, glorious in holiness, Fearful in praises, doing wonders?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Lăm lu yang bu yang, thoi Ih? 'Lơ̆ng rơgoh, mơsêh mơyang, mă đei ư-ang, Trŏ kơ hli, trŏ kơ pơyom, gơh pơm dôm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp.

English: You stretched out Your right hand; The earth swallowed them.
Bahnar: Ih yơ̆r ti 'ma Ih, Teh 'bŭ klơ̆p lê̆ lu sư.

English: You in Your mercy have led forth The people whom You have redeemed; You have guided them in Your strength To Your holy habitation.
Bahnar: Hăm jơhngơ̆m Ih 'mêm mơnat sĭt dui anhăk kon pơlei 'nâu mă Ih đei huai iŏk boih; Ih yua tơdrong pran kơtang pơgơ̆r lu sư wih tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mă Ih oei.

English: “The people will hear and be afraid; Sorrow will take hold of the inhabitants of Philistia.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch bơngai tơmoi, lu sư hli tơtơ̆. Kon pơlei Philistin hli krưp tih tơpă.

English: Then the chiefs of Edom will be dismayed; The mighty men of Moab, Trembling will take hold of them; All the inhabitants of Canaan will melt away.
Bahnar: Lu kră pơgơ̆r Eđôm hli tơrơ rŭng răng dêh. Dôm lu kră pơgơ̆r char Môap dai hli tơtơ̆; Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm char Kanaan jơhngơ̆m rŭng răng đĭ.

English: Fear and dread will fall on them; By the greatness of Your arm They will be as still as a stone, Till Your people pass over, O LORD, Till the people pass over Whom You have purchased.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli tơrơ dêh truh tơ lu sư; Ơ Kră Yang! Kơkŏng ti pran kơtang Ih. Lu sư jing kơmlo nhen thoi tơmo, Tơ̆p mă truh layơ kon pơlei Ih yak hlôi; Tơ̆p mă truh kon pơlei mă Ih huai iŏk boih yak hlôi đĭ.

English: You will bring them in and plant them In the mountain of Your inheritance, In the place, O LORD, which You have made For Your own dwelling, The sanctuary, O Lord, which Your hands have established.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Ih gô ba lu sư mơ̆t păng pơtăm lu sư tơ kơpal kông Ih. Ơ Kră Yang; anih Ih đei hơmet boih, wă pơm anih Ih oei, Ơ Kră Yang! Anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mă ti Ih đei pơjing boih.

English: “The LORD shall reign forever and ever.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơgơ̆r ling-lang, hlŏng hloi.

English: For the horses of Pharaoh went with his chariots and his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought back the waters of the sea upon them. But the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
Bahnar: Kơplah aseh Pharaôn, gre aseh sư, hăm lu bơngai chĕp gre aseh sư, đak dơsĭ klơ̆p lê̆ lu sư boih. Kră Yang iŏk đak dơsĭ klơ̆p tơ kơpal lu sư, Mă-lei gah kon pơlei Isơrael năm rok tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ thoi năm tơ kơpal teh hrĕng.

English: Then Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took the timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
Bahnar: Miriam mŏ Arôn bơngai drŏ-kăn khan lê̆ adrol păng lu drŏ-kăn dai kiơ̆, đơ̆ng rŏng chĕp hơgơ̆r iĕ suang rah.

English: And Miriam answered them: “Sing to the LORD, For He has triumphed gloriously! The horse and its rider He has thrown into the sea!”
Bahnar: Miriam hơri tơl lu sư: Hơri ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư mơsêh mơyang tih hloh. Sư klơ̆m lê̆ aseh păng bơngai hao aseh lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: So Moses brought Israel from the Red Sea; then they went out into the Wilderness of Shur. And they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
Bahnar: Môis chông kon pơlei Isơrael năm đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ 'brê, lu sư năm truh tơ tơmăn glă Sur; pêng năr kơ trong năm lăm tơmăn glă, chă đak ưh kơ đei.

English: Now when they came to Marah, they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were bitter. Therefore the name of it was called Marah.
Bahnar: Wă truh tơ Mara đei đak, mă-lei đak tơ noh tăng, nhă ưh kơ gơh na anih 'nâu đe krao Mara.a

English: And the people complained against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơma jŏk kơ Môis khan: Lu nhôn wă nhă kiơ.

English: So he cried out to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a tree. When he cast it into the waters, the waters were made sweet. There He made a statute and an ordinance for them, and there He tested them
Bahnar: Môis krao apinh Kră Yang; Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ sư minh pôm dơng 'long, sư iŏk klơ̆m lăm đak, na đak jing 'lơ̆ng. Na tơ noh, Kră Yang ăn tơdrong juăt hăm tơdrong tơtă ăn kơ kon pơlei păng tơ noh sư pơlong lăng lu sư.

English: and said, “If you diligently heed the voice of the LORD your God and do what is right in His sight, give ear to His commandments and keep all His statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you which I have brought on the Egyptians. For I am the LORD who heals you.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: Tơdah iĕm mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Inh tơdah iĕm mơ̆ng nơ̆r tơtă păng wei răk dôm tơdrong juăt Inh, lei Inh ưh kơ đei tuh kơ iĕm minh tơdrong jĭ jăn mă inh tuh ăn boih kơ dêh Êyiptơ; Inh boih Kră Yang, tơ'ngla pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng jĭ jăn.

English: Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve wells of water and seventy palm trees; so they camped there by the waters.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei truh tơ Êlim; tơ noh đei mơjĭt-'bar tŏ tu đak mơlĕch păng tơpơh-jĭt 'long gol, kon pơlei oei pơdơh, jê̆ đak noh.

English: And they journeyed from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the Wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they departed from the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei 'bar, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, lu bơngai Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng anih Êlim năm truh tơ tơmăn glă Sin oei tŏk-bŏk Êlim păng Sinai.

English: Then the whole congregation of the children of Israel complained against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael hil jŏk kơ Môis păng Arôn tơ tơmăn glă

English: And the children of Israel said to them, “Oh, that we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the pots of meat and when we ate bread to the full! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to kill this whole assembly with hunger.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael khan kơ bre sư: Ô! Kơtrơ̆m lu nhôn jah lôch lăm tơpang ti Kră Yang tơ dêh Êyiptơ đĕch, kơplah oei jê̆ gŏ 'nhĕm păng sŏng sa phĭ! Mă-lei măr iĕm chông ba lu nhôn năm tơ tơmăn glă 'nâu wă kơ lu nhôn lôch đĭ kơ pơngot.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you. And the people shall go out and gather a certain quota every day, that I may test them, whether they will walk in My law or not.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Inh gô ăn 'bĕng đơ̆ng plĕnh jur thoi 'mi kơ lu iĕm. Kon pơlei gô năm rim năr dônh, dônh tôm mah sa kơ năr 'noh, Inh wă pơlong lăng lu sư hăm đei pơm kiơ̆ thoi Inh athei dah ưh.

English: And it shall be on the sixth day that they shall prepare what they bring in, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.”
Bahnar: Truh năr mă tơdrâu, kon pơlei gô dônh lơ hloh 'bar wơ̆t kơ lu sư juăt kơ dônh rim năr.

English: Then Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, “At evening you shall know that the LORD has brought you out of the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis păng Arôn khan kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael: Gơsơ̆ kơnh lu iĕm gô băt kơ Kră Yang dui ba lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ

English: And in the morning you shall see the glory of the LORD; for He hears your complaints against the LORD. But what are we, that you complain against us?”
Bahnar: Na pơgê dơning lu iĕm gô 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang tih Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r lu iĕm hil jŏk kơ Sư, lu nhôn âu bu na mă lu iĕm mah hil jŏk kơ lu nhôn?

English: Also Moses said, “This shall be seen when the LORD gives you meat to eat in the evening, and in the morning bread to the full; for the LORD hears your complaints which you make against Him. And what are we? Your complaints are not against us but against the LORD.”
Bahnar: Môis khan dơ̆ng: Lu iĕm gô 'bôh Kră Yang ăn 'nhĕm sa kơsơ̆ 'nâu, 'bĕng sa pơgê dơning, yua kơ Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r lu iĕm hil jŏk kơ Sư. Lu nhôn âu bu? Dôm nơ̆r lu iĕm hil jŏk ưh kơ trŏ kơ hil jŏk kơ lu nhôn ôh, mă tơpă noh iĕm hil jŏk kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then Moses spoke to Aaron, “Say to all the congregation of the children of Israel, ‘Come near before the LORD, for He has heard your complaints.’ ”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Arôn: Khan bĕ kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael: Năm jê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r lu iĕm jŏk hil.

English: Now it came to pass, as Aaron spoke to the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.
Bahnar: Kơplah Arôn oei pơma hăm kon pơlei Isơrael, lu sư lăng tơ gah tơmăn glă, 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang rang hơdah tih Kră Yang tơ hơmơ̆l.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “I have heard the complaints of the children of Israel. Speak to them, saying, ‘At twilight you shall eat meat, and in the morning you shall be filled with bread. And you shall know that I am the LORD your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r kon pơlei Isơrael hil jŏk. Na ih athei khan kơ lu sư: Gơsơ̆ kơnh lu iĕm gô sa 'nhĕm hrăp; pơgê dơning lu iĕm gô sa 'bĕng phĭ rơkah; na lu iĕm gô băt Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: So it was that quails came up at evening and covered the camp, and in the morning the dew lay all around the camp.
Bahnar: Lăp truh kơsơ̆, đei sem wăt jruh kôp 'bĕnh jơ̆p kơ anih; truh pơgê dơning đei tŭk gom jơ̆p kơ anih lu sư pơdơh.

English: And when the layer of dew lifted, there, on the surface of the wilderness, was a small round substance, as fine as frost on the ground.
Bahnar: Wă tŭk đak ngom noh hach boih, kơpal teh tơ tơmăn glă 'bôh đei kiơ iĕ, hmŏng thoi prĕl.

English: So when the children of Israel saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?” For they did not know what it was. And Moses said to them, “This is the bread which the LORD has given you to eat.
Bahnar: Lăp kon pơlei Isơrael 'bôh tơmam noh, lu sư apinh dih băl: Kiơ 'noh? Yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ băt ôh tơmam 'noh yă kiơ. Môis khan kơ lu kon pơlei: “'Noh 'bĕng mă Kră Yang ăn kơ lu iĕm sa.

English: This is the thing which the LORD has commanded: ‘Let every man gather it according to each one’s need, one omer for each person, according to the number of persons; let every man take for those who are in his tent.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong Kră Yang tơtă: ‘Rim 'nu lu iĕm athei dônh 'bĕng noh tôm kơ mah sa năr noh, minh ômera kơ rim 'nu, kiơ̆ kơ mah sa rim 'nu bơngai lăm bơsŭn iĕm dôm yơ.

English: Then the children of Israel did so and gathered, some more, some less.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael pơm hloi thoi noh; phŏ bơngai dônh lơ, mơ'nah bơngai dônh tŏ sĕt

English: So when they measured it by omers, he who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack. Every man had gathered according to each one’s need.
Bahnar: Lu sư kŏng hăm ômer, bu dônh lơ kư̆m ưh kơ rơkah, bu dônh tŏ sĕt kư̆m huay ưh kơmah, rim 'nu bơngai dônh lăp kơ sa mah.

English: And Moses said, “Let no one leave any of it till morning.”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ lu sư: 'Nĕ kơ 'măn lê̆ truh pơgê.

English: Notwithstanding they did not heed Moses. But some of them left part of it until morning, and it bred worms and stank. And Moses was angry with them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei mơ'nah lu sư ưh kơ mơ̆ng ôh nơ̆r Môis; đei bơngai 'măn truh tơtil pơgê; na đei hrai păng 'bâu ôm. Na Môis hil kơ lu sư.

English: So they gathered it every morning, every man according to his need. And when the sun became hot, it melted.
Bahnar: Na rim pơgê rim 'nu bơngai dônh lăp mah kơ sư sa; lăp truh 'năr tŏ boih na tơmam noh hach đĭ.

English: And so it was, on the sixth day, that they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one. And all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
Bahnar: Truh năr tơdrâu, kon pơlei dônh tơmam sa pơhloh lê̆ 'bar; rim bơngai 'bar ômer. Lu bơngai kră pơgơ̆r năm roi kơ Môis.

English: Then he said to them, “This is what the LORD has said: ‘Tomorrow is a Sabbath rest, a holy Sabbath to the LORD. Bake what you will bake today, and boil what you will boil; and lay up for yourselves all that remains, to be kept until morning.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư tơl khan: 'Noh nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă boih: Dơning jing năr pơdơh, năr Sa'bat 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang, phang bĕ tơmam kiơ lu iĕm wă phang, pai bĕ tơmam kiơ lu iĕm wă pai; oei wă 'măn lê̆ truh tơ pơgê dơning.

English: So they laid it up till morning, as Moses commanded; and it did not stink, nor were there any worms in it.
Bahnar: Thoi noh kon pơlei 'măn lê̆ hloi truh tơ pơgê dơning, rok thoi Môis đei tơtă; tơmam 'noh ưh kơ đei ôm ôh păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei hrai sa.

English: Then Moses said, “Eat that today, for today is a Sabbath to the LORD; today you will not find it in the field.
Bahnar: Môis khan: Năr 'nâu sa bĕ tơmam 'noh, yua kơ năr 'nâu năr Sa'bat Kră Yang; năr 'nâu lu iĕm chă ưh kơ đei ôh tơmam noh tơ kơpal teh.

English: Six days you shall gather it, but on the seventh day, the Sabbath, there will be none.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm dônh lăm tơdrâu năr; mă-lei năr mă tơpơh năr Sa'bat, ưh pă đei 'bĕng noh ôh.

English: Now it happened that some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found none.
Bahnar: Năr tơpơh đei lu bơngai lăm kon pơlei lĕch wă chă dônh 'bĕng noh, mă-lei lu sư chă ưh kơ 'bôh ôh.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “How long do you refuse to keep My commandments and My laws?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Lu iĕm ưh kơ chu yom wei răk nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt Inh dĭng truh dang yơ dơ̆ng?

English: See! For the LORD has given you the Sabbath; therefore He gives you on the sixth day bread for two days. Let every man remain in his place; let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.”
Bahnar: Athei tơchĕng lăng, Kră Yang ăn boih kơ lu iĕm năr Sa'bat; na lei, truh năr tơdrâu Kră Yang ăn kơ lu iĕm 'bĕng sa mah kơ 'bar năr. Wă kơ rim 'nu bơngai athei oei kơtă anih kơdih, ưh kơ gơh bơngai bu lĕch tơ 'nguaih ôh lăm năr tơpơh.

English: So the people rested on the seventh day.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, năr tơpơh kon pơlei pơdơh.

English: And the house of Israel called its name Manna. And it was like white coriander seed, and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung Isơrael krao anăn tơmam sa 'nâu mana;b sư thoi găr hla ngo, kok, sa 'ngam thoi 'bĕng pơm hăm đak sut.

English: Then Moses said, “This is the thing which the LORD has commanded: ‘Fill an omer with it, to be kept for your generations, that they may see the bread with which I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.’ ”
Bahnar: Môis khan: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă: Athei tah mong lê̆ minh ômer mana, wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai rim jơhnơr 'bôh 'bĕng Inh 'me lu iĕm tơ lăm char glă, kơplah Inh chông tơlĕch lu iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a pot and put an omer of manna in it, and lay it up before the LORD, to be kept for your generations.”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Arôn: Athei iŏk minh pôm gĕl tah mong minh ômer mana, pơdơ̆ng lê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, wă wei răk truh tơ jơhnơr đơ̆ng rŏng.

English: As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang tơtă kơ Môis, Arôn pơdơ̆ng get 'noh 'bơ̆t anăp hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p.

English: And the children of Israel ate manna forty years, until they came to an inhabited land; they ate manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael sa mana lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm, tơ̆p truh tơ lu sư mơ̆t oei tơ dêh Kanaan.

English: Now an omer is one-tenth of an ephah.
Bahnar: Na, ômer jơ̆ minh lăm mơjĭt êpha.c

English: Then all the congregation of the children of Israel set out on their journey from the Wilderness of Sin, according to the commandment of the LORD, and camped in Rephidim; but there was no water for the people to drink.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael năm tơ âu, tơ to đơ̆ng char glă Sin, năm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă kơ lu sư, na lu sư oei pơdơh tơ Rêphiđim: Tơ noh ưh kơ đei đak nhă ôh kơ kon pơlei.

English: Therefore the people contended with Moses, and said, “Give us water, that we may drink.” So Moses said to them, “Why do you contend with me? Why do you tempt the LORD?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh kon pơlei tơhil hăm Môis khan: Ăn kơ lu nhôn đak nhă bĕ. Môis tơl khan: Liơ mă lu iĕm wă tơhil hăm inh? Liơ lu iĕm wă pơlong lăng Kră Yang lĕ?

English: And the people thirsted there for water, and the people complained against Moses, and said, “Why is it you have brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our livestock with thirst?”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei oei tơ noh ưh kơ đei đak, rơhing 'maih nhă, na hil jŏk kơ Môis khan: Liơ ih chông ba lu nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, wă kơ lu nhôn, kon sâu nhôn păng sem dơrong lôch rơhing kơ đak?

English: So Moses cried out to the LORD, saying, “What shall I do with this people? They are almost ready to stone me!”
Bahnar: Môis krao apinh Kră Yang khan: Inh wă pơm liơ hăm kon pơlei 'nâu? Lu sư 'maih wă klơ̆m inh păng tơmo!

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Go on before the people, and take with you some of the elders of Israel. Also take in your hand your rod with which you struck the river, and go.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơl Môis: Năm bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei chĕp 'long jra mă ih teh tơ đak krong Nil sơ̆ păng, chông ba lu kră bơngai Isơrael, na năm hơdai ih.

English: Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock in Horeb; and you shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, that the people may drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
Bahnar: Inh gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp ih, kơpal tơmo tơ kông Hôrêp; ih athei teh tơmo noh, na đak gô lĕch đơ̆ng lăm tơmo noh wă ăn kơ kon pơlei nhă. Môis pơm hloi thoi noh 'bơ̆t anăp măt lu kră kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: So he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, because of the contention of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, “Is the LORD among us or not?”
Bahnar: Sư krao anăn anih noh Masaa păng Mêrib yua kơ kon pơlei Isơrael hil jŏk păng pơlong lăng Kră Yang, khan: Hăm đei Kră Yang oei hăm lu bơ̆n ưh?

English: Now Amalek came and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, kon pơlei Amalek năm wă tơblah hăm kon pơlei Isơrael tơ Rêphiđim.

English: And Moses said to Joshua, “Choose us some men and go out, fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Jôsuê: Rơih iŏk bĕ lu bơngai nuih kơtang, năm tơblah hăm kon pơlei Amalek; năr dơning inh gô dơ̆ng tơ kơpal groi, chĕp 'long jra Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm ti.

English: So Joshua did as Moses said to him, and fought with Amalek. And Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
Bahnar: Jôsuê pơm hloi thoi nơ̆r Môis khan kơ sư, tơblah hăm kon pơlei Amalek; na Môis, Arôn păng Hur tŏk tơ kơpal groi kơjung.

English: And so it was, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
Bahnar: Wă Môis yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal, lei jei kon pơlei Isơrael wă tơjruh ti sư jei kon pơlei Amalek.

English: But Moses’ hands became heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it. And Aaron and Hur supported his hands, one on one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
Bahnar: Ti Môis rơgah boih Arôn păng Hur iŏk tơmo dan kơ sư tơoei, na bre sư dơ̆ng 'bar pah chĕp tơiung ti Môis tơ kơpal; na ti sư oei yơ̆r dĭng truh tơ năr mơ̆t.

English: So Joshua defeated Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
Bahnar: Jôsuê iŏk đao gưm blah tŭk lu linh păng kon pơlei Amalek.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Write this for a memorial in the book and recount it in the hearing of Joshua, that I will utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Athei chih tơdrong 'nâu lăm sơ̆p hla bơar akar wă 'blŏk hơdơ̆r păng tơbăt ăn kơ Jôsuê Inh gô sŭt pơgoh ưh pă đei bu 'blŏk kơ bơngai Amalek lăm teh âu dơ̆ng.

English: And Moses built an altar and called its name, The-LORD-Is-My-Banner
Bahnar: Môis pơdơ̆ng minh pôm chơnang soi, krao anăn Kră Yang Hla-kơ inh

English: for he said, “Because the LORD has sworn: the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: Đei bơngai yơ̆r hla-kơ Kră Yang ling-lang, na Kră Yang tơblah hăm bơngai Amalek đơ̆ng jơhnơr 'nâu truh tơ jơhnơr nai.

English: And Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses and for Israel His people—that the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt.
Bahnar: Jêthrô, 'bok soi dêh Madian tơnei Môis, kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơm ăn kơ Môis hăm kon pơlei Isơrael păng Kră Yang chông ba kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ thoi yơ.

English: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her back
Bahnar: Sư chông ba hloi Sêpôra, akăn Môis, mă Môis ăn sư wih ngôi tơ hnam 'bă sư.

English: with her two sons, of whom the name of one was Gershom (for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land”)
Bahnar: Hăm 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo sư, minh 'nu anăn sư Gersôm,a yua kơ Môis khan boih inh chă năm oei pơdơh tơ char lu tơmoi

English: and the name of the other was Eliezer (for he said, “The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh”)
Bahnar: păng minh 'nu anăn Êliêser,b yua kơ sư đei khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bă inh tơgŭm păng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng đao gưm Pharaôn.

English: and Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
Bahnar: Na, Jêthrô, tơnei Môis năm chông ba 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng akăn Môis, năm ngôi apong tơ anih char glă, anih Môis oei pơdơh jê̆ kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now he had said to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and her two sons with her.”
Bahnar: Jêthrô athei đe năm khan kơ Môis băt: Inh Jêthrô tơnei ih năm ngôi apong tơ ih hơdai hăm akăn ih păng 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo ih.

English: So Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, bowed down, and kissed him. And they asked each other about their well-being, and they went into the tent.
Bahnar: Môis năm sơng tơnei sư, drap tơ teh kơkuh păng chŭm sư, apinh jet gia dih băl hăm oei 'lơ̆ng akâu. Na mơ̆t lăm bơsŭn.

English: And Moses told his father-in-law all that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardship that had come upon them on the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.
Bahnar: Môis ră roi ăn kơ tơnei sư băt tôm tơdrong Kră Yang pơm kơ Pharaôn păng bơngai Êyiptơ sư kư̆m roi gah lu bơngai Isơrael dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat truh kơ lu sư rok trong păng Kră Yang tơgŭm pơklaih lu sư liơ liơ.

English: Then Jethro rejoiced for all the good which the LORD had done for Israel, whom He had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Jêthrô lăm jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk chơt dêh kơ dôm tơdrong mơsêh mă Kră Yang pơm păng pơklaih kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai Êyiptơ.

English: And Jethro said, “Blessed be the LORD, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians and out of the hand of Pharaoh, and who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Na Jêthrô pơma khan: Trŏ bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang tơpă! Tơ'ngla pơklaih boih lu iĕm lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng ti bơngai Êyiptơ păng đơ̆ng ti Pharaôn.

English: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all the gods; for in the very thing in which they behaved proudly, He was above them.”
Bahnar: Dang ei inh băt boih Kră Yang tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng yang, yua kơ Sư pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai Êyiptơ mă pơm kơ lu iĕm kơnê̆ dêh.

English: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt offering and other sacrifices to offer to God. And Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
Bahnar: Jêthrô, tơnei Môis, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng dôm tơmam pơyơ̆r nai ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; đơ̆ng noh Arôn păng lu kră bơngai Isơrael sŏng sa hơdai hăm tơnei Môis 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And so it was, on the next day, that Moses sat to judge the people; and the people stood before Moses from morning until evening.
Bahnar: Truh pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng, Môis hơ-oei sek tơlang kơ kon pơlei; kon pơlei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp sư đơ̆ng pơgê truh tơ kơsơ̆.

English: So when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing for the people? Why do you alone sit, and all the people stand before you from morning until evening?”
Bahnar: Tơnei Môis 'bôh dôm tơdrong Môis pơm kơ kon pơlei, na sư khan: Kon pơm kiơ kơ kon pơlei? Liơ ih hơ-oei na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei dơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ ih đơ̆ng pơgê hrôih truh tơ kơsơ̆ thoi noh?

English: And Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
Bahnar: Môis tơl: 'Noh yua kơ kon pơlei sư năm tơ inh wă kơ băt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ lu sư pơm thoi yơ.

English: When they have a difficulty, they come to me, and I judge between one and another; and I make known the statutes of God and His laws.”
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư đei tơdrong kiơ, lei lu sư năm tơ inh, wă kơ inh tơlang ăn kơ tơdrong lu sư păng bơtho tơblang ăn lu sư băt tơdrong juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: So Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing that you do is not good.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơnei sư khan dơ̆ng: Dôm tơdrong ih pơm noh ưh kơ trŏ ôh.

English: Both you and these people who are with you will surely wear yourselves out. For this thing is too much for you; you are not able to perform it by yourself.
Bahnar: Tơpă, ih hăm kon pơlei oei hơdai ih gô rơdu rơmơ̆n ưh kơ weh ôh, tơdrong noh trăp dêh kơ ih, minh 'nu ih pŭ ưh kơ kĕ ôh.

English: Listen now to my voice; I will give you counsel, and God will be with you: Stand before God for the people, so that you may bring the difficulties to God.
Bahnar: Na dang ei, athei mơ̆ng bĕ, inh bơtho tơ'bôh kơ ih, hơpơi apinh Kră Yang oei hơdai ih. Ăn kơ ih jing bơngai tang măt ăn kơ kon pơlei 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng roi dôm tơdrong lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And you shall teach them the statutes and the laws, and show them the way in which they must walk and the work they must do.
Bahnar: Ih athei bơtho tơtă ăn tơdrong juăt Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư oei arih sa thoi yơ păng tơdrong kiơ gơh pơm.

English: Moreover you shall select from all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
Bahnar: Lei na rơih iŏk bĕ lăm kon pơlei dôm bơngai drŏ-nglo gơh hơgei hlôh wao, băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă tơpă, areh kơ tơdrong ưh kơ trŏ, na pôk lu sư pơm bơngai wei-lăng minh-rơbâu 'nu, minh-hrĕng 'nu, kơ pơđăm-jĭt 'nu, kơ mơjĭt 'nu bơngai.

English: And let them judge the people at all times. Then it will be that every great matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they themselves shall judge. So it will be easier for you, for they will bear the burden with you.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư chă sek tơlang ăn kơ kon pơlei rim năr. Tơdah đei tơdrong truh tih, lu sư athei ba tơ ih; na mă dôm tơdrong iĕ, lu sư chă sek tơlang kơdih. Lei na tơdrong jang ih hơiơch 'biơ̆; lu sư gô wang pŭ tơdrong jang hơdai ih.

English: If you do this thing, and God so commands you, then you will be able to endure, and all this people will also go to their place in peace.”
Bahnar: Tơdah ih pơm thoi noh păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ăn thoi noh mơ̆n, ih gô kĕ pơm keh đang đĭ dôm tơdrong jang păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kư̆m đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk hơđơ̆ng wih brŏk tơ hnam.

English: So Moses heeded the voice of his father-in-law and did all that he had said.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis chu nơ̆r tơnei sư, pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong tơnei sư bơtho boih.

English: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people: rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
Bahnar: Na, Môis rơih hloi lu bơngai drŏ-nglo gơh hơgei đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei Isơrael, pôk ăn pơm yŏng wei-lăng kon pơlei kơ minh-rơbâu 'nu, kơ minh-hrĕng 'nu, kơ pơđăm-jĭt 'nu, kơ mơjĭt 'nu bơngai

English: So they judged the people at all times; the hard cases they brought to Moses, but they judged every small case themselves.
Bahnar: lu sư chă sek tơlang kơ kon pơlei ling-lang. Dôm tơdrong anat lu sư ba ăn tơ Môis sek mă-lei lu sư sek tơlang dôm lu tơdrong iĕ 'bônh.

English: Then Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went his way to his own land.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Môis ba tơnei sư wih tơ dêh sư kơdih.

English: In the third month after the children of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on the same day, they came to the Wilderness of Sinai.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, 'nao pêng khei kon pơlei Isơrael truh tơ char glă Sinai.

English: For they had departed from Rephidim, had come to the Wilderness of Sinai, and camped in the wilderness. So Israel camped there before the mountain.
Bahnar: Lĕch đơ̆ng Rêphiđim năm truh tơ char glă Sinai păng oei pơm bơsŭn pơdơh 'bơ̆t anăp kông.

English: And Moses went up to God, and the LORD called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus you shall say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel
Bahnar: Môis tŏk tơ kông năm tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kră Yang krao sư đơ̆ng kơpal kông khan: Ih athei roi ăn kơ adrĕch Jakôp păng roi tơbăt dơ̆ng kơ kon pơlei Isơrael

English: ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Myself.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong Inh pơm kơ bơngai Êyiptơ, Inh pôk glơng lu iĕm thoi kơpal pơnăr sem klang, wă chông lu iĕm tơ Inh.

English: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey My voice and keep My covenant, then you shall be a special treasure to Me above all people; for all the earth is Mine.
Bahnar: Na, tơdah lu iĕm chu yom Inh păng wei răk dôm tơdrong Inh pơgơ̆p pơkă, lei lăm đĭ-đăng kơ dêh char, lu iĕm boih jing tơmam gĭt Inh. Mă khan đĭ-đăng teh đak jing tơmam Inh ngăl.

English: And you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words which you shall speak to the children of Israel.”
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm jing teh đak 'bok soi păng adrĕch adrung kon pơlei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, noh boih nơ̆r ih gô pơma hăm kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: So Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before them all these words which the LORD commanded him.
Bahnar: Môis wih krao akŭm lu kră, na roi ăn kơ lu sư dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă ăn athei sư pơma.

English: Then all the people answered together and said, “All that the LORD has spoken we will do.” So Moses brought back the words of the people to the LORD.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei minh jơhngơ̆m tơl khan: Lu nhôn gô pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Kră Yang pơkă, Môis roi hloi kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r kon pơlei pơma.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, I come to you in the thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with you, and believe you forever.” So Moses told the words of the people to the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Inh gô năm tơ ih lăm hơmơ̆l hơ'bơ̆l; wă kơplah Inh pơma dơnuh hăm ih, na kon pơlei Isơrael kơtơ̆ng wă kơ lu sư lui gơnang kơ ih ling-lang, Môis roi kơ Kră Yang nơ̆r kon pơlei Isơrael đei pơma.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their clothes.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Ih năm bĕ tơ kon pơlei, Isơrael athei kon pơlei hơmet akâu kơdih mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh năr 'nâu păng năr dơning, athei lu sư pih ao tai.

English: And let them be ready for the third day. For on the third day the LORD will come down upon Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư kơchăng lăm năr mă pêng, yua năr noh Kră Yang wă jur tơ kơpal kông Sinai 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei.

English: You shall set bounds for the people all around, saying, ‘Take heed to yourselves that you do not go up to the mountain or touch its base. Whoever touches the mountain shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Na ih athei war găn jum dăr kơ kông păng pơkă khan kơ lu sư: Athei kơchăng ưh kơ gơh tŏk tơ kơpal kông, dah hơtŭt 'bơm jơ̆ng kông, bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm kông đe gô pơlôch.

English: Not a hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot with an arrow; whether man or beast, he shall not live.’ When the trumpet sounds long, they shall come near the mountain.”
Bahnar: Gô klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo dah prah hăm hră; 'nĕ kơ ăn ti pel 'bơm bơngai noh, mă bơngai dah sem dơrong hơtŭt 'bơm kơ kông noh ưh kơ ăn arih ôh. Dĭng mưh kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm tơgiĕp na kon pơlei gơh năm tŏk tơ kông.

English: So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and sanctified the people, and they washed their clothes.
Bahnar: Môis jur đơ̆ng kông năm tơ kon pơlei, athei lu sư wei hơmet akâu mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng pih ao tai lu sư.

English: And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day; do not come near your wives.”
Bahnar: Na sư khan kơ kon pơlei: Lăm năr mă pêng lu iĕm athei kơchăng, 'nĕ năm jê̆ bơngai drŏ-kăn ôh.

English: Then it came to pass on the third day, in the morning, that there were thunderings and lightnings, and a thick cloud on the mountain; and the sound of the trumpet was very loud, so that all the people who were in the camp trembled.
Bahnar: Pơgê năr mă pêng, đei grơ̆m glaih kơmlat, hơmơ̆l kok hơ'bơ̆l dêh gom tơ kơpal kông păng kơtơ̆ng đei jơwa hlôm tơgiĕp re dêh pơm kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm bơsŭn hli tơrơ ngăl.

English: And Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
Bahnar: Môis chông kon pơlei lĕch đơ̆ng bơsŭn năm tơ'bơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; na kon pơlei gô tơ jơ̆ng kông.

English: Now Mount Sinai was completely in smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire. Its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked greatly.
Bahnar: 'Nhui gom jơ̆p kơ kông Sinai, yua kơ Kră Yang jur tơ lăm ŭnh: 'Nhui ŭnh noh tŏk tơ kơpal kơjung nhen thoi đơ̆ng tơnuh ŭnh tih păng jơ̆p kơ kông pơpơ̆ dêh.

English: And when the blast of the trumpet sounded long and became louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him by voice.
Bahnar: Păng Jơwa tơgiĕp re rai dêh; kơplah noh Môis pơma, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơl sư jơwa thoi grơ̆m.

English: Then the LORD came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain. And the LORD called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jur kơpal kơ̆l kông Sinai, Krao Môis tŏk tơ kông Môis tŏk hloi.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Go down and warn the people, lest they break through to gaze at the LORD, and many of them perish.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, ih jur bĕ khă kon pơlei 'nĕ kơ năm tơkan tơ jê̆ wă lăng Kră Yang, kơnh hli kơ lơ bơngai gô lôch.

English: Also let the priests who come near the LORD consecrate themselves, lest the LORD break out against them.”
Bahnar: Mă lu 'bok soi hai mưh wă năm jê̆ Kră Yang athei hơmet akâu sư mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, tơdah ưh kơnh Kră Yang kư̆m pơrăm lu sư.

English: But Moses said to the LORD, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai; for You warned us, saying, ‘Set bounds around the mountain and consecrate it.’ ”
Bahnar: Môis roi kơ Kră Yang: Kon pơlei ưh kơ gơh tŏk tơ kông Sinai ôh, yua kơ Ih đei tơtă kơ inh: Athei war găn jum dăr kơ kông păng wă 'măn anih kông noh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Then the LORD said to him, “Away! Get down and then come up, you and Aaron with you. But do not let the priests and the people break through to come up to the LORD, lest He break out against them.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, ih jur bĕ na chông ba Arôn tŏk hăm ih, mă-lei dôm lu 'bok soi păng kon pơlei 'nĕ kơ năm hlôi kơ war găn na tŏk tơ Inh, kơnh Inh pơlôch pơrăm lu sư.

English: So Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
Bahnar: Na, Môis jur đơ̆ng kông năm, roi ăn kơ kon pơlei băt tơdrong noh.

English: And God spoke all these words, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma dôm nơ̆r 'nâu, khan

English: “I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Bahnar: Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, pơklaih boih iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, đơ̆ng pơm đĭch đam.

English: “You shall have no other gods before Me.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu Inh đĕch, iĕm 'nĕ kơ đei lu yang nai.

English: “You shall not make for yourself a carved image—any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm lu rup man kơdih, kư̆m 'nĕ pơm rup ayơ nhen thoi tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti, dah tơ ala teh âu, dah tơ lăm ala đak sŭng.

English: you shall not bow down to them nor serve them. For I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp lu rup noh păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ soi sơmah kơ lu sư, yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kơ gar, dah bơngai bu areh kơ Inh, Inh gô jô̆ yoch đơ̆ng sư na phak truh tơ kon sâu se sư pêng puăn jơhnơr

English: but showing mercy to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
Bahnar: păng gô 'mêm dôm rơbâu jơhnơr kơ bơngai bu 'mêm kơ Inh păng wei răk khôi juăt Inh tơtă.

English: “You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ yua anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm wă pơma kư̆ kă, yua kơ Kră Yang ưh kơ achăng ôh bơngai bu yua anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă pơma kư̆ kă.

English: “Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Bahnar: Athei 'blŏk kơ năr tơpơh wă pơm năr giĕng.

English: Six days you shall labor and do all your work
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơm đĭ tơdrong jang kơdih lăm tơdrâu năr.

English: but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the LORD your God. In it you shall do no work: you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your cattle, nor your stranger who is within your gates.
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr mă tơpơh wă khan năr pơdơh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm: Lăm năr 'noh ih, kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn, đĭch đam sem dơrong ih, dah tơmoi oei lăm hnam ih, 'nĕ kơ jang minh tơdrong kiơ ôh

English: For in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day. Therefore the LORD blessed the Sabbath day and hallowed it.
Bahnar: yua kơ lăm tơdrâu năr Kră Yang đei pơjing plĕnh, teh, đak dơsĭ păng đĭ-đăng tơmam tơ lăm noh, năr tơpơh sư pơdơh: Na Kră Yang sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ năr tơpơh wă 'măn pơm năr giĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long upon the land which the LORD your God is giving you.
