Bahnar: Athei chu yom kơ mĕ 'bă ih, wă kơ ih gơh arih sot tơ kơpal teh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei ăn.

English: “You shall not murder.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơlôch bơngai.

English: “You shall not commit adultery.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ plah klo kăn đe, 'nĕ pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: “You shall not steal.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ tơtông klĕ.

English: “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh kơ bôl buăl.

English: “You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor’s.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ 'nhĕng kơ hnam đe, kư̆m lê̆ kơ 'nhĕng akăn đe, dah đĭch đam drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn, rơmo, aseh, dah mŭk tơmam đe.

English: Now all the people witnessed the thunderings, the lightning flashes, the sound of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they trembled and stood afar off.
Bahnar: Kơplah đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kơtơ̆ng grơ̆m păng jơwa tơgiĕp, 'bôh chêr 'blêt kơmlat, kông lĕch 'nhui, lu sư hli tơtey dơ̆ng tơ ataih.

English: Then they said to Moses, “You speak with us, and we will hear; but let not God speak with us, lest we die.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei khan kơ Môis: Apinh Ih jah pơma hăm lu nhôn na lu nhôn gô mơ̆ng 'nĕ ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma hăm lu nhôn, kơnh hli kơ lu nhôn lôch.

English: And Moses said to the people, “Do not fear; for God has come to test you, and that His fear may be before you, so that you may not sin.”
Bahnar: Môis tơl khan: Lê̆ kơ hli, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jur wă pơlong lăng lu iĕm, wă kơ iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m hli yom kơ sư, na huay kơ pơm yoch hăm sư.

English: So the people stood afar off, but Moses drew near the thick darkness where God was.
Bahnar: Na kon pơlei dơ̆ng đơ̆ng ataih, Môis năm jê̆ hơmơ̆l hơ'bơ̆l mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm noh.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: ‘You have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan Môis: Ih athei khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: Lu iĕm 'bôh boih Inh đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh pơma hăm lu iĕm

English: You shall not make anything to be with Me—gods of silver or gods of gold you shall not make for yourselves.
Bahnar: na, 'nĕ kơ man rup yang kơdih iĕm păng hu dah maih na pơting hăm Inh.

English: An altar of earth you shall make for Me, and you shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I record My name I will come to you, and I will bless you.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm kơ Inh minh pôm chơnang soi păng teh, kơpal noh athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh hăm tơmam soi hiôk-hian triu dah rơmo, tơ rim anih ayơ mă Inh ăn athei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Anăn Inh, Inh gô năm tuh ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ ih tơ noh.

English: And if you make Me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stone; for if you use your tool on it, you have profaned it.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih pơm kơ Inh minh pôm chơnang soi păng tơmo, 'nĕ kơ yua tơmo pơm păng ti, yua kơ đe blah tơmo păng ti, lei gô pơm kơ chơnang noh jing 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Nor shall you go up by steps to My altar, that your nakedness may not be exposed on it.’
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ tŏk hăm kung dah wă năm tơ chơnang soi kơnh 'bôh tơdrong brao ih.

English: “Now these are the judgments which you shall set before them
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong tơtă ih athei tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla

English: If you buy a Hebrew servant, he shall serve six years; and in the seventh he shall go out free and pay nothing.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih răt đĭch đam bơngai Hêbrơ, sư gô bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu sơnăm truh sơnăm mă tơpơh gô achăng ăn kơ sư rơngei. Ưh kơ 'mong jên ôh.

English: If he comes in by himself, he shall go out by himself; if he comes in married, then his wife shall go out with him.
Bahnar: Dah sư mơ̆t minh 'nu lei gô achăng sư minh 'nu dah sư mơ̆t đei akăn, kư̆m achăng tơlĕch hloi hăm akăn sư.

English: If his master has given him a wife, and she has borne him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall be her master’s, and he shall go out by himself.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơ'ngla sư chă ăn kơ sư akăn păng dah akăn sư rơneh kon drŏ-nglo dah kon drŏ-kăn, lei sư lĕch rơngei minh drô̆ sư đĕch, kon păng akăn sư gô oei tơ tơ'ngla sư

English: But if the servant plainly says, ‘I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free,’
Bahnar: mă-lei tơdah đĭch đam sư pơma hơdah; inh 'mêm kơ yŏng tơ'ngla păng kon akăn inh, inh ưh kơ 'maih rơngei ôh

English: then his master shall bring him to the judges. He shall also bring him to the door, or to the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall serve him forever.
Bahnar: lei yŏng tơ'ngla sư gô chông ba sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok sek tơlang đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na athei sư năm jê̆ tơ 'măng dah năm jê̆ jrăng 'măng, đơ̆ng noh tơ'ngla sư athei iŏk kơnho tôt đon sư; na sư gô bơ̆jang kơ tơ'ngla sư dĭng đĭ chăl arih.

English: “And if a man sells his daughter to be a female slave, she shall not go out as the male slaves do.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu tĕch kon drŏ-kăn sư pơm đĭch đe, kon drŏ-kăn 'noh ưh kơ gơh rơngei ôh thoi đĭch đam drŏ-nglo

English: If she does not please her master, who has betrothed her to himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no right to sell her to a foreign people, since he has dealt deceitfully with her.
Bahnar: tơdah tơ'ngla adrol hlôi iŏk đĭch đam pơm akăn, na đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh ưh kơ wă dơ̆ng, lei gơh ăn kơ đe bu mă tĕch sư huai iŏk dơ̆ng, ưh kơ gơh tĕch ăn kơ bơngai tơmoi.

English: And if he has betrothed her to his son, he shall deal with her according to the custom of daughters.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơ'ngla sư wă rơ̆ng kơ kon tơdăm sư, lei athei bơtho tơ'bôh lăng sư nhen thoi kon drŏ-kăn sư kơdih.

English: If he takes another wife, he shall not diminish her food, her clothing, and her marriage rights.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơ'ngla sư đei iŏk oei kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn nai na gah akăn sư blŭng-a sư ưh kơ gơh tơjur hơtŭch, lê̆ tơmam sa, hơbĕn ao păng tơdrong 'mêm băl klo kăn.

English: And if he does not do these three for her, then she shall go out free, without paying money.
Bahnar: Na tơdah yŏng tơ'ngla sư ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ pêng tơdrong 'nâu, lei adruh 'noh gơh rơngei ưh pă kăl kơ 'mong jên huai iŏk.

English: “He who strikes a man so that he dies shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu teh pơlôch bơngai, đe gô sek tơlang pơlôch sư.

English: However, if he did not lie in wait, but God delivered him into his hand, then I will appoint for you a place where he may flee.
Bahnar: Mă tơdah bơngai 'noh ưh kơ pơrơ̆ng wă pơlôch. Mă-lei yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao bơngai lôch 'noh lăm tơpang ti sư, na Inh gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ sư minh anih wă kơdâu ôn.

English: “But if a man acts with premeditation against his neighbor, to kill him by treachery, you shall take him from My altar, that he may die.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơrơ̆ng chă đon wă 'maih pơlôch đe. Mă đơ̆ng sư ôn tơ anih chơnang soi kơ Inh, kư̆m athei rôp păng pơlôch sư.

English: “And he who strikes his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu teh 'bă dah mĕ sư kơdih, đe gô sek tơlang pơlôch sư.

English: “He who kidnaps a man and sells him, or if he is found in his hand, shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu rôp tơtông bơngai păng tĕch, dah oei rôp bơwei lăm ti sư, đe gô sek pơlôch sư.

English: “And he who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu blei hiap 'bă dah mĕ sư kơdih, đe gô sek pơlôch sư

English: “If men contend with each other, and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist, and he does not die but is confined to his bed
Bahnar: Tơdah đei 'bar 'nu bơngai tơtôn tơteh băl, bơngai âu teh bơngai to păng tơmo dah chok păng ti, ưh kơ mah truh kơ lôch mă-lei sư pă gơh iung

English: if he rises again and walks about outside with his staff, then he who struck him shall be acquitted. He shall only pay for the loss of his time, and shall provide for him to be thoroughly healed.
Bahnar: tơdah oei gơh iung chĕp 'long jra năm chă ngôi tơ 'nguaih bơngai mă teh noh đe gô mơnat ăn yoch sư. Mă-lei athei duh jên hơmet tơdrong jĭ kơplah dôm năr sư păn păng rong truh kơ sư klaih praih hiôk pran.

English: “And if a man beats his male or female servant with a rod, so that he dies under his hand, he shall surely be punished.
Bahnar: Tơdah yŏng tơ'ngla iŏk 'long teh đĭch đam sư drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn păng lôch hloi đơ̆ng ti sư, đe kư̆m athei phak tơmal sư

English: Notwithstanding, if he remains alive a day or two, he shall not be punished; for he is his property.
Bahnar: mă-lei tơdah đĭch đam sư oei arih minh 'bar năr, tơ'ngla sư ưh kơ yoch, yua kơ sư noh tơmam yŏng tơ'ngla sư.

English: “If men fight, and hurt a woman with child, so that she gives birth prematurely, yet no harm follows, he shall surely be punished accordingly as the woman’s husband imposes on him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei tơtôn tơteh băl, hăm minh 'nu bơngai oei anăp, pơm kơ nge sư huŏng, mă-lei huay kơ đei jĭ răm nai, lei bơngai teh đe 'noh athei duh kiơ̆ kơ klo sư hơgăt păng ăn jên kư̆m kiơ̆ kơ 'bok sek tơlang.

English: But if any harm follows, then you shall give life for life
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đei tơdrong răm kiơ nai dơ̆ng, na ih gô iŏk răm tơdrong arih 'mong tơdrong arih.

English: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot
Bahnar: Răm măt 'mong măt, răm hơnĕnh 'mong hơnĕnh, răm ti 'mong ti, răm jơ̆ng 'mong jơ̆ng.

English: burn for burn, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
Bahnar: Pơtŏk 'mong pơtŏk, pham kơdơ̆k 'mong pham kơdơ̆k, rơka 'mong rơka.

English: “If a man strikes the eye of his male or female servant, and destroys it, he shall let him go free for the sake of his eye.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu teh 'bơm măt đĭch đam drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, pơm kơ sư măt tol, athei ăn kơ sư rơngei yua kơ măt sư tol

English: And if he knocks out the tooth of his male or female servant, he shall let him go free for the sake of his tooth.
Bahnar: tơdah bơngai bu pơm kơ đĭch đam drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn sư hiong minh pôm hơnĕnh, athei ăn kơ sư rơngei, yua kơ hiong hơnĕnh.

English: “If an ox gores a man or a woman to death, then the ox shall surely be stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be acquitted.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei rơmo tơ̆m bơngai drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn na lôch hloi, rơmo 'noh athei klơ̆m pơlôch hăm tơmo, mă-lei đe ưh kơ gơh sa 'nhĕm sư ôh, na tơ'ngla rơmo, noh gơh klaih.

English: But if the ox tended to thrust with its horn in times past, and it has been made known to his owner, and he has not kept it confined, so that it has killed a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned and its owner also shall be put to death.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah rơmo noh juăt kơ gơlŭng tơ̆m đe păng đe roi boih kơ tơ'ngla sư, na tơ'ngla sư oei ưh kơ chĭt wei sư 'mơ̆i, na rơmo noh oei tơ̆m pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, đe gô klơ̆m pơlôch rơmo noh păng tơmo păng kư̆m pơlôch tơ'ngla sư dơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: If there is imposed on him a sum of money, then he shall pay to redeem his life, whatever is imposed on him.
Bahnar: Dah đe athei tơ'ngla rơmo 'noh duh, tơ'ngla sư khŏm duh kiơ̆ kơ đe hơgăt.

English: Whether it has gored a son or gored a daughter, according to this judgment it shall be done to him.
Bahnar: Tơdah rơmo tơ̆m minh 'nu hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, lei đe kư̆m gô pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'nâu

English: If the ox gores a male or female servant, he shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
Bahnar: tơdah rơmo tơ̆m 'bơm đĭch đam drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, tơ'ngla rơmo athei duh pêng-jĭt hlak sêikơla jên hu ăn kơ tơ'ngla sư; na rơmo 'noh gô klơ̆m pơlôch păng tơmo.

English: “And if a man opens a pit, or if a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls in it
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơih 'măng sơlŭng dah mă sir hơlŭng na ưh kơ klơ̆p hơmet, na dah rơmo aseh huŏng tơ lăm noh

English: the owner of the pit shall make it good; he shall give money to their owner, but the dead animal shall be his.
Bahnar: tơ'ngla sơlŭng gô duh jên ăn kơ tơ'ngla rơmo, mă-lei sem dơrong mă lôch 'noh ăn kơ tơ'ngla sơlŭng.

English: “If one man’s ox hurts another’s, so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and divide the money from it; and the dead ox they shall also divide.
Bahnar: Dah rơmo bơngai âu tơ̆m rơmo bơngai nai na lôch hloi, 'bar 'nu bre sư athei tĕch rơmo mă oei arih 'noh, asong băl jên păng asong băl 'nhĕm rơmo mă lôch 'noh mơ̆n.

English: Or if it was known that the ox tended to thrust in time past, and its owner has not kept it confined, he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead animal shall be his own.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah tơ'ngla rơmo băt kơ rơmo sư juăt kơ gơlŭng, dah tơ̆m păng ưh kơ bơngơ̆t wei-lăng, tơ'ngla sư athei iŏk rơmo duh 'mong rơmo arih, mă-lei rơmo lôch 'noh oei lê̆ kơ tơ'ngla sư.

English: “If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and slaughters it or sells it, he shall restore five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu tơtông klĕ rơmo dah triu, klaih kơ noh pơlôch dah tĕch lê̆, sư athei duh pơđăm tŏ rơmo ăn kơ đơ̆ng minh pôm rơmo păng puăn tŏ triu ăn kơ đơ̆ng minh pôm triu

English: If the thief is found breaking in, and he is struck so that he dies, there shall be no guilt for his bloodshed.
Bahnar: tơdah bơngai tơtông klĕ oei chơkơ̆ 'măng na đe rôp păng teh pơlôch, bơngai teh pơlôch ưh kơ đei yoch.

English: If the sun has risen on him, there shall be guilt for his bloodshed. He should make full restitution; if he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah teh pơlôch kơplah 'năr đĭ lĕch boih, 'noh sư pŭ yoch pơlôch bơngai. Mă-lei tơdah teh pơlôch kơ'năr boih, sư pŭ yoch pơlôch bơngai, bơngai tơtông athei duh; tơdah ưh kơ đei kiơ, thoi noh đe gô tĕch sư, yua kơ tơdrong tơtông klĕ sư.

English: If the theft is certainly found alive in his hand, whether it is an ox or donkey or sheep, he shall restore double.
Bahnar: Dah tơmam mă bơngai tơtông kah đei iŏk, rơmo, aseh, dah triu, oei 'bôh arih lăm tơpang ti sư, lei bơngai tơtông khŏm duh hơgăt 'bar.

English: “If a man causes a field or vineyard to be grazed, and lets loose his animal, and it feeds in another man’s field, he shall make restitution from the best of his own field and the best of his own vineyard.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu ngơ̆r pơrăm achăng sem dơrong sư chă sa tơ lăm na chŭn đe dah lăm pơgar hơmu, bơngai 'noh athei iŏk tơmam 'lơ̆ng hloh đơ̆ng lăm chŭn mir sư, dah đơ̆ng lăm pơgar hơmu sư na duh kơ đe.

English: “If fire breaks out and catches in thorns, so that stacked grain, standing grain, or the field is consumed, he who kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu soh jơ'bôt jơla na bơmrok truh tơ 'ba đe chô̆ bơih dah sa kơtă kơ tơm, bơyan 'ba, dah sa pơđĭ lăm chŭn, bơngai mă soh ŭnh sa 'noh athei duh tôm tơmam đêl ŭnh sa 'noh.

English: “If a man delivers to his neighbor money or articles to keep, and it is stolen out of the man’s house, if the thief is found, he shall pay double.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơjao jên dah tơmam ăn kơ bôl buăl sư wei, na đei bơngai tơtông đơ̆ng hnam bơngai wei 'noh, dah đei rôp bơngai tơtông 'noh sư athei duh hloh 'bar wơ̆t.

English: If the thief is not found, then the master of the house shall be brought to the judges to see whether he has put his hand into his neighbor’s goods.
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh kơ đei rôp bơngai tơtông, tơ'ngla hnam wei jên noh athei năm pơdah sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok sek tơlang đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, pơdah wă kơ tơbăt sư ưh kơ đei iŏk tơmam buôl buăl sư noh.

English: “For any kind of trespass, whether it concerns an ox, a donkey, a sheep, or clothing, or for any kind of lost thing which another claims to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whomever the judges condemn shall pay double to his neighbor.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong tơmam hiong đe oei pơjah băl gah kon rơmo, aseh, minh pôm kon triu, hơbĕn ao dah tơmam kiơ hiong, na đei bơngai khan: Noh tơmam inh tơpă athei anhăk ba bre sư 'noh 'bơ̆t anăp sek tơlang đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, dah 'bok sek tơlang khan trŏ kơ bu noh athei duh ăn kơ buăl sư hloh 'bar 'măng

English: If a man delivers to his neighbor a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any animal to keep, and it dies, is hurt, or driven away, no one seeing it
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơjao ăn aseh, rơmo, triu dah sem dơrong nai ăn kơ buăl sư wei, na lôch, tơgơ̆ jơ̆ng dah đe puh iŏk, ưh kơ đei bu 'bôh

English: then an oath of the LORD shall be between them both, that he has not put his hand into his neighbor’s goods; and the owner of it shall accept that, and he shall not make it good.
Bahnar: 'bar pah bre sư athei yua anăn Kră Yang pơkă pơkăm bơngai mă wei gô roi sư kơdih ưh kơ đei chro ti hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam buăl sư, bơngai tơ'ngla sem dơrong athei lui kơ nơ̆r sư pơkăm, lei bơngai wei 'noh huay kơ duh ôh.

English: But if, in fact, it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner of it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đei bơngai tơtông sem dơrong 'noh đơ̆ng lăm hnam sư, bơngai rong 'noh athei duh kơ tơ'ngla sư.

English: If it is torn to pieces by a beast, then he shall bring it as evidence, and he shall not make good what was torn.
Bahnar: Tơdah sem dơrong 'noh sem bri rôp châu sa, bơngai rong athei anhăk ba tơ'bôh wă kơ băt, lei ưh kơ duh.

English: “And if a man borrows anything from his neighbor, and it becomes injured or dies, the owner of it not being with it, he shall surely make it good.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu mưng iŏk đơ̆ng buăl sư minh tŏ sem dơrong na tơgơ̆ jơ̆ng, dah lôch krŭl tơ'ngla sư, bơngai 'noh athei 'mong.

English: If its owner was with it, he shall not make it good; if it was hired, it came for its hire.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơm măt tơ'ngla sư tơ 'noh, ưh kơ 'mong ôh, dah sem dơrong noh ăn tŏk iŏk, na tơmam tŏk iŏk 'noh jô̆ hăm jên 'mong ăn.

English: “If a man entices a virgin who is not betrothed, and lies with her, he shall surely pay the bride-price for her to be his wife.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơhlŭ păng ngôi kư̆ kă hăm minh 'nu adruh hle ưh tam mă đei buăl, bơngai 'noh athei duh pơ'lơ̆ng păng athei iŏk hloi bơngai adruh 'noh pơm akăn.

English: If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money according to the bride-price of virgins.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bă adruh ưh kơ wă rôp ăn, bơngai 'noh kư̆m athei duh jên kiơ̆ kơ juăt đei hơgăt bơngai adruh oei hơlai.

English: “You shall not permit a sorceress to live.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ lê̆ minh 'nu drŏ-kăn pơjâu arih ôh.

English: “Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ngôi kư̆ kă păng sem brem đe gô pơlôch.

English: “He who sacrifices to any god, except to the LORD only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu kơkuh soi sơmah kơ lu yang nai ưh kơ trŏ kơ Kră Yang đe gô pơlôch sư.

English: “You shall neither mistreat a stranger nor oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai tơmoi păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơjuă lu sư, yua kơ lu iĕm kư̆m đêl jing bơngai tơmoi oei lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “You shall not afflict any widow or fatherless child.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơjuă yă adro dah bơngai mơti.

English: If you afflict them in any way, and they cry at all to Me, I will surely hear their cry
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư, na sư ôr krao truh tơ Inh, sĭt Inh gô kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r sư krao

English: and My wrath will become hot, and I will kill you with the sword; your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
Bahnar: Inh hil mĭl dêh; gô pơlôch lu iĕm, hăm đao gưm na akăn lu iĕm gô adro păng kon lu iĕm gô mơti.

English: “If you lend money to any of My people who are poor among you, you shall not be like a moneylender to him; you shall not charge him interest.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh dơnuh tŏk iŏk jên, 'nĕ kơ iŏk jên kiĕng thoi bơngai juăt ăn đe tŏk iŏk.

English: If you ever take your neighbor’s garment as a pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih iŏk ao tai bôl buăl ih hăm nơ̆r pơkă pơkăm ih athei pơdrâu ăn kơ sư adrol kơ 'năr mơ̆t

English: For that is his only covering, it is his garment for his skin. What will he sleep in? And it will be that when he cries to Me, I will hear, for I am gracious.
Bahnar: yua kơ sư đei ao lăp klơ̆p akâu đĕch; tơmam yă kiơ dơ̆ng sư wă tep, tơdah sư ôr krao Inh, Inh gô mơ̆ng nơ̆r sư yua kơ Inh boih Tơ'ngla mă 'mêm mơnat.

English: “You shall not revile God, nor curse a ruler of your people.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơma kơnê̆ 'bơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hiap pơtê̆ yŏng pơlei pơla ih.

English: “You shall not delay to offer the first of your ripe produce and your juices. The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơhiơ̆ pơyơ̆r kơ Inh dôm lu plei blŭng-a ih đơ̆ng mir chŭn păng sik hơmu ih, ih kư̆m athei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Inh kon kơdră drŏ-nglo ih.

English: Likewise you shall do with your oxen and your sheep. It shall be with its mother seven days; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
Bahnar: Gah lu triu păng rơmo ih kư̆m athei pơm thoi noh mơ̆n, lăm tơpơh năr blŭng-a lê̆ oei hơdai mĕ sư, năr mă tơhngam ih athei pơyơ̆r sư kơ Inh.

English: “And you shall be holy men to Me: you shall not eat meat torn by beasts in the field; you shall throw it to the dogs.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'măn kơ Inh, yua kơ thoi noh 'nĕ kơ sa 'nhĕm mă đơ̆ng sem bri kăp tơ bri brah; athei klơ̆m ăn kơ kŏ sa.

English: “You shall not circulate a false report. Do not put your hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ chă roi hơlĕnh, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pôm đon kiơ̆ lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă roi hơlĕnh.

English: You shall not follow a crowd to do evil; nor shall you testify in a dispute so as to turn aside after many to pervert justice.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ grê kiơ̆ lu bơngai tơpôl lơ wă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ ôh, tơdah ih wă dơ̆ng pơm kơdranh roi tơdrong kiơ, ih 'nĕ kơ druh kiơ̆ bơngai tơpôl wă 'bơ̆ lê̆ tơdrong tơpăt.

English: You shall not show partiality to a poor man in his dispute.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t bơngai dơnuh tơdah wă sek tơlang kơ sư.

English: “If you meet your enemy’s ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely bring it back to him again.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih tơ'bơ̆p rơmo dah aseh lu bơngai ayăt kơ ih wơ̆l jrok ih athei puh brŏk ăn kơ tơ'ngla sư.

English: If you see the donkey of one who hates you lying under its burden, and you would refrain from helping it, you shall surely help him with it.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih 'bôh aseh iĕ, tơ'ngla sư mă bơngai areh kơ ih chơ trăp na ưh kơ kĕ, ih 'nĕ kơ pơglăn đĕch, athei tŭn dŏng sư.

English: “You shall not pervert the judgment of your poor in his dispute.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong sek tơlang 'bơm bơngai dơnuh, ih 'nĕ kơ 'bơ̆ đŏng tơdrong tơpăt.

English: Keep yourself far from a false matter; do not kill the innocent and righteous. For I will not justify the wicked.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ chu kiơ̆ dôm lu nơ̆r hơlĕnh pơdăr; 'nĕ kơ pơlôch bơngai ưh kơ pơm yoch păng bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, yua kơ inh ưh kơ đei achăng bơngai kơnê̆ ôh.

English: And you shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds the discerning and perverts the words of the righteous.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ iŏk sa pơgâm mŭk tơmam đe, yua kơ iŏk sa pơgâm pơm bơbôl kơ măt bơngai hlôh wao păng bơ̆ đŏng tơdrong bơngai tơpăt.

English: “Also you shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the heart of a stranger, because you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơjuă pơđep lu bơngai tơmoi, yua kơ lu iĕm đêl tơmoi tơ dêh Êyiptơ, lu iĕm băt lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm bơngai tơmoi thoi yơ boih.

English: “Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its produce
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrâu sơnăm ih athei rei pơtăm lăm mir ih păng kĕch yuă iŏk

English: but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what they leave, the beasts of the field may eat. In like manner you shall do with your vineyard and your olive grove.
Bahnar: mă-lei truh tơ sơnăm mă tơpơh ih ưh kơ choh pơtăm athei lê̆ teh pơdơh. Wă kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin lăm kon pơlei pơla ih gơh yua iŏk plei đơ̆ng teh 'noh, oei đei đăi dôm yơ, lê̆ kơ sem bri sa kư̆m athei pơm thoi noh gah pơgar hơmu hăm pơgar 'long ôliwơ.

English: Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female servant and the stranger may be refreshed.
Bahnar: Lăm rim giĕng ih athei bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu năr, sơmă truh kơ năr mă tơpơh athei pơdơh, wă kơ rơmo păng aseh iĕ ih gơh pơdơh mơ̆n; hăm kon đĭch đam drŏ-kăn păng bơngai tơmoi gơh pơdơh jơhngơ̆m rơhơi.

English: “And in all that I have said to you, be circumspect and make no mention of the name of other gods, nor let it be heard from your mouth.
Bahnar: Ih athei wei răk đĭ dôm nơ̆r inh pơkă kơ ih, 'nĕ kơ chă pơư anăn lu yang nai; 'nĕ kơ tơ'blŏk tơdrong noh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ih.

English: “Three times you shall keep a feast to Me in the year
Bahnar: Lăm rim sơnăm pêng wơ̆t pơm giĕng et sa kơkuh kơ Inh.

English: You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread (you shall eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month of Abib, for in it you came out of Egypt; none shall appear before Me empty)
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm giĕng et sa 'Bĕng ưh kơ đei 'Buih Pông, athei sa 'bĕng noh lăm tơpơh năr trŏ kơ lăm khei mônh thoi nơ̆r Inh đei pơma pơkă; Yua kơ lăm khei 'noh lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ ưh kơ đei bu năm 'bơ̆t anăp Inh hăm ti hoh đĕch.

English: and the Feast of Harvest, the firstfruits of your labors which you have sown in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you have gathered in the fruit of your labors from the field.
Bahnar: Ih athei wei năr 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ bơyan phĕ kĕch yuă wă khan bơyan plei 'long blŭng-a đơ̆ng ih bơ̆jang păng dôm adrĕch ih rei boih tơ chŭn mir; păng 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ bơyan phĕ kĕch yuă wă hlôi, kơplah lu iĕm đei phĕ kĕch yuă plei đơ̆ng chŭn mir

English: “Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Pêng wơ̆t lăm minh sơnăm athei đĭ-đăng bơngai drŏ-nglo năm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread; nor shall the fat of My sacrifice remain until morning.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ pơyơ̆r Pham tơmam soi 'buh hrâu, hăm tơpŭng đei 'buih pông Rơmă wă pơyơ̆r pơyom kơ Inh 'nĕ 'măn truh kơ pơgê.

English: The first of the firstfruits of your land you shall bring into the house of the LORD your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
Bahnar: Dôm lu plei bơyan blŭng-a đơ̆ng teh, athei năm ba tơ hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ kơ pai hơbĭ bơbe triu kon lăm đak toh mĕ sư.

English: “Behold, I send an Angel before you to keep you in the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh wơh minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng năm adrol adrol kơ iĕm, wă wei-lăng kơplah iĕm yak năm rok trong mơ̆t tơ anih mă Inh đei hơmet boih.

English: Beware of Him and obey His voice; do not provoke Him, for He will not pardon your transgressions; for My name is in Him.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp sư, ih athei kơchăng păng mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r sư 'nĕ kơ sơngah pơjah plơ̆; kơnh sư ưh kơ mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch ih, yua kơ anăn Inh oei lăm sư.

English: But if you indeed obey His voice and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah iĕm mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r sư păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho khan, na Inh gô ayăt kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm.

English: For My Angel will go before you and bring you in to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites and the Hivites and the Jebusites; and I will cut them off.
Bahnar: Linh jang Inh gô năm adrol adrol kơ iĕm, chông ba iĕm mơ̆t tơ char lu bơngai Amôrit, bơngai Hêtit, bơngai Pêrisit, bơngai Kanaan, bơngai Hêwit păng bơngai Jêbus, na inh gô pơrăm lu sư.

English: You shall not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do according to their works; but you shall utterly overthrow them and completely break down their sacred pillars.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ drap kơkuh păng soi sơmah kơ lu yang lu sư, 'nĕ kơ pơm rok kiơ̆ tơdrong jang lu sư, mă-lei athei pơrăm đĭ dôm lu rup yang păng juă pơhĕch dôm lu gơ̆ng rup yang sư.

English: “So you shall serve the LORD your God, and He will bless your bread and your water. And I will take sickness away from the midst of you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; sư Kră Yang gô tơgŭm iĕm tơmam sŏng sa, ăn kơ iĕm liĕm akâu păng huay kơ đei jĭ jăn.

English: No one shall suffer miscarriage or be barren in your land; I will fulfill the number of your days.
Bahnar: Lăm char iĕm gô ưh kơ đei drŏ-kăn hơwŏng păng ưh kơ đei nge rơngăt, Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm arih sot

English: “I will send My fear before you, I will cause confusion among all the people to whom you come, and will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
Bahnar: inh gô ăn tơdrong hli krưp Inh năm adrol, pơm kơ lu teh đak hơwơ̆l hơwang, pơm kơ lu ayăt kơ iĕm kơdâu đĭ mưh iĕm năm truh tơ yơ pơm kơ đe hli tơrơ.

English: And I will send hornets before you, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before you.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ong hơgơ̆r năm adrol blah puh lu bơngai Hêwit, bơngai Kanaan, bơngai Hêtit, weh đơ̆ng anăp iĕm.

English: I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate and the beasts of the field become too numerous for you.
Bahnar: Inh gô ưh kơ puh lê̆ lu sư weh đĭ hloi lăm minh sơnăm ôh, kơnh hli kơ dêh char noh jing bri juơ păng dôm lu sem bri rai chek lar rai lơ gô pơrăm iĕm

English: Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased, and you inherit the land.
Bahnar: mă-lei inh gô puh lu sư 'net 'net weh đơ̆ng iĕm, dĭng layơ lu iĕm mă lơ păng gơh wei-lăng dêh noh boih

English: And I will set your bounds from the Red Sea to the sea, Philistia, and from the desert to the River. For I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.
Bahnar: Inh gô chĕng hơdral iĕm iŏk đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ 'brê truh tơ đak dơsĭ Philistin, a đơ̆ng char glă truh tơ đak glung tih;b yua kơ inh gô pơjao adrĕch adrung 'noh lăm tơpang ti ih păng ih gô puh lu sư weh đơ̆ng anăp iĕm.

English: You shall make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư, dah hăm yang lu sư.

English: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against Me. For if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn lu sư oei lăm char iĕm ôh, hli kơ lu sư pơhlŭ iĕm pơm yoch hăm Inh na kơkuh kơ yang lu sư; tơdrong noh gô pơm hơđong đăk kơ iĕm.

English: Now He said to Moses, “Come up to the LORD, you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel, and worship from afar.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Ih, Arôn, Nađap, Abihu păng tơpơh-jĭt 'nu lu kră wei-lăng bơngai Isơrael, iĕm athei tŏk tơ anih Kră Yang dơ̆ng tơ ataih na drap kơkuh.

English: And Moses alone shall come near the LORD, but they shall not come near; nor shall the people go up with him.”
Bahnar: Hơdrô̆ Môis đĕch gơh năm jê̆ Kră Yang, mă-lei lu bơngai nai ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ păng kon pơlei pơla kư̆m ưh kơ gơh tŏk hơdai ih.

English: So Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD and all the judgments. And all the people answered with one voice and said, “All the words which the LORD has said we will do.”
Bahnar: Môis năm roi hloi kơ kon pơlei pơla dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă păng khôi juăt, na lu sư tơl thoi âu: Lu nhôn gô pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho akhan.

English: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD. And he rose early in the morning, and built an altar at the foot of the mountain, and twelve pillars according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
Bahnar: Môis chih iŏk đĭ dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho akhan pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih, pơdơ̆ng minh pôm chơnang soi 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng kông păng pơtăm mơjĭt-'bar tŏ gơ̆ng pơtih kơ mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch adrung Isơrael.

English: Then he sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư wơh lu tơdăm Isơrael năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang hăm rơmo dăm.

English: And Moses took half the blood and put it in basins, and half the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk minh puăt pham mong lăm kơthao păng minh puăt nai dơ̆ng tuh tơ kơpal chơnang soi

English: Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read in the hearing of the people. And they said, “All that the LORD has said we will do, and be obedient.”
Bahnar: klaih kơ noh sư iŏk minh Sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, đŏk ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla mơ̆ng, na kon pơlei pơla khan thoi âu, lu nhôn gô mơ̆ng păng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: And Moses took the blood, sprinkled it on the people, and said, “This is the blood of the covenant which the LORD has made with you according to all these words.”
Bahnar: Na Môis iŏk pham săi tơ akâu kon pơlei pơla na khan: 'Nâu boih pham pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang pơsĭt boih hăm lu iĕm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r pơkă pơkăm.

English: Then Moses went up, also Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Môis Arôn, Nađap, Abihu hơdai păng tơpơh-jĭt 'nu kră wei-lăng bơngai Isơrael đĭ-đăng lu sư tŏk tơ kông.

English: and they saw the God of Israel. And there was under His feet as it were a paved work of sapphire stone, and it was like the very heavens in its clarity.
Bahnar: Tơmang 'bôh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tơ ala jơ̆ng Sư đei minh pôm tơmam thoi trong lơ̆k tơmo gĭt rang, nhen thoi hơdah plĕnh.

English: But on the nobles of the children of Israel He did not lay His hand. So they saw God, and they ate and drank.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ đei hiŏng ti pơrăm lu kră wei-lăng bơngai Isơrael; lu sư 'bôh ră mă-lei oei sŏng sa hiôk đĕch.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and be there; and I will give you tablets of stone, and the law and commandments which I have written, that you may teach them.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Tŏk bĕ tơ Inh tơ kơpal kông păng gô tơ noh; Inh gô ăn kơ ih tơmo lat, chih răk khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă wă bơtho kon pơlei pơla

English: So Moses arose with his assistant Joshua, and Moses went up to the mountain of God.
Bahnar: Môis iung hơdai hăm Jôsuê, bơngai jang kơ sư, na Môis năm tŏk hloi tơ kơpal kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And he said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we come back to you. Indeed, Aaron and Hur are with you. If any man has a difficulty, let him go to them.”
Bahnar: Na sư khan hloi kơ lu kră wei-lăng: Athei gô tơ âu dĭng truh nhôn hơlơ̆k tơ lu iĕm dơ̆ng. 'Nâu Arôn păng Hur oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm, bu đei tơdrong kiơ athei apinh bre sư 'noh.

English: Then Moses went up into the mountain, and a cloud covered the mountain.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis tŏk tơ kơpal kông, hơmơ̆l gom lê̆ kông.

English: Now the glory of the LORD rested on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. And on the seventh day He called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
Bahnar: Tơdrong rang hơdah 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang tơ kơpal kông Sinai; lăm tơdrâu năr hơmơ̆l gom kông, truh năr mă tơpơh Kră Yang đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l krao Môis.

English: The sight of the glory of the LORD was like a consuming fire on the top of the mountain in the eyes of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Tơdrong rang hơdah 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang tơ kơpal wĕch kông 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Isơrael, thoi hơdah ŭnh sa kơdrơ̆ng.

English: So Moses went into the midst of the cloud and went up into the mountain. And Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
Bahnar: Môis mơ̆t tơ tŏk-bŏk hơmơ̆l, tŏk tơ kơpal kông, oei tơ noh lăm puăn-jĭt năr păng puăn-jĭt măng.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, that they bring Me an offering. From everyone who gives it willingly with his heart you shall take My offering.
Bahnar: Athei khan kơ bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r tơmam ăn kơ Inh; ih athei iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng bơngai bu đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Inh noh.

English: And this is the offering which you shall take from them: gold, silver, and bronze
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơmam pơyơ̆r ih gô iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư; hu, maih kong

English: blue, purple, and scarlet thread, fine linen, and goats’ hair
Bahnar: Brai jơk 'brê hơhĭm, 'brê gôh, che 'bui brai se, che sŏk bơbe, akar triu tơno tong đak 'brê

English: ram skins dyed red, badger skins, and acacia wood
Bahnar: akar ka tih, 'long Keo

English: oil for the light, and spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense
Bahnar: đak rơmă plei ôliwơ tơ̆k ŭnh jrĕnh, tơmam wă pơm đak 'bâu phu wă pik wă pơm pơgang 'bâu phu

English: onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod and in the breastplate.
Bahnar: Tơmo rang gĭt nai wă pơklep tơ êphot păng che atol tơ kơtơh.

English: And let them make Me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơm ăn kơ Inh minh anih kơkuh rơgoh păng Inh gô oei tŏk-bŏk lu sư.

English: According to all that I show you, that is, the pattern of the tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings, just so you shall make it.
Bahnar: Athei pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm hăm tơmam yua lei-lăi thoi Inh gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih.

English: “And they shall make an ark of acacia wood; two and a half cubits shall be its length, a cubit and a half its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei lu sư pơm minh pôm hom hăm 'long Keo, tor sư 'bar hơgăt minh puăt, wơ̆l minh hơgăt minh puăt păng kơjung sư kư̆m minh hơgăt minh puăt.

English: And you shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and out you shall overlay it, and shall make on it a molding of gold all around.
Bahnar: Iŏk maih rơgoh lom pơklep lăm păng đaih păng pơm gơnăp sư tăp dăr păng maih.

English: You shall cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in its four corners; two rings shall be on one side, and two rings on the other side.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei hling puăn tŏ khuen maih 'măn lê̆ tơ puăn pah jơ̆ng mum hom; 'bar tŏ jơ̆ng mum gah âu, 'bar tŏ jơ̆ng mum gah to

English: And you shall make poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
Bahnar: kư̆m pơm 'bar tŏ 'long tơnung hăm 'long Keo, lom hăm maih

English: You shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, that the ark may be carried by them.
Bahnar: na sôr tơmơ̆t tơ lăm bơlôh khuen 'bar pah jơ̆ng mum hom, wă kơ tung hom.

English: The poles shall be in the rings of the ark; they shall not be taken from it.
Bahnar: 'Long tơnung noh lê̆ hloi lăm bơlôh khuen, 'nĕ pă plôh.

English: And you shall put into the ark the Testimony which I will give you.
Bahnar: Ih athei tah lăm hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p khôi juăt nơ̆r mă tơtă Inh gô ăn kơ ih.

English: “You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold; two and a half cubits shall be its length and a cubit and a half its width.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei pơm minh hlak tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat păng maih rơgoh, tor 'bar hơgăt minh puăt, wơ̆l minh hơgăt minh puăt.

English: And you shall make two cherubim of gold; of hammered work you shall make them at the two ends of the mercy seat.
Bahnar: Kŭm pơm kơtă hloi 'bar tŏ rup chêrubim hăm maih, dan 'bar pah kơ̆l tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat

English: Make one cherub at one end, and the other cherub at the other end; you shall make the cherubim at the two ends of it of one piece with the mercy seat.
Bahnar: dan hloh tơ 'nguaih, minh pôm rup jih gah âu păng minh pôm rup jih gah to. Ih athei pơm rup chêrubim dan sư tơ 'bar pah jih.

English: And the cherubim shall stretch out their wings above, covering the mercy seat with their wings, and they shall face one another; the faces of the cherubim shall be toward the mercy seat.
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ chêrubim gô bơyar pơnăr, klơ̆p kơpal tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat, tơwih măt tơklă băl lăng tơpăt tơ tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat.

English: You shall put the mercy seat on top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the Testimony that I will give you.
Bahnar: Ih athei dan tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tơ kơpal hom, lăm hom ih tah khôi juăt nơ̆r tơtă Inh gô ăn kơ ih.

English: And there I will meet with you, and I will speak with you from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim which are on the ark of the Testimony, about everything which I will give you in commandment to the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơ'bơ̆p ih tơ noh, tơ kơpal tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat sơlam 'bar tŏ rup chêrubim, tơ kơpal hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p noh Inh gô bơtho tơ'bôh kơ ih dôm tơdrong tơtă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: “You shall also make a table of acacia wood; two cubits shall be its length, a cubit its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh pôm gơ'bang păng 'long keo; tor sư 'bar hơgăt, wơ̆l sư minh hơgăt păng kơjung minh hơgăt minh puăt

English: And you shall overlay it with pure gold, and make a molding of gold all around.
Bahnar: ih lom păng maih rơgoh păng pơm minh trong gơnăp tăp dăr hăm maih

English: You shall make for it a frame of a handbreadth all around, and you shall make a gold molding for the frame all around.
Bahnar: ih pơm 'long găn tăp dăr gơ'bang dang tŏ pah, na pơm gơnăp hăm maih minh trong tăp dăr.

English: And you shall make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings on the four corners that are at its four legs.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh ih tah puăn tŏ khuen maih tơ puăn pah mum jơ̆ng gơ'bang.

English: The rings shall be close to the frame, as holders for the poles to bear the table.
Bahnar: Gơwang khuen noh jê̆ 'long găn sư, wă sôr 'long tơnung tung gơ'bang.

English: And you shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be carried with them.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm 'long tơnung hăm 'long keo, lom păng maih, đe gô yua wă tung gơ'bang noh.

English: You shall make its dishes, its pans, its pitchers, and its bowls for pouring. You shall make them of pure gold.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei iŏk maih rơgoh pơm pơnhan chhĕr, pơnhan, klĭnh păng kơchŏk wă yua tuh tơmam pơyơ̆r huch sa.

English: And you shall set the showbread on the table before Me always.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal gơ'bang ih gô 'măn 'bĕng tơpŭng athei đei ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: “You shall also make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be of hammered work. Its shaft, its branches, its bowls, its ornamental knobs, and flowers shall be of one piece.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng hăm maih rơgoh, jơ̆ng, akâu, 'long pơdơ̆ng, plei hăm pơkao kơđeng pơm đĭ păng maih hơjơ̆m pơiel.

English: And six branches shall come out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side.
Bahnar: 'Bar pah akâu ŭnh kơđeng đei tơdrâu tŏ dơng tơ'bla, pêng tŏ dơng tơ'bla gah âu, pêng tŏ dơng tơ'bla gah to.

English: Three bowls shall be made like almond blossoms on one branch, with an ornamental knob and a flower, and three bowls made like almond blossoms on the other branch, with an ornamental knob and a flower—and so for the six branches that come out of the lampstand.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrâu tŏ dơng tơ'bla sư chăt đơ̆ng jơ̆ng kơđeng rim kơ dơng tơ'bla đei pêng tŏ plei kơchŏk pơm thoi pơkao amandê,a minh pôm rơnôp păng pơkao.

English: On the lampstand itself four bowls shall be made like almond blossoms, each with its ornamental knob and flower.
Bahnar: Kơpal akâu jơ̆ng kơđeng, kư̆m dai đei puăn tŏ plei kơchŏk pơm thoi pơkao amandê đei minh pôm rơnôp păng pơkao sư.

English: And there shall be a knob under the first two branches of the same, a knob under the second two branches of the same, and a knob under the third two branches of the same, according to the six branches that extend from the lampstand.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrâu tŏ dơng tơ'bla đơ̆ng akâu jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng, kư̆ kơ rim 'bar tŏ dơng tơ'bla, tơ ala đei minh pôm rơnôp.

English: Their knobs and their branches shall be of one piece; all of it shall be one hammered piece of pure gold.
Bahnar: Rơnôp păng dơng tơ'bla, tơ'bưh hơbĭ pơm hăm maih đe tơtang blat.

English: You shall make seven lamps for it, and they shall arrange its lamps so that they give light in front of it.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei pơm tơpơh tŏ brai kơđeng đe wă tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng na pơchrang hơdah tơ anăp.

English: And its wick-trimmers and their trays shall be of pure gold.
Bahnar: Chơkep kăt rơnok brai ŭnh kơđeng păng pơnhan chhĕr dan rơnok sư kư̆m pơm păng maih rơgoh.

English: It shall be made of a talent of pure gold, with all these utensils.
Bahnar: Đe gô yua minh talângb maih rơgoh pơm jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng păng tơmam wă yua hơmet sư.

English: And see to it that you make them according to the pattern which was shown you on the mountain.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei lăng, kư̆ kơ pơm rok hơbŏ thoi đei tơ'bôh kơ ih boih tơ kơpal kông.

English: “Moreover you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine woven linen and blue, purple, and scarlet thread; with artistic designs of cherubim you shall weave them.
Bahnar: Ih athei yua mơjĭt blah che 'bui se hơ'bơ̆l wă pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tanh păng brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, ih athei tanh rup chêrubim tanh mă đen 'lơ̆ng.

English: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits. And every one of the curtains shall have the same measurements.
Bahnar: Rim kơ che noh tor sư 'bar-jĭt tơhngam hơgăt, wơ̆l puăn hơgăt, rim blah athei tŏ ăi băl.

English: Five curtains shall be coupled to one another, and the other five curtains shall be coupled to one another.
Bahnar: Athei sĭt pơtrơp pơđăm blah che pơm jing minh, pơđăm blah nai kư̆m sĭt pơtrơp lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: And you shall make loops of blue yarn on the edge of the curtain on the selvedge of one set, and likewise you shall do on the outer edge of the other curtain of the second set.
Bahnar: Ih athei sĭt gơwŏk thoi gơwang hăm brai jơk sĭt rok tơnăp pơtrơp che mă minh đơ̆ng noh ih kư̆m athei sĭt thoi noh mơ̆n 'bơ̆t wă pơtrơp che mă 'bar.

English: Fifty loops you shall make in the one curtain, and fifty loops you shall make on the edge of the curtain that is on the end of the second set, that the loops may be clasped to one another.
Bahnar: Ih pơm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk brai, 'bơ̆t che mă mônh păng pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk brai 'bơ̆t che mă 'bar, lu gơwŏk brai 'bar pah tơklă băl.

English: And you shall make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains together with the clasps, so that it may be one tabernacle.
Bahnar: Kŭm athei pơm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk păng maih, na gơwŏk đơ̆ng che âu tơ che noh, wă kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơ'bưh băl jing minh blah.

English: “You shall also make curtains of goats’ hair, to be a tent over the tabernacle. You shall make eleven curtains.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei pơm mơjĭt-mônh blah che hơ'bơ̆l hăm sŏk bơbe, wă klơ̆p kơpal Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; and the eleven curtains shall all have the same measurements.
Bahnar: Che hơ'bơ̆l âu, tor sư pêng-jĭt hơgăt wơ̆l sư puăn hơgăt, lăm mơjĭt-mônh blah noh tŏ ăi băl.

English: And you shall couple five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves, and you shall double over the sixth curtain at the forefront of the tent.
Bahnar: Ih athei sĭt pơtrơp pơđăm blah che sŏk bơbe âu lê̆ pha păng tơdrâu blah nai 'măn lê̆ pha mă-lei che hlak mă tơdrâu noh chơ̆p pơm 'bar, gah anăp Anih Akŭm.

English: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain of the second set.
Bahnar: Na tah pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk brai rok tơnăp pơtrơp che mă minh păng tah pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk brai tơnăp pơtrơp che mă 'bar.

English: And you shall make fifty bronze clasps, put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m pơm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk păng kong, gơwŏk mơ̆t tơ lăm gơwŏk brai na dui akŭm tơmơ̆t sư, wă kơ lu sư jing minh.

English: The remnant that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Mă oei rơkah, minh puăt che hơ'bơ̆l noh, noh gô atol tơ gah rŏng kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And a cubit on one side and a cubit on the other side, of what remains of the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle, on this side and on that side, to cover it.
Bahnar: Gah tor sư che oei rơkah gah âu minh hơgăt gah to minh hơgăt, na gô tơjur wă klơ̆p 'bar pah Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: “You shall also make a covering of ram skins dyed red for the tent, and a covering of badger skins above that.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh blah wă klơ̆p bơbŭng bơsŭn hăm akar triu tơno tong đak 'brê păng minh blah dơ̆ng hăm akar ka tih.

English: “And for the tabernacle you shall make the boards of acacia wood, standing upright.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei yua tơ̆r pơm 'long dơ̆ng tơnăr bơsŭn păng 'long keo, pơ̆ng pơdơ̆ng sư.

English: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half shall be the width of each board.
Bahnar: Minh blah kơjung mơjĭt hơgăt, să minh hơgăt minh puăt

English: Two tenons shall be in each board for binding one to another. Thus you shall make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: kao tŏk-bŏk jơ̆ng tơ̆r wă pơkăp băl, đĭ-đăng lu tơ̆r tơnăr bơsŭn ih athei pơm lei-lăi ngăl.

English: And you shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side.
Bahnar: Gah gơal kơ bơsŭn ih athei pơm 'bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r

English: You shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under each of the boards for its two tenons.
Bahnar: Ala 'bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r athei pơm puăn-jĭt tŏ rơnuh păng hu kơ 'bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r, minh pôm rơnuh bŏk minh bơlôh, wă tah minh pah jơ̆ng tơ̆r, minh pôm rơnuh bơlôh nai wă tah minh pah jơ̆ng tơ̆r tơ'bưh băl.

English: And for the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, there shall be twenty boards
Bahnar: Athei pơm 'bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r gah yă-nơ̆m kơ bơsŭn.

English: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under each of the boards.
Bahnar: Păng puăn-jĭt tŏ rơnuh păng hu 'bar tŏ bơlôh rơnuh kơ rim hlak tơ̆r.

English: For the far side of the tabernacle, westward, you shall make six boards.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm tơdrâu hlak tơ̆r gah rŏng bơsŭn wă khan gah bơmơ̆t.

English: And you shall also make two boards for the two back corners of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: 'Bar pah mum gah rŏng bơsŭn athei pơm 'bar hlak tơ̆r

English: They shall be coupled together at the bottom and they shall be coupled together at the top by one ring. Thus it shall be for both of them. They shall be for the two corners.
Bahnar: pơkăp băl đơ̆ng ala truh tơ kơpal, 'bơ̆t 'bar pah mum 'nâu săp tơ'bưh băl hăm minh pôm khuen, pơđĭ kơ 'bar pah mum athei pơm thoi noh ngăl.

English: So there shall be eight boards with their sockets of silver—sixteen sockets—two sockets under each of the boards.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đei tơhngam hlak tơ̆r păng mơjĭt-tơdrâu tŏ rơnuh păng hu.

English: “And you shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the boards on one side of the tabernacle
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei pơm pơđăm tŏ 'long găn hơbăt păng 'long keo, pơđăm tŏ tơ gah âu.

English: five bars for the boards on the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the far side westward.
Bahnar: Pơđăm tŏ 'long hơbăt gah 'ngiĕo pah to bơsŭn păng pơđăm tŏ 'long plơ̆ng dơ̆ng gah rŏng bơsŭn wă khan gah bơmơ̆t.

English: The middle bar shall pass through the midst of the boards from end to end.
Bahnar: Roh 'long hơbăt tŏk-bŏk pơioi lăm tŏk-bŏk tơ̆r tơnăr kơjung, đơ̆ng kơ̆l 'nâu tơ'bưh tơ kơ̆l to.

English: You shall overlay the boards with gold, make their rings of gold as holders for the bars, and overlay the bars with gold.
Bahnar: Kŭm athei iŏk maih lom pơklop lu tơ̆r hăm 'long hơbăt păng pơm gơwŏk păng maih, wă kơ gơh chô̆ rim 'long hơbăt.

English: And you shall raise up the tabernacle according to its pattern which you were shown on the mountain.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm nhen thoi Inh tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih tơ kơpal kông 'noh.

English: “You shall make a veil woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen. It shall be woven with an artistic design of cherubim.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh blah che 'bui tĕnh, brai jơk, 'brê hơhĭm, tanh mă tơnen 'lơ̆ng dônh tanh rup chêrubim

English: You shall hang it upon the four pillars of acacia wood overlaid with gold. Their hooks shall be gold, upon four sockets of silver.
Bahnar: Iŏk gơwŏk hăm maih na atol che 'noh tơ puăn tŏ jrăng 'long keo lom păng maih, pơdơ̆ng pơtăm tơ puăn tŏ bơlôh rơnuh păng hu.

English: And you shall hang the veil from the clasps. Then you shall bring the ark of the Testimony in there, behind the veil. The veil shall be a divider for you between the holy place and the Most Holy.
Bahnar: Gơwŏk mă dan hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p tơ gah lăm che; pĕng che 'nâu wă klah asong anih rơgoh păng anih tôch rơgoh.

English: You shall put the mercy seat upon the ark of the Testimony in the Most Holy.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh iŏk tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat klơ̆p hom tah tơdrong pơgơ̆p, lăm anih rơgoh hloh

English: You shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand across from the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south; and you shall put the table on the north side.
Bahnar: Gah 'nguaih kơ che pĕng găn 'noh ih 'măn gơ'bang; gah yă-nơ̆m păng jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng 'măn gah gơal tơklă băl.

English: “You shall make a screen for the door of the tabernacle, woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, made by a weaver.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh blah che pĕng găn 'măng Bơsŭna che jơk, 'brê hơhĭm, 'brê gôh che 'bui noh đei sĭt pơ'lơ̆ng boih

English: And you shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; their hooks shall be gold, and you shall cast five sockets of bronze for them.
Bahnar: Pơm gơwŏk păng maih wă atol che găn 'nâu tơ pơđăm tŏ jrăng păng 'long keo lom păng maih; păng pơtăm tơ pơđăm tŏ bơlôh rơnuh păng kong.

English: “You shall make an altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar shall be square—and its height shall be three cubits.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh pôm chơnang soi păng 'long keo, puăn pah tŏ ăi, pơđăm hlok gah tor, pơđăm hơgăt gah wơ̆l păng kơjung pêng hơgăt.

English: You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t puăn pah mum chơnang soi ih pơm puăn tŏ ake hlôi tơ 'nguaih păng lom păng kong.

English: Also you shall make its pans to receive its ashes, and its shovels and its basins and its forks and its firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm kơthŭng mong ngar gŏ bô̆i mong tơnuh, kơthao mong đak, gơ'bênh, chơkrơ. Kơthŭng mong ngar pơm hăm kong ngăl.

English: You shall make a grate for it, a network of bronze; and on the network you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
Bahnar: Păng tanh minh hlak grang păng hơdrao kong, na puăn pah mum grang 'noh pơm puăn tŏ khuen păng kong

English: You shall put it under the rim of the altar beneath, that the network may be midway up the altar.
Bahnar: 'măn grang noh lăm chơnang soi tơnăp sư tơ lăm chơnang soi wă kơ grang kơjung, truh minh puăt akâu chơnang soi

English: And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
Bahnar: chơnang soi kư̆m athei pơm 'long tơnung wă tung chơnang soi păng 'long keo lom păng kong

English: The poles shall be put in the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar to bear it.
Bahnar: na sôr tơmơ̆t tơ lăm lu bơlôh khuen; 'bar pah chơnang mưh wă ting tung.

English: You shall make it hollow with boards; as it was shown you on the mountain, so shall they make it.
Bahnar: Chơnang soi pơm păng tơ̆r, pơm đei lăm tŏk-bŏk, pơm nhen thoi Inh bơtho tơ'bôh kơ ih tơ kơpal kông 'noh.

English: “You shall also make the court of the tabernacle. For the south side there shall be hangings for the court made of fine woven linen, one hundred cubits long for one side.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, gah gơal athei đei che pĕng tanh che 'bui brai se kơjung minh-hrĕng hơgăt.a

English: And its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets shall be bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be silver.
Bahnar: Đei 'bar-jĭt tŏ jrăng pơtăm kơpal 'bar-jĭt tŏ bơlôh rơnuh păng kong; gơwŏk pơm păng hu.

English: Likewise along the length of the north side there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, with its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
Bahnar: Gah yă-nơ̆m kư̆m đei che mơ̆n; che pĕng 'noh tor sư kơjung minh-hrĕng hơgăt, 'bar-jĭt tŏ jrăng păng pơtăm 'bar-jĭt tŏ bơlôh rơnuh păng kong păng lu gơwŏk sư pơm păng hu.b

English: “And along the width of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.
Bahnar: Che pĕng cham gah bơmơ̆t tor sư kơjung pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt tơ'băk tơ mơjĭt tŏ jrăng păng pơtăm tơ mơjĭt tŏ bơlôh rơnuh.

English: The width of the court on the east side shall be fifty cubits.
Bahnar: Cham gah anăp, gah hơlĕch să, đei pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt

English: The hangings on one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
Bahnar: Gah 'ma kơ 'măng dur đei mơjĭt-pơđăm hơgăt che pĕng, tơ'băk tơ pêng tŏ jrăng păng pơtăm tơ pêng tŏ bơlôh rơnuh

English: And on the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
Bahnar: gah 'ngiĕo kơ 'măng dur đei mơjĭt-pơđăm hơgăt che pĕng tơ'băk tơ pêng tŏ jrăng păng pơtăm tơ pêng tŏ bơlôh rơnuh.

English: “For the gate of the court there shall be a screen twenty cubits long, woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, made by a weaver. It shall have four pillars and four sockets.
Bahnar: 'Măng dur cham đei che pĕng să 'bar-jĭt hơgăt che 'bui brai jơk, 'brê, 'brê hơhĭm, 'brê gôh đei sĭt 'lơ̆ng, tơ'băk tơ puăn tŏ jrăng păng pơtăm tơ puăn tŏ bơlôh rơnuh.

English: All the pillars around the court shall have bands of silver; their hooks shall be of silver and their sockets of bronze.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng jrăng tăp dăr kơ cham tơ'bưh băl; hăm gơwŏk hu, pơtăm tơ bơlôh rơnuh păng kong.

English: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits, the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits, made of fine woven linen, and its sockets of bronze.
Bahnar: Cham să kơjung đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt gah wơ̆l, minh pah pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt, atol che kơjung pơđăm hơgăt hăm che 'bui tanh brai se, dôm lu bơlôh rơnuh hăm kong.

English: All the utensils of the tabernacle for all its service, all its pegs, and all the pegs of the court, shall be of bronze.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam yua lăm cham bơsŭn, anih akŭm lu jrăng hnam păng đĭ-đăng lu tơmam yua nai pơm păng kong ngăl.

English: “And you shall command the children of Israel that they bring you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to cause the lamp to burn continually.
Bahnar: Ih athei tơtă khan ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael anhăk ba đak rơmă 'long ôliwơ ngăl ưh kơ hrâu. Wă tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng wă kơ sư hơdah ling-lang.

English: In the tabernacle of meeting, outside the veil which is before the Testimony, Aaron and his sons shall tend it from evening until morning before the LORD. It shall be a statute forever to their generations on behalf of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong jang tơ 'nguaih kơ che pĕng găn 'bơ̆t anăp hom tah khôi juăt lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, 'bok Arôn hăm dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư gô wei hơmet ŭnh kơđeng, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă kơ khơ̆ng ling-lang đơ̆ng măng truh 'năr hơdah, 'noh jing minh tơdrong juăt ling-lang ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael athei wei răk lăm đĭ-đăng jơhnơr.

English: “Now take Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister to Me as priest, Aaron and Aaron’s sons: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai Isơrael ih athei rơih iŏk Arôn, 'nhŏng ih hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, Nađap, Abihu, Êlêasar; păng Ithamar; pơjao ăn tơdrong jang pơm 'bok soi bơ̆jang kơ Inh.

English: And you shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơhrŭk ăn kơ Arôn 'nhŏng ih ao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, wă kơ pơyom ư-ang.

English: So you shall speak to all who are gifted artisans, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron’s garments, to consecrate him, that he may minister to Me as priest.
Bahnar: Ih athei lu bơngai gơh tanh sĭt hơgei, bơngai mă Inh ăn kơ lu sư gơh hơgei kơ pơm, wă kơ lu sư sĭt ăn kơ Arôn ao, wă kơ sư hrŭk năr đe pôk sư jing 'bok soi, wă kơ sư bơ̆jang kơ Inh.

English: And these are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, an ephod, a robe, a skillfully woven tunic, a turban, and a sash. So they shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons, that he may minister to Me as priest.
Bahnar: 'Nâu đei lăm ao wă pơm kơ sư: Minh blah bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh, minh blah êphot, minh blah ao tai, môk păng tơlei tơ̆n, lu sư gô pơm ao rơgoh tơ̆n ăn kơ Arôn, 'nhŏng ih, hăm dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, wă kơ lu sư noh pơm 'bok soi bơ̆jang kơ Inh.

English: “They shall take the gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and the fine linen
Bahnar: Lu sư gô yua che brai rang hlơ-hlĕch, brai jơk, brai 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm păng che 'bui tanh hăm brai se.

English: and they shall make the ephod of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, artistically worked.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơm ao êphot păng brai rang, brai jơk, brai 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm păng che 'bui tanh hăm brai se.

English: It shall have two shoulder straps joined at its two edges, and so it shall be joined together.
Bahnar: 'Bar pah êphot pơm 'bar dăng tơlei 'băk, wă 'băk tơ 'bar pah hơngiĕng. Sĭt pơklep băl, wă kơ sư kơjăp.

English: And the intricately woven band of the ephod, which is on it, shall be of the same workmanship, made of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen.
Bahnar: Tơlei tơ̆n đe tanh hơbĭ hăm ao êphot wă tơ̆n, đe kư̆m gô pơm păng brai rang iĕ, brai jơk, brai 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm păng che 'bui tanh hăm brai se.

English: “Then you shall take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel
Bahnar: Ih athei iŏk 'bar tŏ tơmo gĭt păng chrek chhơ̆ tơ noh anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael.

English: six of their names on one stone and six names on the other stone, in order of their birth.
Bahnar: Tơdrâu 'nu anăn lu sư chrek tơ tơmo 'nâu păng tơdrâu 'nu anăn lu sư tơ tơmo to, kiơ̆ kơ năr rơneh kơ lu sư.

English: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, you shall engrave the two stones with the names of the sons of Israel. You shall set them in settings of gold.
Bahnar: Athei chrek anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael tơ 'bar hlak tơmo rang 'noh nhen thoi bơngai chrek tơ tơmam tơdra kơtĭt păng hling maih tơter jih tơmo noh.

English: And you shall put the two stones on the shoulders of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel. So Aaron shall bear their names before the LORD on his two shoulders as a memorial.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh tah 'bar tŏ tơmo gĭt tơ tơlei 'băk tơ hơngiĕng wă pơm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael; Arôn gô 'băk anăn lu sư tơ 'bar pah hơngiĕng sư wă kơ 'blŏk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: You shall also make settings of gold
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei pơm gơwŏk păng maih.

English: and you shall make two chains of pure gold like braided cords, and fasten the braided chains to the settings.
Bahnar: Pơm 'bar dăng rơbưn glang iĕ păng maih rơgoh, thoi tơlei maih 'noh tơmơ̆t lăm kơ gơwŏk.

English: “You shall make the breastplate of judgment. Artistically woven according to the workmanship of the ephod you shall make it: of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, you shall make it.
Bahnar: Bơnal iĕ 'băk tơ kơpal kơtơh gah tơdrong sek tơlang, ih kư̆m athei pơm kơ bơnal, nhen thoi êphot. Wă păng brai maih brai jơk, 'brê hơhĭm 'brê gôh păng che 'bui tanh hăm brai se.

English: It shall be doubled into a square: a span shall be its length, and a span shall be its width.
Bahnar: Bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh să iĕ tŏ ăi păng sĭt 'bar tăl: Gah tor minh hơđa, gah wơ̆l minh hơđa mơ̆n.

English: And you shall put settings of stones in it, four rows of stones: The first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and an emerald; this shall be the first row
Bahnar: Ih tơmơ̆t puăn trong tơmo rang tơ lăm bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh; trong mă minh tơmo gôh rang Sardis tơmo hlăng Topas, tơmo rang Carbucle.

English: the second row shall be a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond
Bahnar: Trong mă 'bar tơmo gĭt Emeral, tơmo gĭt saphir, tơmo jơmŏng.

English: the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst
Bahnar: Trong mă pêng tơmo gĭt Jakin, tơmo gĭt Agate, tơmo gĭt amethit.

English: and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be set in gold settings.
Bahnar: Trong mă puăn tơmo gĭt Beril, tơmo gĭt Onit, tơmo gĭt jasper.

English: And the stones shall have the names of the sons of Israel, twelve according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, each one with its own name; they shall be according to the twelve tribes.
Bahnar: Gô đei đĭ-đăng mơjĭt-'bar găr, kiơ̆ kơ lu anăn kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael; tơ kơpal rim kơ găr tơmo rang 'noh đe chrek anăn minh 'nu lăm mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch adrung lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael, nhen thoi đe pơm tơmam tơdra kơtĭt 'noh.

English: “You shall make chains for the breastplate at the end, like braided cords of pure gold.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm rơbưn glang păng maih rơgoh, thoi tơlei kŭi tơ bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh

English: And you shall make two rings of gold for the breastplate, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
Bahnar: ih athei pơm 'bar tŏ gơwŏk păng maih chô̆ tơ 'bar pah mum gah bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh

English: Then you shall put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the breastplate
Bahnar: ih athei chô̆ 'bar dăng rơbưn maih tah tơmơ̆t tơ 'bar pah gơwŏk tơ 'bar pah kơ̆l 'băk bơnal tơ kơtơh

English: and the other two ends of the two braided chains you shall fasten to the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod in the front.
Bahnar: păng 'bar pah kơ̆l rơbưn chô̆ tơmơ̆t tơ lăm gơwŏk maih, na pơkăp tơklep tơ kơpal 'bar pah tơlei 'băk tơ hơngiĕng êphot gah anăp kơtơh.

English: “You shall make two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on the edge of it, which is on the inner side of the ephod.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm 'bar tŏ gơwŏk maih dơ̆ng, tơmơ̆t tơ 'bar pah mum kơ bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh, tơ gah lăm ao êphot.

English: And two other rings of gold you shall make, and put them on the two shoulder straps, underneath the ephod toward its front, right at the seam above the intricately woven band of the ephod.
Bahnar: Na athei pơm 'bar tŏ gơwŏk maih, pơkăp, pơklep tơmơ̆t tơ 'bar pah tơ tơlei 'băk tơ hơngiĕng ao êphot, tơ gah anăp, tơ kơpal tơlei tơ̆n ao êphot tanh hăm brai se.

English: They shall bind the breastplate by means of its rings to the rings of the ephod, using a blue cord, so that it is above the intricately woven band of the ephod, and so that the breastplate does not come loose from the ephod.
Bahnar: Yua tơlei brai jơk chô̆ bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh gơwŏk hăm êphot, tah lăm khuen maih wă kơ bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh păng êphot huay kơ tơpleh.

English: “So Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel on the breastplate of judgment over his heart, when he goes into the holy place, as a memorial before the LORD continually.
Bahnar: Kơplah Arôn mơ̆t tơ anih rơgoh, sư 'băk ba lu anăn kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael, mă anăn đei chrek tơ tơmo tah lăm bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh gah tơdrong sek tơlang, wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And you shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be over Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the LORD. So Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel over his heart before the LORD continually.
Bahnar: Ih dan lăm bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh gah tơdrong sek tơlang, Urim hăm Thumim,a wă kơ kơplah Arôn truh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang na dôm tơmam noh gô jê̆ lăm jơhngơ̆m Arôn kơdih, thoi noh Arôn gô yua Urim păng Thumim wă kơ băt sek tơlang lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang wă.*

English: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei sĭt ao tai hrŭk 'nguaih êphot hăm che jơk ngăl.

English: There shall be an opening for his head in the middle of it; it shall have a woven binding all around its opening, like the opening in a coat of mail, so that it does not tear.
Bahnar: Tơ tŏk-bŏk ao đei minh tŏ bơlôh tơmơ̆t kơ̆l; tăp dăr bơlôh đei lem, wă kơ huay kơ tơhleh.

English: And upon its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet, all around its hem, and bells of gold between them all around
Bahnar: Tơdrơi ao gah ala athei tanh plei gărnăt, jơk, 'brê hơhĭm, 'brê gôh atol hơdai krĕng-nĕng maih tăp dăr kiơ̆ kơ tơnăp

English: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe all around.
Bahnar: wă khan minh tŏ krĕng-nĕng maih na minh pôm plei gărnăt, minh găr krĕng-nĕng păng minh pôm plei gărnăt tơ tăp dăr tơnăp ao.

English: And it shall be upon Aaron when he ministers, and its sound will be heard when he goes into the holy place before the LORD and when he comes out, that he may not die.
Bahnar: Arôn pơm 'bok soi tơm, gô hrŭk ao 'noh păng kơplah sư mơ̆t lăm anih rơgoh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng kơplah sư lĕch đơ̆ng anih noh na đe gô kơtơ̆ng krĕng-nĕng re păng băt noh Arôn huay kơ lôch.

English: “You shall also make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving of a signet: HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh tŏ plăk maih rơgoh, ih athei chrek nhen thoi đe chrek pơm tơmam tơdra kơtĭt: Pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: And you shall put it on a blue cord, that it may be on the turban; it shall be on the front of the turban.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh iŏk minh dăng tơlei brai kŭi jơk sĭt pơklep 'bơ̆t anăp môk.

English: So it shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things which the children of Israel hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall always be on his forehead, that they may be accepted before the LORD.
Bahnar: Plăk 'noh gô sĭt dan tơ kơpal klĕng Arôn; Arôn pŭ tơdrong yoch lu bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch kơplah lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; plăk 'noh gô pơklep tơ kơpal klĕng Arôn ling-lang wă Kră Yang lăp đon iŏk lu sư.

English: “You shall skillfully weave the tunic of fine linen thread, you shall make the turban of fine linen, and you shall make the sash of woven work.
Bahnar: Ih athei tanh minh blah ao tai lăm hăm che 'bui brai se, athei pơm minh pôm môk păng che 'bui păng brai se tanh minh dăng tơlei tơ̆n.

English: “For Aaron’s sons you shall make tunics, and you shall make sashes for them. And you shall make hats for them, for glory and beauty.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei pơm kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn ao tai, tơlei tơ̆n păng môk, wă kơ pơyom ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: So you shall put them on Aaron your brother and on his sons with him. You shall anoint them, consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to Me as priests.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, athei iŏk hơbĕn ao 'noh pơhrŭk ăn kơ Arôn, 'nhŏng ih hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư; ih athei ăn đak 'bâu phu, kơ lu sư pơm rơgoh, wă kơ pôk lu sư jing 'bok soi gơh jang ăn kơ Inh.

English: And you shall make for them linen trousers to cover their nakedness; they shall reach from the waist to the thighs.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm ăn kơ sư hơbĕn iĕ lăm păng che 'bui brai se wă kơ pĕng tơdrong hang-hông sư, hơbĕn noh đơ̆ng kơiĕng truh tơ blu.

English: They shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they come into the tabernacle of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister in the holy place, that they do not incur iniquity and die. It shall be a statute forever to him and his descendants after him.
Bahnar: Arôn hăm kon drŏ-nglo sư gô tah hơbĕn 'noh lăm kơplah lu sư mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dah năm jê̆ chơnang soi wă jang lăm anih rơgoh, kơnh hli kơ lu sư lôch yua kơ hang-hông, tơdrong noh jing tơdrong juăt kơ Arôn păng adrĕch adrung sư pơm ling-lang.

English: “And this is what you shall do to them to hallow them for ministering to Me as priests: Take one young bull and two rams without blemish
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih tơdrong ih gô pơm, wă kơ sư pơm 'bok soi jang kơ Inh. Ih athei rôp minh pôm rơmo dăm păng 'bar tŏ triu tơno ưh kơ đei rơka.

English: and unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil (you shall make them of wheat flour).
Bahnar: Yua tơpŭng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông hrâu păng rơmă ôliwơ păng 'bĕng klang ưh kơ đei 'buih pông; dah pung hăm rơmă ôliwơ. Ih athei pơm 'bĕng noh hăm tơpŭng 'ba mi.

English: You shall put them in one basket and bring them in the basket, with the bull and the two rams.
Bahnar: Ih tah dôm 'bĕng 'noh lăm bai, đơ̆ng noh chĕp ba pơyơ̆r hơdai hloi hăm rơmo dăm păng 'bar tŏ triu tơno noh.

English: “And Aaron and his sons you shall bring to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and you shall wash them with water.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ih athei chông Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, ih iŏk đak tuh hum lu sư

English: Then you shall take the garments, put the tunic on Aaron, and the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the intricately woven band of the ephod.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, ih athei iŏk hơbĕn ao pơhrŭk ăn kơ Arôn ao tai, ao tai êphot, ao êphot păng bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh na iŏk tơlei tơ̆n êphot tanh hăm brai se tơ̆n ăn kơ sư.

English: You shall put the turban on his head, and put the holy crown on the turban.
Bahnar: Ih pơyơ̆l ăn môk tơ kơ̆l sư na pơklep plăk 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tơ môk

English: And you shall take the anointing oil, pour it on his head, and anoint him.
Bahnar: hăm iŏk đak pơgang 'bâu phu hling tơ kơpal kơ̆l sư.

English: Then you shall bring his sons and put tunics on them.
Bahnar: Na ih athei chông lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn năm jê̆ pơhrŭk ăn kơ lu sư ao tai

English: And you shall gird them with sashes, Aaron and his sons, and put the hats on them. The priesthood shall be theirs for a perpetual statute. So you shall consecrate Aaron and his sons.
Bahnar: klaih kơ 'noh iŏk tơlei tơ̆n, tơ̆n ăn kơ lu sư păng pơyơ̆l ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư môk, na tơdrong jang jing 'bok soi kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt oei ling-lang. Noh boih tơdrong jang mă ih gô pôk ăn kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo jing 'bok soi.

English: “You shall also have the bull brought before the tabernacle of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the bull.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, ih athei dui ba rơmo dăm tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư dan ti tơ kơpal rơmo dăm noh.

English: Then you shall kill the bull before the LORD, by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơlôch rơmo dăm noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: You shall take some of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and pour all the blood beside the base of the altar.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk pham rơmo dăm, djrŭ hơnglâu ti ih, pik tơ lu ake chơnang soi.

English: And you shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.
Bahnar: Ih athei iŏk đĭ-đăng dôm lu rơmă klak, mơ'nhao lom klơm, 'bar tŏ boh-lăn păng rơmă boh-lăn na anhăk năm 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: But the flesh of the bull, with its skin and its offal, you shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
Bahnar: Mă-lei akar, sĕch păng ĭch rơmo dăm noh athei chĕp 'buh tơ 'nguaih anih pơlei 'noh boih jing tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch.

English: “You shall also take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm triu tơno, na Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư dan ti lu sư kơpal kơ̆l triu tơno noh

English: and you shall kill the ram, and you shall take its blood and sprinkle it all around on the altar.
Bahnar: klaih kơ noh ih pơlôch triu tơno noh, iŏk pham sư tơtraih tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi 'noh.

English: Then you shall cut the ram in pieces, wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and with its head.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, kăt kơnăt triu tơno noh, ôp rơgoh, klak klơm păng jơ̆ng sư, na 'măn hơdai hăm lu kơnăt kăt boih păng kơ̆l sư

English: And you shall burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the LORD; it is a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Na 'buh pơđĭ triu tơno noh tơ kơpal chơnang soi; 'noh jing tơmam soi 'buh, đei 'bâu phu pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, wă khan tơmam soi 'buh păng ŭnh pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: “You shall also take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram.
Bahnar: Ih athei rôp kon triu tơno mă 'bar na Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư gô dan ti tơ kơpal kơ̆l triu tơno

English: Then you shall kill the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, on the thumb of their right hand and on the big toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: klaih kơ noh pơlôch triu tơno 'noh iŏk pham pik tơ hla đon gah 'ma Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, tơ hơnglâu yŏng tơpang ti 'ma lu sư păng hơnglâu yŏng jơ̆ng; gah 'ma lu sư; pham oei rơkah noh săi tăp dăr chơnang soi.

English: And you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar, and some of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments, on his sons and on the garments of his sons with him; and he and his garments shall be hallowed, and his sons and his sons’ garments with him.
Bahnar: Ih athei iŏk pham đơ̆ng kơpal chơnang soi păng rơmă pơgang 'bâu phu na tơtraih tơ kơpal akâu jăn păng hơbĕn ao Arôn, hăm tơ kơpal akâu păng hơbĕn ao lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, thoi noh Arôn hăm hơbĕn ao sư, lu kon drŏ-nglo sư hăm hơbĕn ao lu sư gô jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: “Also you shall take the fat of the ram, the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, the two kidneys and the fat on them, the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration)
Bahnar: Yua kơ kon triu tơno noh pơm yang pơchĕp ăn tơdrong jang, thoi noh ih athei iŏk rơmă; kiĕng, rơmă klak, mơ'nhao lom klơm, 'bar tŏ boh-lăn păng blu gah 'ma

English: one loaf of bread, one cake made with oil, and one wafer from the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the LORD
Bahnar: Păng iŏk minh pôm 'bĕng, minh pôm 'bĕng hrâu hăm rơmă ôliwơ păng minh pôm 'bĕng klang đơ̆ng lăm bai 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông 'măn lê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: and you shall put all these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and you shall wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
Bahnar: na dan dôm tơmam 'noh tơ lăm tơpang ti Arôn păng tơ lăm, tơpang ti lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, na tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo, noh jing tơmam soi tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: You shall receive them back from their hands and burn them on the altar as a burnt offering, as a sweet aroma before the LORD. It is an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh ih athei iŏk đơ̆ng tơpang ti lu sư, athei ba soh tơ kơpal chơnang soi, tơ kơpal tơmam soi sơmah 'buh, wă kơ 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, 'noh jing tơmam soi yua soh lăm ŭnh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: “Then you shall take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s consecration and wave it as a wave offering before the LORD; and it shall be your portion.
