Bahnar: Kŭm athei iŏk kơtơh triu tơno pơm yang pơchĕp ăn kơ Arôn, na tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, noh mă gah ih.

English: And from the ram of the consecration you shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering which is waved, and the thigh of the heave offering which is raised, of that which is for Aaron and of that which is for his sons.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei iŏk 'nhĕm kơtơh păng blu kon triu tơno yua pơm tơmam soi tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo, pơm pơchĕp ăn jing 'bok soi kơ 'bok Arôn, hăm dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, wă khan 'nhĕm kơtơh pơyơ̆r 'ma 'ngiĕo boih păng blu yua kơ noh jing tơmam soi pơyơ̆r.

English: It shall be from the children of Israel for Aaron and his sons by a statute forever. For it is a heave offering; it shall be a heave offering from the children of Israel from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, that is, their heave offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi 'nâu, đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư sa 'nâu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian, ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: “And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed in them and to be consecrated in them.
Bahnar: Hơbĕn ao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng Arôn gô 'măn lê̆ kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng, wă kơ lu sư hrŭk ao noh, 'bơ̆t năr đe hling đak rơmă 'bâu phu păng pơchĕp pôk ăn tơdrong jang pơm 'bok soi.

English: That son who becomes priest in his place shall put them on for seven days, when he enters the tabernacle of meeting to minister in the holy place.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lăm kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm 'bok soi tơplih kơ sư, athei hrŭk ao noh lăm tơpơh năr. Mưh sư mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm wă bơ̆jang lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: “And you shall take the ram of the consecration and boil its flesh in the holy place.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ 'noh ih athei rôp triu tơno wă pơm tơmam soi pơchĕp pôk tơdrong jang păng pai 'nhĕm 'noh lăm anih rơgoh.

English: Then Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Bok Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư gô sa 'nhĕm triu tơno 'noh, hăm 'bĕng đơ̆ng lăm bai 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: They shall eat those things with which the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them; but an outsider shall not eat them, because they are holy.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô sa lu tơmam soi noh, tơmam pơklaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, păng lu sư đei pôk jing 'bok soi păng 'măn lê̆ lu sư rơgoh; mă-lei lu bơngai nai ưh kơ gơh sa ôh, yua kơ dôm tơmam 'noh tơmam rơgoh.

English: And if any of the flesh of the consecration offerings, or of the bread, remains until the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'nhĕm hăm 'bĕng đêl soi sơmah oei rơkah na truh tơ năr dơning, ih athei 'buh hŭt pơđĭ tơ lăm ŭnh, 'nĕ kơ sa, yua kơ tơmam 'noh 'măn lê̆ kơ rơgoh 'lơ̆ng boih.

English: “Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. Seven days you shall consecrate them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Inh pơkă, ih athei pơm thoi noh kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng ih athei pơm dôm tơdrong noh kơ lu sư lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And you shall offer a bull every day as a sin offering for atonement. You shall cleanse the altar when you make atonement for it, and you shall anoint it to sanctify it.
Bahnar: Rim năr ih athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm pơm tơmam soi tang tơdrong yoch; păng pơm ăn kơ chơnang soi rơgoh, hăm tơdrong sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch, păng tuh đak 'bâu phu, wă kơ chơnang soi jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and sanctify it. And the altar shall be most holy. Whatever touches the altar must be holy.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr ih athei soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch păng pơm kơ chơnang soi rơgoh wă kơ chơnang soi jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng hloh, tơdah tơmam kiơ hơtŭt 'bơm kơ chơnang soi kư̆m jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two lambs of the first year, day by day continually.
Bahnar: 'Nâu dôm tơmam ih athei pơyơ̆r tơ chơnang soi; 'bar tŏ kon triu 'nao minh sơnăm, pơm rim năr ling-lang thoi noh.

English: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
Bahnar: Rim pơgê ih athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm, minh pôm ih athei pơyơ̆r til kơsơ̆ kơmăng.

English: With the one lamb shall be one-tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of pressed oil, and one-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering.
Bahnar: Hăm kon triu mă minh, ih athei pơyơ̆r 'bar lich,a êpha tơpŭng 'ba mi hĕch pơjrâu hăm minh lăm puăn hin,b đak ôliwơ păng iŏk minh lăm puăn hin đak hơmu, jing tơmam pơyơ̆r huch.c

English: And the other lamb you shall offer at twilight; and you shall offer with it the grain offering and the drink offering, as in the morning, for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Gah kon triu mă 'bar ih athei pơyơ̆r til kơsơ̆ măng hăm tơmam soi tơpŭng păng tơmam soi huch thoi lĕ til pơgê 'noh tơmam soi 'buh 'bâu phu pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: This shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of meeting before the LORD, where I will meet you to speak with you.
Bahnar: 'Noh jing tơmam soi 'buh na lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r ling-lang, lăm rim jơhnơr tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơ noh Inh gô jur pơma dơnuh hăm ih

English: And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle shall be sanctified by My glory.
Bahnar: Tơ noh Inh kư̆m wă gô tơ'bơ̆p lu kon pơlei Isơrael: 'Bơ̆t anih 'noh hăm tơdrong ư-ang Inh wă pơm kơ anih noh jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: So I will consecrate the tabernacle of meeting and the altar. I will also consecrate both Aaron and his sons to minister to Me as priests.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm hăm chơnang soi jing rơgoh; hăm ih kư̆m gô pơm kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư jing rơgoh mơ̆n, wă kơ lu sư bơ̆jang pơm 'bok soi kơ Inh.

English: I will dwell among the children of Israel and will be their God.
Bahnar: Inh gô oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael, pơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them. I am the LORD their God.
Bahnar: Na lu sư gô băt kơ Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, tơ'ngla chông ba lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ na wă kơ Inh oei hăm lu sư, Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: “You shall make an altar to burn incense on; you shall make it of acacia wood.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm minh pôm chơnang soi păng 'long keo wă kơ soh tơmam 'bâu phu.

English: A cubit shall be its length and a cubit its width—it shall be square—and two cubits shall be its height. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
Bahnar: Chơnang să iĕ tŏ ăi, gah tor minh hơgăt, gah wơ̆l minh hơgăt păng kơjung 'bar hơgăt; chơnang soi pơm puăn tŏ ake kơtă hloi.a

English: And you shall overlay its top, its sides all around, and its horns with pure gold; and you shall make for it a molding of gold all around.
Bahnar: Ih athei lom sư păng maih rơgoh tơ đĭ-đăng akâu sư păng tơ puăn tŏ ake; lem trong păng maih jum dăr.

English: Two gold rings you shall make for it, under the molding on both its sides. You shall place them on its two sides, and they will be holders for the poles with which to bear it.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm tơ ala kơ trong gơnăp 'bar tŏ khuen păng maih wă kơ gơh sôr 'long tung sư.

English: You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm 'bar tŏ 'long tơnung wă tung păng 'long keo, lom păng maih.

English: And you shall put it before the veil that is before the ark of the Testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the Testimony, where I will meet with you.
Bahnar: Ih gô ming chơnang soi 'noh gah anăp che pĕng găn jê̆ hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p păng tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat đơ̆p kơpal Hom anih Inh gô tơ'bơ̆p ih.

English: “Aaron shall burn on it sweet incense every morning; when he tends the lamps, he shall burn incense on it.
Bahnar: Rim til pơgê, kơplah Arôn tơ̆k hơmet ŭnh kơđeng, sư gô soh tơmam 'bâu phu tơ anih 'noh.

English: And when Aaron lights the lamps at twilight, he shall burn incense on it, a perpetual incense before the LORD throughout your generations.
Bahnar: Kơplah til kơsơ̆ măng, Arôn kư̆m tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng, kư̆m gô soh tơmam 'bâu phu; tơmam 'bâu phu 'nâu athei soh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang ling-lang, truh lăm rim jơhnơr.

English: You shall not offer strange incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering; nor shall you pour a drink offering on it.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal chơnang soi 'nâu 'nĕ kơ soh tơmam 'bâu phu ưh kơ rơgoh kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh soi tơpŭng dah tơmam soi huch.

English: And Aaron shall make atonement upon its horns once a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonement; once a year he shall make atonement upon it throughout your generations. It is most holy to the LORD.”
Bahnar: Minh sơnăm minh wơ̆t, Arôn gô iŏk pham kon sem dơrong soi 'buh huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, pik tơ kơpal ake chơnang soi wă pơm kơ chơnang soi rơgoh minh wơ̆t rim sơnăm lăm đĭ-đăng jơhnơr. 'Nâu boih jing chơnang soi rơgoh 'lơ̆ng hloh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “When you take the census of the children of Israel for their number, then every man shall give a ransom for himself to the LORD, when you number them, that there may be no plague among them when you number them.
Bahnar: Layơ ih chih jô̆ tơmơ̆t kơsô̆ kơ̆l bơngai Isơrael, rim 'nu kơ lu sư athei ăn jên wă huai tơdrong arih kơdih ăn kơ Kră Yang wă huay kơ đei tơdrong jĭ apoh truh lăm kơplah ih oei chih tơmơ̆t jô̆ lu sư.

English: This is what everyone among those who are numbered shall give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (a shekel is twenty gerahs). The half-shekel shall be an offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai ayơ đei anăn lăm sơ̆p hla bơar athei ăn jên minh puăt seikơlb kiơ̆ kơ seikơl anih rơgoh, trăp sư dang 'bar-jĭt gera thoi noh, minh puăt seikơl noh jing tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Everyone included among those who are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Dôm lu anăn đei chih jô̆ tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal athei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: The rich shall not give more and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when you give an offering to the LORD, to make atonement for yourselves.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam 'nâu ăn kơ Kră Yang wă kơ huai tơdrong arih kơdih, lu bơngai mơdrŏng ưh kơ ăn pơhloh, kơ lu bơngai dơnuh kư̆m ưh kơ gơh ăn hơtuch kơ minh puăt seikơl mơ̆n.

English: And you shall take the atonement money of the children of Israel, and shall appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of meeting, that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before the LORD, to make atonement for yourselves.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih ra iŏk jên wă kơ huai tơdrong arih lu bơngai Isơrael, na yua jên 'noh ih tơmơ̆t lăm tơdrong jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, 'noh jing tơmam 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang, wă kơ gơh huai tơdrong arih kơdih akâu iĕm.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “You shall also make a laver of bronze, with its base also of bronze, for washing. You shall put it between the tabernacle of meeting and the altar. And you shall put water in it
Bahnar: Ih athei pơm kơthŭng păng jơ̆ng kơthŭng păng kong, wă kơ ôp 'nhao, na ih ming dan sư sơlam Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm hăm chơnang soi păng tuh đak lăm noh.

English: for Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in water from it.
Bahnar: Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư gô ôp ti păng jơ̆ng lu sư tơ lăm đak noh.

English: When they go into the tabernacle of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to the LORD, they shall wash with water, lest they die.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư mơ̆t tơ lăm Bơsŭn anih akŭm lu sư ôp hơrao jơ̆ng ti, na lu sư huay kơ lôch; păng kơplah năm jê̆ chơnang soi wă 'buh tơmam soi yua ŭnh soh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, lu sư athei wei răk thoi noh.

English: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, lest they die. And it shall be a statute forever to them—to him and his descendants throughout their generations.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu sư athei ôp jơ̆ng ti, wă huay kơ lôch, 'noh jing minh tơdrong juăt ling-lang ăn kơ Arôn hăm adrĕch adrung sư rim jơhnơr.

English: Moreover the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Also take for yourself quality spices—five hundred shekels of liquid myrrh, half as much sweet-smelling cinnamon (two hundred and fifty shekels), two hundred and fifty shekels of sweet-smelling cane
Bahnar: Athei akŭm bĕ lu tơmam 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng hloh: Tơdrâu kĭ 'long pơgang 'bâu phu, pêng kĭ kơđoh 'long hol 'bâu phu, pêng kĭ chai 'bâu phu.

English: five hundred shekels of cassia, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and a hin of olive oil.
Bahnar: Tơdrâu kĭ kơđoh 'long Kasia 'bâu phu. Kiơ̆ kơ anih rơgoh păng puăn lit rơmă 'long ôliwơ.c

English: And you shall make from these a holy anointing oil, an ointment compounded according to the art of the perfumer. It shall be a holy anointing oil.
Bahnar: Ih athei iŏk dôm lu tơmam 'bâu phu 'noh, pơm đak rơmă 'bâu phu yua wă pơm pơgang pik 'lơ̆ng, rơgoh. Thoi đak 'bâu phu lŭk hrâu hơbĭ kiơ̆ thoi đe juăt kơ pơm rơmă 'bâu phu, sư jing đak 'bâu phu wă yua pik hling lăm tơdrong rơgoh.

English: With it you shall anoint the tabernacle of meeting and the ark of the Testimony
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, ih iŏk đak rơmă 'bâu phu pik tơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơ hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p.

English: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense
Bahnar: Gơ'bang hăm lu tơmam yua lăm sư, jơ̆ng kơđeng hăm lu tơmam yua lăm sư, chơnang soh pơgang 'bâu phu

English: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the laver and its base.
Bahnar: chơnang soi pơyơ̆r 'buh hăm tơmam yua lăm noh, kơthŭng đak hăm jơ̆ng kơthŭng.

English: You shall consecrate them, that they may be most holy; whatever touches them must be holy.
Bahnar: Ih athei 'măn dôm tơmam 'nâu pha pơm tơdrong rơgoh, wă kơ pơm rơgoh hloh, wă kơ tơmam kiơ hơtŭt 'bơm tă kơ gơh rơgoh.

English: And you shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may minister to Me as priests.
Bahnar: Ih athei tuh hling đak pơgang 'bâu phu ăn kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, 'măn lu sư pha wă kơ rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, wă kơ pơm 'bok soi bơ̆jang kơ Inh.

English: “And you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘This shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations.
Bahnar: Păng ih athei khan hăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael: Đak pơgang 'bâu phu 'nâu jơ̆ pơgang 'bâu phu rơgoh hloh wă yua lăm rim jơhnơr lu iĕm.

English: It shall not be poured on man’s flesh; nor shall you make any other like it, according to its composition. It is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ đe tuh tơ akâu kon bơngai nai păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ yua pơm pơgang 'bâu phu ayơ rok kiơ̆, tơmam 'bâu phu 'noh; pơgang 'bâu phu 'nâu jơ̆ pơgang rơgoh, kư̆m gô pơm ăn kơ lu iĕm, gơh rơgoh.

English: Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it on an outsider, shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơm rok pơgang 'bâu phu nhen thoi noh na tuh hling tơ minh bơngai nai, đe gô puh jăk đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: And the LORD said to Moses: “Take sweet spices, stacte and onycha and galbanum, and pure frankincense with these sweet spices; there shall be equal amounts of each.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Ih athei iŏk dôm tơmam 'bâu phu wă khan chai 'long hold, kơđoh hmok ka Ônichae, chai 'long Phrankincensef, chai 'long Galbuniumg, đĭ-đăng lu sư iŏk dôm ăi.h

English: You shall make of these an incense, a compound according to the art of the perfumer, salted, pure, and holy.
Bahnar: Ih ăn kơ bơngai gơh pơm pơgang 'bâu phu, gô pơm jing pơgang bâu phu 'lơ̆ng. 'Nâu pơgang 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng, đei 'boh, tŏ sĕt păng ling rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: And you shall beat some of it very fine, and put some of it before the Testimony in the tabernacle of meeting where I will meet with you. It shall be most holy to you.
Bahnar: Athei peh sư jing tơpŭng hĕch, na prôi sư 'bơ̆t anăp kơ Hom pơgơ̆p lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm anih mă Inh gô tơ'bơ̆p ih. Pơgang 'bâu phu âu rơgoh hloh.

English: But as for the incense which you shall make, you shall not make any for yourselves, according to its composition. It shall be to you holy for the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm tơmam 'bâu phu thoi 'nâu wă yua kơ iĕm kơdih, ih athei lăng pơm tơmam rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Whoever makes any like it, to smell it, he shall be cut off from his people.”
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơm nhen thoi noh wă yua kơdih akâu 'bâu phu, đe gô puh tơweh lê̆ sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis.

English: “See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
Bahnar: Âu inh krao bơih Bêsalel kon drŏ-nglo Uri, sâu Hur, đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Juđa.

English: And I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship
Bahnar: Inh ăn bơih kơ sư 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, hăm tơdrong hơgei, hlôh wao băt đei đon tơchĕng, wă kơ jang tanh sĭt, hling maih.

English: to design artistic works, to work in gold, in silver, in bronze
Bahnar: Inh ăn kơ sư gơh chă đon pơm tôm tơdrong, pơm păng maih păng hu păng kong

English: in cutting jewels for setting, in carving wood, and to work in all manner of workmanship.
Bahnar: chraih kuer tơmo, chraih hơkôih 'long, chrek chhơ̆.

English: “And I, indeed I, have appointed with him Aholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have put wisdom in the hearts of all the gifted artisans, that they may make all that I have commanded you
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m krao Ôhôliap kon drŏ-nglo Ahisamak, đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Đan jing bơngai tơgŭm sư. Inh kư̆m ăn bơih đei đon tơchĕng wă kơ gơh hơgei jang lăm tôm tơdrong jang. Inh kư̆m krao bơngai plơ̆ng wă kơ lu sư gơh pơm đĭ-đăng tơdrong jang mă inh đei pơkă khan kơ ih.

English: the tabernacle of meeting, the ark of the Testimony and the mercy seat that is on it, and all the furniture of the tabernacle
Bahnar: Bơsŭn anih akŭm hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p, tơnglơ̆p mơnat tơdrong yoch păng dôm tơmam yua lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: the table and its utensils, the pure gold lampstand with all its utensils, the altar of incense
Bahnar: Gơ'bang păng tơmam yua lăm sư, jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng maih rơgoh păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm sư, chơnang soi tơmam 'bâu phu.

English: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the laver and its base
Bahnar: Chơnang soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soh 'buh hăm đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm sư, kơthŭng đak păng jơ̆ng kơthŭng.

English: the garments of ministry, the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, to minister as priests
Bahnar: Hơbĕn ao giĕng, ăn kơ Arôn 'bok soi tơm hăm hơbĕn ao kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư wă yua lăm tơdrong jang 'bok soi.

English: and the anointing oil and sweet incense for the holy place. According to all that I have commanded you they shall do.”
Bahnar: Đak rơmă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng pơgang 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'măn lăm Anih Rơgoh. Lu sư gô pơm đĭ tôm tơdrong kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Inh đei pơkă ăn kơ ih.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak also to the children of Israel, saying: ‘Surely My Sabbaths you shall keep, for it is a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, that you may know that I am the LORD who sanctifies you.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, lu iĕm athei 'blŏk wei răk năr Sa'bat Inh, yua kơ tơdrong noh jơ̆ tơdrong tơdra tŏk-bŏk Inh hăm iĕm ling-lang đĭ jơhnơr, wă kơ iĕm băt Inh bơih Kră Yang, pơm ăn kơ iĕm jơ̆ rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: You shall keep the Sabbath, therefore, for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his people.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu iĕm athei bơwei năr Sa'bat yua kơ năr noh jing năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ lu iĕm. Bơngai bu pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ năr noh, đe gô pơlôch sư; hăm bơngai bu jang minh tơdrong kiơ lăm năr noh, đe gô pơpuh tơweh lê̆ sư.

English: Work shall be done for six days, but the seventh is the Sabbath of rest, holy to the LORD. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day, he shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Đe gô bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu năr, mă-lei năr mă tơpơh jơ̆ năr Sa'bat, năr pơdơh, năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang. Lăm năr Sa'bat, dah bơngai bu bơ̆jang minh tơdrong kiơ, đe gô pơpuh sư.

English: Therefore the children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their generations as a perpetual covenant.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu kon pơlei Isơrael gô wei răk năr Sa'bat, pơyom kơ năr Sa'bat lăm rim jơhnơr lu sư, jing tơdrong pơgơ̆p pơkă ling-lang khŏm khŏm.

English: It is a sign between Me and the children of Israel forever; for in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day He rested and was refreshed.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh jing tơdrong tơdra Inh hăm kon pơlei Isơrael ling-lang khŏm khŏm, yua kơ Kră Yang pơjing kơ plĕnh teh păng tôm tơmam lăm tơdrâu năr. Truh năr tơpơh sư pơdơh.

English: And when He had made an end of speaking with him on Mount Sinai, He gave Moses two tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
Bahnar: Lăp Kră Yang khan kơ Môis tơ kơpal kông Sinai, đang bơih sư ăn hloi 'bar tŏ gơ'bang tơdrong pơgơ̆p pơm păng tơmo blat đơ̆ng hơnglâu ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chih.

English: Now when the people saw that Moses delayed coming down from the mountain, the people gathered together to Aaron, and said to him, “Come, make us gods that shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei lăng Môis hiơ̆ kơ jur đơ̆ng kông, lu sư akŭm hloi tăp dăr kơ Arôn păng khan kơ sư: Pơm bĕ kơ bơ̆n lu rup yang năm adrol kơ bơ̆n; yua kơ Môis tơ'ngla mă tơlĕch bơ̆n đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ noh bơ̆n ưh kơ băt ôh tơdrong kiơ truh kơ sư bơih.

English: And Aaron said to them, “Break off the golden earrings which are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
Bahnar: Arôn khan kơ lu sư, toh bĕ le maih đơ̆ng đon akăn lu iĕm kon drŏ-nglo lu iĕm, hăm kon drŏ-kăn lu iĕm, klaih kơ noh ba kơ inh.

English: So all the people broke off the golden earrings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron.
Bahnar: Thoi noh đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei toh le maih đơ̆ng đon lu sư klaih kơ noh năm ăn kơ Arôn

English: And he received the gold from their hand, and he fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made a molded calf. Then they said, “This is your god, O Israel, that brought you out of the land of Egypt!”
Bahnar: Arôn iŏk tơmam lu noh đơ̆ng ti lu sư, sư hling maih noh, klaih kơ noh, sư tuh hling rup kon rơmo, na lu sư khan: Ơ bơngai Isơrael, 'nâu yang lu iĕm, tơ'ngla mă tơlĕch chông iĕm đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: So when Aaron saw it, he built an altar before it. And Aaron made a proclamation and said, “Tomorrow is a feast to the LORD.”
Bahnar: Arôn 'bôh tơdrong noh, sư pơm minh pôm chơnang soi 'bơ̆t anăp rup rơmo kon noh; păng ôr re khan. Pơgê dơning đei pơm giĕng kơkuh pơyom kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then they rose early on the next day, offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning lu sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih, klaih kơ noh lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, hăm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê, lu kon pơlei pơla hơ-oei, wă sa et, đơ̆ng noh lu sư iung hơnul pơchơt.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Go, get down! For your people whom you brought out of the land of Egypt have corrupted themselves.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Jah jur bĕ, yua kơ lu kon pơlei pơla ih, lu bơngai mă ih đei chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, lu sư pơm glăi răm bơih

English: They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them. They have made themselves a molded calf, and worshiped it and sacrificed to it, and said, ‘This is your god, O Israel, that brought you out of the land of Egypt!’ ”
Bahnar: lu sư đĭ hăt kơ tơklah boih đơ̆ng trong Inh đei tơtă ăn kơ lu sư. Lu sư man pơm rup kon rơmo kơdih lu sư bơih, lu sư kơkuh păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ rup noh, klaih kơ noh lu sư khan; Ơ bơngai Isơrael, 'nâu yang ih, tơ'ngla mă đei chông tơlĕch ih đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ!

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and indeed it is a stiff-necked people!
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Inh 'bôh boih kon pơlei pơla âu jing kon pơlei pơla arăng kơ̆l tơpă.

English: Now therefore, let Me alone, that My wrath may burn hot against them and I may consume them. And I will make of you a great nation.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, lê̆ Inh hil mĭl kơ lu sư, pơrăm pơtôch lê̆ lu sư; mă-lei Inh gô pơjing đơ̆ng ih minh adrĕch adrung tih tơpă.

English: Then Moses pleaded with the LORD his God, and said: “LORD, why does Your wrath burn hot against Your people whom You have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis krao apinh hloi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư khan, Ơ Kră Yang, liơ Ih ơh blĕk hil mĭl kơ kon pơlei pơla Ih, khŭl bơngai mă Ih đei chông tơlĕch bơih đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ hăm tơdrong mơsêh tih hăm ti pran kơtang Ih?

English: Why should the Egyptians speak, and say, ‘He brought them out to harm them, to kill them in the mountains, and to consume them from the face of the earth’? Turn from Your fierce wrath, and relent from this harm to Your people.
Bahnar: Liơ Ih wă lê̆ lu bơngai Êyiptơ khan: ‘Kră Yang chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng char bơ̆n wă pơrăm lê̆, pơlôch lê̆ lu sư tơ lăm kông, hăm pơrăm pơtôch lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng lăm teh đak âu?’ Lê̆ bĕ tơdrong Ih blĕk tơtŏ păng tơplih tơdrong tơchĕng Ih wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ kon pơlei pơla Ih.

English: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, Your servants, to whom You swore by Your own self, and said to them, ‘I will multiply your descendants as the stars of heaven; and all this land that I have spoken of I give to your descendants, and they shall inherit it forever.’ ”
Bahnar: Apinh Ih athei 'blŏk bĕ kơ Abraham, Isăk, hăm Isơrael, lu đĭch đam Ih mă Ih đei yua anăn Ih kơdih, na pơkă: Inh gô ăn kon sâu lu iĕm lơ thoi lu sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh păng Inh gô ăn kơ kon sâu lu iĕm đĭ-đăng teh đak âu mă Inh đei pơkă boih kơ lu sư gô oei tơ noh jang sa ling-lang khŏm khŏm.

English: So the LORD relented from the harm which He said He would do to His people.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang tơplih tơdrong Sư tơchĕng wă pơm kơnê̆ lu kon pơlei pơla Sư.

English: And Moses turned and went down from the mountain, and the two tablets of the Testimony were in his hand. The tablets were written on both sides; on the one side and on the other they were written.
Bahnar: Môis jur brŏk đơ̆ng kông chĕp ba 'bar tŏ gơ'bang tơdrong pơgơ̆p, 'bar tŏ gơ'bang pơgơ̆p noh đei chih 'bar pah.

English: Now the tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God engraved on the tablets.
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ gơ'bang noh đơ̆ng tơdrong jang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm chư noh kư̆m đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, chih răk 'bơ̆t tơmo.

English: And when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is a noise of war in the camp.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Jôsuê kơtơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla ôr, sư khan kơ Môis khan: “Đei jơwa tơdrong tơblah tơ lăm anih kon pơlei.”

English: But he said: “It is not the noise of the shout of victory, Nor the noise of the cry of defeat, But the sound of singing I hear.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis tơl khan: “Ưh kơ trŏ nơ̆r ôr gah tơdrong jei. Kŭm ưh kơ trŏ nơ̆r ôr lu sư thuơ ôh, Mă-lei inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu đe hơri.”

English: So it was, as soon as he came near the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing. So Moses’ anger became hot, and he cast the tablets out of his hands and broke them at the foot of the mountain.
Bahnar: Lăp sư truh jê̆ anih kon pơlei, sư 'bôh kon rơmo, hăm lu bơngai oei yŭn suang. Môis 'blut ơh blĕk hloi, klaih kơ noh sư hơtat lê̆ gơ'bang pơgơ̆p noh đơ̆ng ti sư tơ jơ̆ng kông, gơ'bang noh pơchah hloi.

English: Then he took the calf which they had made, burned it in the fire, and ground it to powder; and he scattered it on the water and made the children of Israel drink it.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk rup kon rơmo lu sư pơm soh hloi tơ lăm ŭnh, đơ̆ng noh sư peh pơhĕch jing gơnơ̆k păng iŏk gơnơ̆k noh tuh tơ lăm đak, klaih kơ noh ăn lu kon pơlei Isơrael nhă.

English: And Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought so great a sin upon them?”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Arôn: Kon pơlei đei pơm kiơ kơ ih na dĭng ih mah pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla pơm yoch tih krưp thoi noh.

English: So Aaron said, “Do not let the anger of my lord become hot. You know the people, that they are set on evil.
Bahnar: Arôn khan: Apinh ih 'nĕ kơ blĕk kơ inh, ih băt kon pơlei pơla âu 'maih pơm tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: For they said to me, ‘Make us gods that shall go before us; as for this Moses, the man who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ inh; athei ih pơm bĕ kơ bơ̆n rup yang năm adrol kơ bơ̆n; yua kơ Môis tơ'ngla mă chông tơlĕch bơ̆n đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ noh, bơ̆n ưh kơ băt ôh tơdrong kiơ truh kơ sư bơih.

English: And I said to them, ‘Whoever has any gold, let them break it off.’ So they gave it to me, and I cast it into the fire, and this calf came out.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu sư: Bu đei maih athei lu sư plôh bĕ; na lu sư ăn maih noh tơ inh, inh klơ̆m 'buh maih noh lăm ŭnh, đơ̆ng noh na jing đei hĭ rup kon rơmo âu.

English: Now when Moses saw that the people were unrestrained (for Aaron had not restrained them, to their shame among their enemies)
Bahnar: Môis 'bôh kon pơlei pơla đei tơdrong rơngei pơm kư̆ kă mơ̆ng kơ lu sư wă, ưh kơ đei bơngai wei-lăng lu sư, yua kơ Arôn lê̆ lu sư rơngei dĭng mah đei tơdrong lu ayăt pơjăm lu sư.

English: then Moses stood in the entrance of the camp, and said, “Whoever is on the LORD’s side—come to me!” And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him.
Bahnar: Yua thoi noh Môis oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng jang anih kon pơlei păng khan: “Bu gah Kră Yang, năm bĕ tơ inh, đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo bơngai Lêwi akŭm hăm sư.

English: And he said to them, “Thus says the LORD God of Israel: ‘Let every man put his sword on his side, and go in and out from entrance to entrance throughout the camp, and let every man kill his brother, every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ đe noh: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan thoi âu. Rim 'nu lu iĕm athei kiĕo đao tơ kơiĕng lu iĕm, chă yơyak jơ̆p lăm anih kon pơlei đơ̆ng 'măng jang 'nâu, tơ 'măng jang to păng rim 'nu lu iĕm athei pơlôch 'nhŏng oh iĕm, buăl juăt iĕm hăm lu bơngai tăp dăr kơ lu iĕm.

English: So the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. And about three thousand men of the people fell that day.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo bơngai Lêwi pơm kiơ̆ hloi thoi nơ̆r Môis pơkă noh; lăm năr noh lu sư pơlôch dang pêng-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: Then Moses said, “Consecrate yourselves today to the LORD, that He may bestow on you a blessing this day, for every man has opposed his son and his brother.”
Bahnar: Na Môis khan: Năr âu rim 'nu lu iĕm pơyơ̆r boih lu iĕm kơ tơdrong jang Kră Yang, ưh pă rong minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, dah 'nhŏng oh kơdih, thoi noh Kră Yang ăn kơ iĕm pŭn hiôk năr âu.

English: Now it came to pass on the next day that Moses said to the people, “You have committed a great sin. So now I will go up to the LORD; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
Bahnar: Năr dơning Môis khan kơ lu kon pơlei pơla lu iĕm pơm bơih minh tơdrong glăi tih. Mă-lei dang ei inh wă tŏk tơ kông năm tơ Kră Yang. Rŏ lăng inh kư̆m gơh apinh huai iŏk tơdrong yoch lu iĕm.

English: Then Moses returned to the LORD and said, “Oh, these people have committed a great sin, and have made for themselves a god of gold!
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis wơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ Kră Yang păng khan: Ơ Kră Yang, lu kon pơlei pơla âu pơm bơih minh tơdrong glăi tih. Lu sư pơm rup yang hăm maih păng kơkuh.

English: Yet now, if You will forgive their sin—but if not, I pray, blot me out of Your book which You have written.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei, dang ei apinh Ih mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch lu sư. Dah ưh, apinh sŭt lê̆ bĕ anăn inh đơ̆ng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Ih đei chih bơih noh

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against Me, I will blot him out of My book.
Bahnar: mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Bơngai bu pơm yoch bơih hăm Inh, Inh gô sŭt anăn sư đơ̆ng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Inh.

English: Now therefore, go, lead the people to the place of which I have spoken to you. Behold, My Angel shall go before you. Nevertheless, in the day when I visit for punishment, I will visit punishment upon them for their sin.”
Bahnar: Dang ei năm bĕ chông lu kon pơlei pơla năm tơ anih mă Inh đei khan bơih kơ ih. Âu, linh jang 'lơ̆ng Inh gô năm adrol kơ ih. Mă-lei năr ayơ Inh tơiung kơting, lei Inh gô phak lu sư yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm bơih.

English: So the LORD plagued the people because of what they did with the calf which Aaron made.
Bahnar: Kră Yang phak kon pơlei pơla hăm tơdrong jĭ apoh, yua kơ lu sư yoch pơm rup kon rơmo maih mă Arôn tuh hling.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Depart and go up from here, you and the people whom you have brought out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your descendants I will give it.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Năm bĕ đơ̆ng âu, ih hăm lu kon pơlei pơla ih đei chông lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, năm bĕ tơ char Inh đei pơkă pơkăm boih kơ Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp: Inh gô ăn char noh kơ kon sâu ih.

English: And I will send My Angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanite and the Amorite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.
Bahnar: Inh gô wơh minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng Inh năm adrol kơ ih, na Inh gô puh tơweh lu bơngai Kanaan, Amôrit, Hêtit, Pêrisit, Hêwit, hăm lu bơngai Jêbus

English: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey; for I will not go up in your midst, lest I consume you on the way, for you are a stiff-necked people.”
Bahnar: năm bĕ iĕm tơ char đei đak toh, hăm đak sut; mă-lei Inh ưh kơ đei năm hơdai ih ôh, yua kơ iĕm adrĕch arăng kơ̆l kơnh hli kơ Inh pơrăm lê̆ lu iĕm rok trong.

English: And when the people heard this bad news, they mourned, and no one put on his ornaments.
Bahnar: Kơplah kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ noh, lu sư sơ'ngon kơdih kơdih, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu 'bot dah đoh tơmam pơhrôp.

English: For the LORD had said to Moses, “Say to the children of Israel, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. I could come up into your midst in one moment and consume you. Now therefore, take off your ornaments, that I may know what to do to you.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan bơih kơ Môis, khan bĕ lu kon pơlei pơla Isơrael, lu iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla arăng kơ̆l, dah Inh năm hơdai iĕm 'nao lăp hrei hrei đĕch, Inh gô pơrăm iĕm! Thoi noh dang ei plôh bĕ tơmam pơhrôp iĕm, wă kơ Inh băt gô pơm kiơ kơ iĕm.

English: So the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments by Mount Horeb.
Bahnar: Lei na iŏk đơ̆ng kông Hôrêp kon pơlei pơla Isơrael plôh lê̆ đĭ tơmam pơhrôp lu sư.

English: Moses took his tent and pitched it outside the camp, far from the camp, and called it the tabernacle of meeting. And it came to pass that everyone who sought the LORD went out to the tabernacle of meeting which was outside the camp.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Môis chĕp ba bơsŭn năm pơdơ̆ng tơ 'nguaih ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng anih kon pơlei oei, sư anăn bơsŭn 'noh “Bơsŭn Krao Apinh.” Dah bơngai bu 'maih wă krao apinh chă Kră Yang sư năm tơ bơsŭn noh tơ 'nguaih kơ anih kon pơlei oei.

English: So it was, whenever Moses went out to the tabernacle, that all the people rose, and each man stood at his tent door and watched Moses until he had gone into the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t mưh Môis lĕch năm tơ bơsŭn noh đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla iung dang dơ̆ng, rim 'nu dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng bơsŭn sư, kiơ̆ hnhoi lăng Môis dĭng sư mơ̆t lăm bơsŭn anih krao apinh.

English: And it came to pass, when Moses entered the tabernacle, that the pillar of cloud descended and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and the LORD talked with Moses.
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis mơ̆t boih lăm bơsŭn, anih krao apinh đei hơmơ̆l thoi jrăng jur gom 'bơ̆t 'măng bơsŭn, noh na Kră Yang pơma dơnuh hăm sư.

English: All the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the tabernacle door, and all the people rose and worshiped, each man in his tent door.
Bahnar: Kơplah đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla 'bôh hơmơ̆l thoi jrăng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng bơsŭn, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng bơsŭn lu sư drap kơkuh.

English: So the LORD spoke to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. And he would return to the camp, but his servant Joshua the son of Nun, a young man, did not depart from the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Kră Yang juăt pơma dơnuh hăm Môis tơm măt thoi noh nhen thoi minh 'nu bơngai pơma dơnuh hăm buăl juăt sư. Đơ̆ng noh Môis wơ̆t brŏk tơ anih kon pơlei, mă-lei Jôsuê bơngai tơdăm tơgŭm sư kon drŏ-nglo Nun, ưh kơ đei lĕch đơ̆ng bơsŭn krao apinh noh ôh.

English: Then Moses said to the LORD, “See, You say to me, ‘Bring up this people.’ But You have not let me know whom You will send with me. Yet You have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have also found grace in My sight.’
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Kră Yang: Ih đei khan bơih kơ inh thoi âu: Ih athei chông ba lu kon pơlei pơla âu năm, mă-lei Ih ưh kơ ăn inh băt ôh bơngai bu Ih wơh năm hơdai păng inh. Ih khan: Inh băt kơ ih, băt anăn ih păng ih đei tơdrong mơnat boih 'bơ̆t anăp Inh!

English: Now therefore, I pray, if I have found grace in Your sight, show me now Your way, that I may know You and that I may find grace in Your sight. And consider that this nation is Your people.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei inh krao apinh Ih, tơdah inh đei bơih pŭn hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, lei inh apinh Ih tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh bĕ trong Ih, wă kơ inh băt kơnăl kơ Ih păng inh đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, apinh Ih kư̆m 'blŏk kơ lu adrĕch adrung âu kon pơlei pơla Ih mơ̆n!

English: And He said, “My Presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inha gô năm hơdai hăm Ih păng Inh gô ăn kơ ih jơhngơ̆m hơđơ̆ng hiôk.

English: Then he said to Him, “If Your Presence does not go with us, do not bring us up from here.
Bahnar: Môis tơl khan: Mưh Ih ưh kơ đei năm hơdai hăm inh, lei 'nĕ ăn kơ lu nhôn weh đơ̆ng anih âu.

English: For how then will it be known that Your people and I have found grace in Your sight, except You go with us? So we shall be separate, Your people and I, from all the people who are upon the face of the earth.”
Bahnar: Lei liơ đe gơh băt kơnăl kơ inh hăm lu kon pơlei pơla Ih? Đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, Dah Ih ưh kơ năm hơdai hăm nhôn? Mưh Ih năm hơdai inh hăm kon pơlei pơla Ih âu phara kơ kon pơlei pơla nai oei lăm teh đak âu?

English: So the LORD said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have spoken; for you have found grace in My sight, and I know you by name.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Inh gô pơm thoi ih đei apinh Inh noh, yua kơ ih đei tơdrong mơnat bơih 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, Inh băt kơ ih; păng băt kơ anăn ih.

English: And he said, “Please, show me Your glory.”
Bahnar: Môis khan: Inh apinh Ih, tơ'bôh bĕ kơ inh tơdrong ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ Ih.

English: Then He said, “I will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim the name of the LORD before you. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inh gô pơdah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng Inh 'bơ̆t anăp ih, klaih kơ noh Inh gô roi anăn Inh Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp ih, Inh gô mơnat kơ bơngai bu mă Inh 'maih mơnat, hăm Inh gô pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ bơngai bu mă inh 'maih pơm 'lơ̆ng.

English: But He said, “You cannot see My face; for no man shall see Me, and live.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Sư khan dơ̆ng: Mă-lei ih ưh kơ đei 'bôh muh măt Inh ôh; yua kơ kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh 'bôh Inh na mă oei arih.

English: And the LORD said, “Here is a place by Me, and you shall stand on the rock.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng đei minh pôm anih tơmo jê̆ Inh, ih gô dơ̆ng kơpal tơmo 'noh.

English: So it shall be, while My glory passes by, that I will put you in the cleft of the rock, and will cover you with My hand while I pass by.
Bahnar: Mưh tơdrong ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ Inh năm brih, Inh gô dan ih tơ lăm trôm tơmo păng Inh gô pĕng ih hăm ti Inh, dĭng mă Inh năm hlôi 'mơ̆i.

English: Then I will take away My hand, and you shall see My back; but My face shall not be seen.”
Bahnar: Inh gô dui lê̆ ti Inh đơ̆ng noh ih 'bôh gah rŏng Inh đĕch mă-lei ih ưh kơ gơh 'bôh muh măt Inh ôh.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Cut two tablets of stone like the first ones, and I will write on these tablets the words that were on the first tablets which you broke.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Ih athei traih tơmo pơm 'bar hlak gơ'bang nhen thoi gơ'bang adrol ki, đơ̆ng noh Inh gô chih 'bơ̆t gơ'bang noh, nơ̆r pơma thoi 'bơ̆t gơ'bang mă ih hơtat pơchah lê̆ noh ki.

English: So be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself to Me there on the top of the mountain.
Bahnar: Dơning athei năm bĕ tơ kông Sinai; đơ̆ng hrôih gô inh na gô tơ'bơ̆p Inh tơ kơpal kông.

English: And no man shall come up with you, and let no man be seen throughout all the mountain; let neither flocks nor herds feed before that mountain.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn bơngai bu năm tŏk kiơ̆ hơdai hăm ih, ưh kơ gơh ăn bơngai bu chă ngôi tăp dăr kơ kông. Kŭm ưh kơ ăn triu, rơmo sa 'nhĕt jê̆ tơ kông noh mơ̆n.

English: So he cut two tablets of stone like the first ones. Then Moses rose early in the morning and went up Mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him; and he took in his hand the two tablets of stone.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis traih hloi 'bar hlak gơ'bang păng tơmo thoi adrol ki. Sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih tŏk tơ kông Sinai, chĕp ba 'bar hlak gơ'bang noh kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă kơ sư.

English: Now the LORD descended in the cloud and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jur lăm hơmơ̆l, dơ̆ng hơdai hăm Môis tơ noh păng roi anăn sư.

English: And the LORD passed before him and proclaimed, “The LORD, the LORD God, merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abounding in goodness and truth
Bahnar: Kră Yang năm brih 'bơ̆t anăp Môis păng khan: Inh bơih Kră Yang, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bĕnh tơdrong 'mêm mơnat, iơ̆m dim 'mêm kơeng hiơ̆ kơ hil, pơm trŏ 'blep đêl Sư pơkă hăm tơdrong sĭt.

English: keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children and the children’s children to the third and the fourth generation.”
Bahnar: Răk tơdrong 'mêm kơeng kơ lơ rơbâu jơhnơr kon bơngai, mơnat ăn tơdrong pơm kơnê̆, pơm yoch kơ tơdrong juăt mă-lei Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh gô phak bơngai pơm yoch păng jô̆ tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng Mĕ 'Bă sư pơm, inh gô phak truh tơ kon sâu sư dĭng truh tơ pêng puăn jơhnơr.

English: So Moses made haste and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshiped.
Bahnar: Môis hăt hot kŭp kơ̆l tơ teh kơkuh pơyom.

English: Then he said, “If now I have found grace in Your sight, O Lord, let my Lord, I pray, go among us, even though we are a stiff-necked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us as Your inheritance.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: Ơ Kră Yang! Dang ei mưh khan inh đei bơih tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp Ih inh apinh Ih năm hơdai lu nhôn, mă khan lu sư jing kon pơlei pơla arăng kơ̆l, apinh Ih mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu nhôn, na jô̆ nhôn jing tơmam Ih yua.

English: And He said: “Behold, I make a covenant. Before all your people I will do marvels such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among whom you are shall see the work of the LORD. For it is an awesome thing that I will do with you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Âu Inh pơm minh tơdrong pơgơ̆p. Inh gô pơm minh tơdrong, mơsêh hlĭch chrơp 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla ih, tơdrong mă tam lah 'bôh tơ lăm minh adrĕch ayơ lăm teh đak âu. Na đĭ-đăng kon bơngai, gô 'bôh tơdrong jang Kră Yang; Inh gô pơm tơdrong hli krưp dêh.

English: Observe what I command you this day. Behold, I am driving out from before you the Amorite and the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ tơdrong Inh pơkă ăn kơ ih năr âu: Âu Inh gô puh tơweh bơngai Amôrit, Kanaan, Hêtit, Pêrisit, Hêwit, hăm bơngai Jêbus đơ̆ng anăp ih.

English: Take heed to yourself, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where you are going, lest it be a snare in your midst.
Bahnar: Ih athei kơchăng kơdih, ih 'nĕ pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm lu bơngai lăm dêh char mă ih wă mơ̆t, tơdrong noh hli kơ lu sư jing thoi hơđong hơ'năk kơ ih.

English: But you shall destroy their altars, break their sacred pillars, and cut down their wooden images
Bahnar: Ih athei pơrăm lê̆ chơnang soi teh pơchah lê̆ gơ̆ng păng kăl tơpăk lê̆ rup yang Asêrim lu sư.

English: (for you shall worship no other god, for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God)
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ drap kơkuh kơ lu yang nai ôh. Yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang jơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'ngla băt gar.

English: lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they play the harlot with their gods and make sacrifice to their gods, and one of them invites you and you eat of his sacrifice
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm lu bơngai tơ lăm char noh. Mưh lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă kơplah lu sư pơm yang, sư pơtơm ih sa, đơ̆ng noh ih gô sa hloi tơmam sư pơm yang.

English: and you take of his daughters for your sons, and his daughters play the harlot with their gods and make your sons play the harlot with their gods.
Bahnar: Na ih 'nĕ rôp akăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo ih, kon adruh lu sư gô pơm kư̆ kă hăm yang lu sư, đơ̆ng noh pơhlŭ kon tơdăm ih kư̆m pơm kư̆ kă kiơ̆ yang lu sư mơ̆n.

English: “You shall make no molded gods for yourselves.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơm lu rup yang.

English: “The Feast of Unleavened Bread you shall keep. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, in the appointed time of the month of Abib; for in the month of Abib you came out from Egypt.
Bahnar: Ih athei 'blŏk răk kơ năr giĕng sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei hăm 'buih pông, iĕm athei sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei hăm 'buih pông lăm tơpơh năr, thoi Inh đei pơkă ăn kơ ih boih yua kơ trŏ 'bơ̆t khei mônh 'noh iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “All that open the womb are Mine, and every male firstborn among your livestock, whether ox or sheep.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo kơdră jơ̆ gah Inh ngăl. Đĭ-đăng sem dơrong rơmo dah triu, tơno tuh blŭng-a kư̆m lei-lăi jơ̆ gah Inh mơ̆n

English: But the firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb. And if you will not redeem him, then you shall break his neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. “And none shall appear before Me empty-handed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ih athei rôp minh pôm kon triu dah kon bơbe wă huai tơplih kơ kon aseh iĕ kơdră dah ưh kơ đei huai sư, ih athei gơ̆ lê̆ hơko aseh iĕ, na ih gơh huai iŏk lu kon drŏ-nglo kơdră ih. Ưh kơ gơh bơngai bu năm tơpang ti hoh 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: “Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest; in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.
Bahnar: Ih athei bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu năr, mă-lei lăm năr tơpơh ih athei pơdơh, ih athei pơdơh năr Sa'bat mă khan bơyan choh dah bơyan kĕch kư̆m pơdơh lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: “And you shall observe the Feast of Weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at the year’s end.
Bahnar: Ih athei 'blŏk răk năr giĕng, bơyan blŭng-a ih kĕch phĕ, yuă 'ba mi, hăm bơyan ih phĕ kĕch yuă tuch-luch lăm sơnăm.

English: “Three times in the year all your men shall appear before the Lord, the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm minh sơnăm pêng wơ̆t, đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo lu iĕm athei dơ̆ng tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: For I will cast out the nations before you and enlarge your borders; neither will any man covet your land when you go up to appear before the LORD your God three times in the year.
Bahnar: Inh gô puh tơweh lê̆ lu adrĕch adrung nai đơ̆ng anăp ih, Inh gô pơih dêh char ih rai să, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu tơgar dêh char iĕm mơ̆n kơplah ih năm dơ̆ng tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, pêng wơ̆t lăm rim sơnăm.a

English: “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leaven, nor shall the sacrifice of the Feast of the Passover be left until morning.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơyơ̆r pham tơmam soi hơdai hăm 'bĕng đei 'buih pông, 'nhĕm tơmam soi giĕng Năm Brih noh ưh kơ gơh mơmăn truh tơ pơgê dơning.

English: “The first of the firstfruits of your land you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
Bahnar: Ih athei chĕp ba tơ hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei plei blŭng-a đơ̆ng mir ih. Ih 'nĕ kơ pai 'nhĕm bơbe kon lăm đak toh mĕ sư ôh.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Write these words, for according to the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Chih răk bĕ nơ̆r pơma âu, yua kơ trŏ kiơ̆ thoi lu nơ̆r âu na Inh pơgơ̆p pơkă hăm ih păng hăm lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: So he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread nor drank water. And He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.
Bahnar: Môis sư oei hơdai hăm Kră Yang tơ kông noh puăn-jĭt năr puăn-jĭt măng, sư ưh kơ đei sŏng sa kư̆m ưh kơ đei nhă đak, đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang chih tơ 'bar hlak gơ'bang tơmo dôm lu nơ̆r pơgơ̆p, wă khan mơjĭt khôi juăt.

English: Now it was so, when Moses came down from Mount Sinai (and the two tablets of the Testimony were in Moses’ hand when he came down from the mountain), that Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone while he talked with Him.
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis jur đơ̆ng kông Sinai ti sư chĕp ba 'bar hlak gơ'bang tơdrong pơgơ̆p, Môis ưh kơ băt ôh muh măt kơdih sư hơdah yua kơ đơ̆ng sư pơma dơnuh hăm Kră Yang.

English: So when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone, and they were afraid to come near him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Arôn hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla Isơrael lăng 'bôh Môis muh măt rang mơnhal lu sư hli ưh kơ pơ̆n năm jê̆.

English: Then Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned to him; and Moses talked with them.
Bahnar: Môis krao lu sư hloi. Arôn hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r năm jê̆, na Môis pơma dơnuh hăm lu sư.

English: Afterward all the children of Israel came near, and he gave them as commandments all that the LORD had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla Isơrael năm jê̆ sư, sư bơtho, pơkă dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă kơ sư đơ̆ng kơpal kông Sinai.

English: And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil on his face.
Bahnar: Môis đang kơ pơma dơnuh hăm lu sư, na Môis iŏk che gom lê̆ muh măt sư.

English: But whenever Moses went in before the LORD to speak with Him, he would take the veil off until he came out; and he would come out and speak to the children of Israel whatever he had been commanded.
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis mơ̆t pơma dơnuh hăm Kră Yang sư pơih lê̆ che mă sư gom muh măt sư noh dĭng truh tơ sư lĕch. Păng roi ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla Isơrael dơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r mă Kră Yang đei pơkă khan boih kơ sư.

English: And whenever the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses’ face shone, then Moses would put the veil on his face again, until he went in to speak with Him.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla Isơrael lăng 'bôh muh măt Môis hơdah rang mơnhal na Môis klơ̆p dơ̆ng muh măt sư dĭng truh tơ sư mơ̆t pơma dơnuh hăm Kră Yang dơ̆ng.

English: Then Moses gathered all the congregation of the children of Israel together, and said to them, “These are the words which the LORD has commanded you to do
Bahnar: Môis krao akŭm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla Isơrael na khan kơ lu sư: 'Nâu dôm tơdrong Kră Yang bơtho khan athei lu iĕm wei răk pơm kiơ̆.

English: Work shall be done for six days, but the seventh day shall be a holy day for you, a Sabbath of rest to the LORD. Whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu năr, mă-lei truh năr mă tơpơh năr noh năr Sa'bat 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'măn pơdơh kơ Kră Yang. Bơngai bu jang minh tơdrong kiơ̆ lăm năr noh, đe gô pơlôch sư.

English: You shall kindle no fire throughout your dwellings on the Sabbath day.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr Sa'bat rim hnam dơnŏ iĕm mă tơ yơ yơ 'nĕ pơm ŭnh ôh

English: And Moses spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, “This is the thing which the LORD commanded, saying
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, 'nâu dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă khan boih.

English: ‘Take from among you an offering to the LORD. Whoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it as an offering to the LORD: gold, silver, and bronze
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ tơmam đơ̆ng lăm hnam lu iĕm na pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, bu đei jơhngơ̆m hơmrah, sư athei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang maih, hu, kong

English: blue, purple, and scarlet thread, fine linen, and goats’ hair
Bahnar: brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, che 'bui brai se, sŏk bơbe

English: ram skins dyed red, badger skins, and acacia wood
Bahnar: akar triu tơno tong đak 'brê, akar ka tih, 'long keo.

English: oil for the light, and spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense
Bahnar: Đak rơmă plei ôliwơ tơ̆k ŭnh, tơmam 'bâu phu pơm đak rơmă wă pik 'bâu phu păng wă pơm pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod and in the breastplate.
Bahnar: Tơmo rang (Ônik) hăm tơmo gĭt kăl nai wă yua pơklep 'bơ̆t ao êphot hăm bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh.

English: ‘All who are gifted artisans among you shall come and make all that the LORD has commanded
Bahnar: Lăm lu iĕm dôm lu bơngai gơh hơgei noh, iĕm athei năm jang dôm tơdrong mă Kră Yang đei bơtho khan

English: the tabernacle, its tent, its covering, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets
Bahnar: Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm che hăm tơmam klơ̆p bơbŭng sư, gơwŏk, tơ̆r, 'long hơbăt, jrăng, hăm bơlôh rơnuh

English: the ark and its poles, with the mercy seat, and the veil of the covering
Bahnar: Hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm 'long tơnung răk kơ tung sư, tơnglơ̆p tơdrong mơnat păng che pĕng.

English: the table and its poles, all its utensils, and the showbread
Bahnar: Gơ'bang hăm 'long tơnung sư păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm noh păng 'bĕng rơgoh.

English: also the lampstand for the light, its utensils, its lamps, and the oil for the light
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng hăm tơmam yua lăm sư, lu ŭnh kơđeng hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ tuh tơ̆k sư.

English: the incense altar, its poles, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, and the screen for the door at the entrance of the tabernacle
Bahnar: Chơnang soi hăm 'long tơnung tung, đak rơmă păng 'bâu phu; che pĕng 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: the altar of burnt offering with its bronze grating, its poles, all its utensils, and the laver and its base
Bahnar: Chơnang soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh grang hơdrao hăm 'long tung păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm sư, kơthŭng đak păng jơ̆ng kơthŭng

English: the hangings of the court, its pillars, their sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court
Bahnar: Che pĕng cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, jrăng hăm bơlôh rơnuh păng che pĕng 'bơ̆t 'măng cham.

English: the pegs of the tabernacle, the pegs of the court, and their cords
Bahnar: 'Long hơdrơ̆ng pơdơ̆ng bơsŭn, 'long hơdrơ̆ng war klaih kơ noh tơlei kŭi chô̆ lu hơdrơ̆ng.

English: the garments of ministry, for ministering in the holy place—the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, to minister as priests.’ ”
Bahnar: Hơbĕn ao giĕng yua hrŭk jang lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, hơbĕn ao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Arôn 'bok soi tơm păng hơbĕn ao giĕng kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư wă jang tơdrong jang 'bok soi.

English: And all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơpôl kon pơlei pơla Isơrael đang kơ akŭm lĕch wih.

English: Then everyone came whose heart was stirred, and everyone whose spirit was willing, and they brought the LORD’s offering for the work of the tabernacle of meeting, for all its service, and for the holy garments.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m pơdrŭt, hăm lu bơngai mă đei jơhngơ̆m 'maih wă, chĕp ba tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang, wă yua lăm tơdrong jang pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm kơkuh păng đĭ-đăng tơdrong jang kăl lăm noh, hăm pơm hơbĕn ao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: They came, both men and women, as many as had a willing heart, and brought earrings and nose rings, rings and necklaces, all jewelry of gold, that is, every man who made an offering of gold to the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh mă lu drŏ-nglo mă lu drŏ-kăn năm mơ̆n, đĭ-đăng bơngai bu bu đei jơhngơ̆m 'maih wă chĕp ba le đon, tơkhiĕn, kong 'bot, hăm dôm lu tơmam pơhrôp păng maih, đĭ-đăng lu sư pơyơ̆r maih kơ Kră Yang.

English: And every man, with whom was found blue, purple, and scarlet thread, fine linen, and goats’ hair, red skins of rams, and badger skins, brought them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai bu đei che brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, che 'bui brai se, sŏk bơbe, akar triu tơno tong đak 'brê păng akar ka tih kư̆m chĕp ba.

English: Everyone who offered an offering of silver or bronze brought the LORD’s offering. And everyone with whom was found acacia wood for any work of the service, brought it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei tơmam pơm păng hu dah păng kong kư̆m chĕp ba pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang mơ̆n păng dah bơngai bu đei 'long keo (sitim) pơyơ̆r wă yua lăm tơdrong jang kư̆m pơyơ̆r mơ̆n.

English: All the women who were gifted artisans spun yarn with their hands, and brought what they had spun, of blue, purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drŏ-kăn gơh dui tơroi, na chĕp ba pơyơ̆r brai đêl lu sư dui noh brai jơk 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, hăm che 'bui brai se.

English: And all the women whose hearts stirred with wisdom spun yarn of goats’ hair.
Bahnar: Na lu drŏ-kăn mơ'nah lăm jơhngơ̆m đei pơdrŭt păng hơgei lu sư dui tơroi hăm sŏk bơbe kư̆m pơyơ̆r mơ̆n.

English: The rulers brought onyx stones, and the stones to be set in the ephod and in the breastplate
Bahnar: Lu kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei chĕp ba pơyơ̆r tơmo rang (onik) hăm tơmo gĭt nai 'măn wă tah pơklep 'bơ̆t ao êphot păng pơklep 'bơ̆t bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh.

English: and spices and oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m chĕp ba đak rơmă plei ôliwơ răk tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng, tơmam 'bâu phu răk pơm đak rơmă 'bâu phu wă pik păng wă pơm đak pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: The children of Israel brought a freewill offering to the LORD, all the men and women whose hearts were willing to bring material for all kinds of work which the LORD, by the hand of Moses, had commanded to be done.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn lăm kon pơlei pơla Isơrael. Đei jơhngơ̆m pơdrŭt wă tơgŭm tơdrong jang Kră Yang pơkă kơ Môis noh, lu sư chĕp ba tơmam pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi lu sư wă kơdih.

English: And Moses said to the children of Israel, “See, the LORD has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ kon pơlei pơla Isơrael: Ăn kơ lu iĕm băt Kră Yang krao boih anăn Bêsalel kon drŏ-nglo Uri, Sâu Hur, đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Juđa

English: and He has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom and understanding, in knowledge and all manner of workmanship
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ sư 'bĕnh blai boih yang bơhngol 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, hăm tơdrong gơh hơgei, tơdrong hơdah, tơdrong hlôh wao, wă kơ gơh bơ̆jang pơm tôm tơdrong jang.

English: to design artistic works, to work in gold and silver and bronze
Bahnar: Wă kơ gơh tuh hling pơm tơmam, hăm maih, hu, klaih kơ noh hăm kong

English: in cutting jewels for setting, in carving wood, and to work in all manner of artistic workmanship.
Bahnar: Gơh chhơ̆ chrek tơmo gĭt păng, traih 'long klaih kơ noh pơm tôm tĕch tơdrong jang.

English: “And He has put in his heart the ability to teach, in him and Aholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ sư đei đon hơgei gơh bơtho pơhrăm păng kư̆m ăn kơ Ôhôliap kon drŏ-nglo Ahisamak đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Đan hai.

English: He has filled them with skill to do all manner of work of the engraver and the designer and the tapestry maker, in blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine linen, and of the weaver—those who do every work and those who design artistic works.
Bahnar: Kră Yang sư ăn kơ 'bar 'nu bre noh 'bĕnh blai tơdrong gơh hơgei, jang tôm tơdrong gơh sĭt, gơh reng gơh tanh brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, che 'bui brai se; păng pơm lơ tơdrong chă đon hơgei dôm tơdrong jang.

English: “And Bezalel and Aholiab, and every gifted artisan in whom the LORD has put wisdom and understanding, to know how to do all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, shall do according to all that the LORD has commanded.”
Bahnar: Bêsalel, Ôhôliap hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai mă Kră Yang ăn boih tơdrong tơchĕng đei đon hlôh wao gơh hơgei kơ pơm tôm tơdrong jang lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, lu sư bơ̆jang dôm tơdrong kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă khan boih

English: Then Moses called Bezalel and Aholiab, and every gifted artisan in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, everyone whose heart was stirred, to come and do the work.
Bahnar: Môis krao Bêsalel, Ôhôliap păng lu bơngai gơh hơgei jang đei tơdrong tơchĕng mă Kră Yang ăn boih kơ lu sư mă đei jơhngơ̆m mơn pơdrŭt lu sư pơtơm năm bơ̆jang.

English: And they received from Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of making the sanctuary. So they continued bringing to him freewill offerings every morning.
Bahnar: Lu sư iŏk đơ̆ng Môis dôm tơmam pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla Isơrael ba ăn wă yua pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm rơgoh 'lơ̆ng. Rim pơgê đei bơngai năm ba tơ Môis tơmam pơyơ̆r kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong kăl yua.

English: Then all the craftsmen who were doing all the work of the sanctuary came, each from the work he was doing
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai hơgei gơh pơm tôm tơdrong jang lăm anih noh, lu sư pơdơh 'bơ̆t anih lu sư oei jang.

English: and they spoke to Moses, saying, “The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which the LORD commanded us to do.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư năm khan kơ Môis, lu kon pơlei pơla ăn tơmam lơ dêh rơkah rơkai lơ hloh kơ tơdrong jang wă yua, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang pơkă athei pơm.

English: So Moses gave a commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, “Let neither man nor woman do any more work for the offering of the sanctuary.” And the people were restrained from bringing
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis pơkă athei, lu sư tơroi băl jơ̆p lăm anih lu sư oei lê̆ pă ăn pơyơ̆r dơ̆ng tơmam kơ pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, thoi noh đe khă pă ăn kon pơlei pơla năm ba tơmam pơyơ̆r dơ̆ng.

English: for the material they had was sufficient for all the work to be done—indeed too much.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơmam đei noh tôm mah boih păng kư̆m rơkah mơ̆n kơ dôm tơdrong jang.

English: Then all the gifted artisans among them who worked on the tabernacle made ten curtains woven of fine linen, and of blue, purple, and scarlet thread; with artistic designs of cherubim they made them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai hơgei gơh jang pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm iŏk mơjĭt blah che 'bui tanh păng brai se, brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, đei rup chêrubim, 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; the curtains were all the same size.
Bahnar: Rim blah che 'bui kơjung sư 'bar-jĭt tơhngam hơgăt, wơ̆l sư să puăn hơgăt, rim blah să iĕ lei-lăi.

English: And he coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled to one another.
Bahnar: Sư sĭt pơtrơp pơđăm blah pơm minh, kư̆m sĭt pơtrơp mơ̆n pơđăm blah nai pơm minh.

English: He made loops of blue yarn on the edge of the curtain on the selvedge of one set; likewise he did on the outer edge of the other curtain of the second set.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk brai jơk sĭt pơm gơwŏk 'bơ̆t tơdrơi che pơtrơp mă minh, sư kư̆m sĭt pơm lei-lăi mơ̆n 'bơ̆t tơdrơi che pơtrơp mă 'bar.

English: Fifty loops he made on one curtain, and fifty loops he made on the edge of the curtain on the end of the second set; the loops held one curtain to another.
Bahnar: Lu sư sĭt pơđăm-jĭt kiơ̆ kơ trong jih tơdrơi che mă minh păng sư sĭt pơđăm-jĭt tơ tơdrơi jih kơ che mă 'bar, tơnăp sư tơ'bưh băl.

English: And he made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains to one another with the clasps, that it might be one tabernacle.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk păng maih, wă kơ gơwŏk pơtrơp che 'nâu hăm che noh tơ'bưh jing minh.

English: He made curtains of goats’ hair for the tent over the tabernacle; he made eleven curtains.
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh lu sư iŏk che sŏk bơbe sĭt pơtrơp mơjĭt-mônh blah wă klơ̆p tơ kơpal pơm bơbŭng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; the eleven curtains were the same size.
Bahnar: Che kơjung lăm rim minh blah che noh pêng-jĭt hơgăt, să puăn hơgăt, mơjĭt-mônh blah che noh să iĕ lei-lăi băl.a

English: He coupled five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves.
Bahnar: Sư pơtrơp lăm pơđăm blah noh pơm minh, hăm tơdrâu blah che nai kư̆m pơm minh

English: And he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in one set, and fifty loops he made on the edge of the curtain of the second set.
Bahnar: Sĭt pơđăm-jĭt gơwŏk ter jih che tuch-luch kơ che mă minh, hăm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk 'bơ̆t jih che să mă 'bar.

English: He also made fifty bronze clasps to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
Bahnar: Sư pơm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gơwŏk păng kong, gơwŏk tơ'bưh đĭ-đăng che bơbŭng noh jing minh.

English: Then he made a covering for the tent of ram skins dyed red, and a covering of badger skins above that.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơm 'bar blah che hăm akar triu tơno tong đak 'brê păng hăm akar ka tih.

English: For the tabernacle he made boards of acacia wood, standing upright.
Bahnar: Sư yua tơ̆r 'long keo (sitim) pơm 'long dơ̆ng tơnăr Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm noh.

English: The length of each board was ten cubits, and the width of each board a cubit and a half.
Bahnar: Lăm rim hlak tơ̆r mơjĭt hơgăt kơjung, minh hơgăt minh puăt wơ̆l sư.b

English: Each board had two tenons for binding one to another. Thus he made for all the boards of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Rim hlak tơ̆r athei kao tŏk-bŏk đei 'bar pah wă kơ pơkăp hơdai tơ rơnuh sư pơm thoi noh kơ đĭ-đăng tơ̆r lăm Bơsŭn anih akŭm.

English: And he made boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side.
Bahnar: Thoi âu lu sư yua tơ̆r lăm Bơsŭn: 'Bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r tơ gah gơal.

English: Forty sockets of silver he made to go under the twenty boards: two sockets under each of the boards for its two tenons.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm puăn-jĭt tŏ bơlôh rơnuh păng hu, kơ 'bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r, 'bar tŏ bơlôh rơnuh kơ minh hlak tơ̆r 'măn 'bar pah wă pơkăp sư păng 'bar tŏ bơlôh rơnuh kơ tơ̆r nai 'măn 'bar pah wă kơ pơkăp sư.

English: And for the other side of the tabernacle, the north side, he made twenty boards
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'bar-jĭt hlak tơ̆r tơ gah yă-nơ̆m kơ hnam

English: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under each of the boards.
Bahnar: păng puăn-jĭt bơlôh rơnuh pơm păng hu 'bar tŏ bơlôh rơnuh pơm pơkăp kơ minh hlak tơ̆r păng 'bar tŏ bơlôh rơnuh tơ minh hlak nai.

English: For the west side of the tabernacle he made six boards.
Bahnar: Gah rŏng kơ Bơsŭn til bơmơ̆t sư pơm tơdrâu hlak tơ̆r.

English: He also made two boards for the two back corners of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Păng 'bar pah mum gah rŏng sư pơm hăm 'bar hlak tơ̆r.

English: And they were coupled at the bottom and coupled together at the top by one ring. Thus he made both of them for the two corners.
Bahnar: 'Bar pah mum 'bar hlak tơ̆r pơkăp dih băl khĕp đơ̆ng ala truh tơ kơpal đei khuen gơwŏk băl, 'bar pah mum pơm lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: So there were eight boards and their sockets—sixteen sockets of silver—two sockets under each of the boards.
Bahnar: Đei tơhngam hlak tơ̆r hăm mơjĭt-tơdrâu tŏ bơlôh rơnuh pơm păng hu, ala kơ rim hlak tơ̆r noh đei 'bar tŏ bơlôh rơnuh.

English: And he made bars of acacia wood: five for the boards on one side of the tabernacle
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơm pơđăm tŏ 'long hơbăt, hăm 'long keo wă pơ̆ng pơkăp tơ tơ̆r tơ gah âu kơ Bơsŭn.

English: five bars for the boards on the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle on the far side westward.
Bahnar: Pơđăm tŏ 'long hơbăt nai tơ gah to păng pơđăm tŏ 'long hơbăt nai dơ̆ng tơ gah rŏng, wă khan tơ gah bơmơ̆t.

English: And he made the middle bar to pass through the boards from one end to the other.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơm 'long hơbăt tŏk-bŏk găn đĭ tơ̆r đơ̆ng kơ̆l pah âu truh tơ kơ̆l pah to

English: He overlaid the boards with gold, made their rings of gold to be holders for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
Bahnar: păng lom păng maih rim lu tơ̆r noh, sư pơm khuen hăm maih, wă sôr 'long hơbăt, rim lu 'long hơbăt lom păng maih ngăl.

English: And he made a veil of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen; it was worked with an artistic design of cherubim.
Bahnar: Sư pơm minh blah che hăm brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm păng che 'bui tanh brai se, tanh rup chêrubim 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: He made for it four pillars of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold, with their hooks of gold; and he cast four sockets of silver for them.
Bahnar: Sư pơm puăn tŏ jrăng 'long keo lom hăm maih păng pơm gơwŏk hăm maih bŏk hling puăn tŏ bơlôh rơnuh păng wă pơkăp jrăng.

English: He also made a screen for the tabernacle door, of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, made by a weaver
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'bơ̆t 'măng wă mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm minh blah che brai jơk, 'brê gôh păng 'brê hơhĭm, che tanh rup 'brông hơdah.

English: and its five pillars with their hooks. And he overlaid their capitals and their rings with gold, but their five sockets were bronze.
Bahnar: Păng sư pơm pơđăm tŏ jrăng lom kơ̆l păng maih păng pơđăm tŏ bơlôh rơnuh pơm păng kong lu gơwŏk sư păng maih.

English: Then Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood; two and a half cubits was its length, a cubit and a half its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
Bahnar: Bêsalel pơm hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm 'long keo; tor sư 'bar hơgăt minh puăt, wơ̆l sư minh hơgăt minh puăt kơjung sư minh hơgăt minh puăt.a

English: He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold all around it.
Bahnar: Sư lom hăm maih rơgoh tơ lăm păng tơ đaih păng pơm gơnăp sư tăp dăr hăm maih.

English: And he cast for it four rings of gold to be set in its four corners: two rings on one side, and two rings on the other side of it.
Bahnar: Sư hling pơm puăn tŏ khuen păng maih wă tah tơ lăm puăn pah mum. Minh pah 'bar tŏ păng minh pah nai 'bar tŏ mơ̆n.

English: He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Bahnar: Sư pơm lu 'long ting tung păng 'long keo klaih kơ noh lom lu sư hăm maih.

English: And he put the poles into the rings at the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
Bahnar: Sư sôr 'long tơnung ting tung lăm bơlôh khuen gah ala hom noh 'măn wă ting tung sư.

English: He also made the mercy seat of pure gold; two and a half cubits was its length and a cubit and a half its width.
Bahnar: Sư pơm minh pôm Tơnglơ̆p Pơklaih Yoch lom ăn hăm maih rơgoh, tor sư 'bar hơgăt minh puăt, wơ̆l sư minh hơgăt minh puăt.b

English: He made two cherubim of beaten gold; he made them of one piece at the two ends of the mercy seat
Bahnar: Pơm kơtă hloi 'bar tŏ rup chêrubim hăm maih 'bơ̆t 'bar pah jih Tơnglơ̆p Pơklaih Yoch.

English: one cherub at one end on this side, and the other cherub at the other end on that side. He made the cherubim at the two ends of one piece with the mercy seat.
Bahnar: Minh pôm rup chêrubim noh 'bơ̆t jih pah âu minh pôm rup chêrubim to dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t jih pah to.

English: The cherubim spread out their wings above, and covered the mercy seat with their wings. They faced one another; the faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy seat.
Bahnar: Rup chêrubim bơyar pơnăr sư kơpal tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat, muh măt tơwih tơklă băl, muh măt chêrubim lăng Tơ Anih Tơdrong 'Mêm Mơnat.

English: He made the table of acacia wood; two cubits was its length, a cubit its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
Bahnar: Sư pơm gơ'bang hăm 'long keo: Tor sư 'bar hơgăt, wơ̆l sư minh hơgăt kơjung sư minh hơgăt minh puăt.c

English: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made a molding of gold all around it.
Bahnar: Sư lom hăm maih rơgoh păng lem trong jih hăm maih tăp dăr.

English: Also he made a frame of a handbreadth all around it, and made a molding of gold for the frame all around it.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tăp dăr gơ'bang puăn pah tŏ tơpuănd păng lem rok gor noh hăm maih păng pơ̆n minh trong gơnăp tăp dăr hăm maih.

English: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings on the four corners that were at its four legs.
Bahnar: Sư hling pơm puăn tŏ khuen hăm maih tah khuen noh 'bơ̆t mum 'long găn jơ̆ng gơ'bang.

English: The rings were close to the frame, as holders for the poles to bear the table.
Bahnar: Khuen noh tah 'bơ̆t jê̆ 'long găn gơ'bang noh, răk sôr 'long wă tung gơ'bang.

English: And he made the poles of acacia wood to bear the table, and overlaid them with gold.
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'long ting tung păng 'long keo hăm lom sư păng maih, wă kơ ting-tung gơ'bang noh.

English: He made of pure gold the utensils which were on the table: its dishes, its cups, its bowls, and its pitchers for pouring.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơmam yua tơ kơpal gơ'bang; pơnhan chhĕr, kơthao mong pơgang, 'bâu phu, klĭnh bô̆i, kơchŏk 'măn yua tuh tơmam pơyơ̆r huch sa, pơm lu sư păng maih rơgoh.

English: He also made the lampstand of pure gold; of hammered work he made the lampstand. Its shaft, its branches, its bowls, its ornamental knobs, and its flowers were of the same piece.
Bahnar: Sư pơm jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng hăm maih rơgoh; jơ̆ng sư, akâu sư, gĕl sư, rơnôp, pơkao sư pơm hăm maih rơgoh păng klep băl hơbôl.

English: And six branches came out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side.
Bahnar: Akâu ŭnh kơđeng đei pơm tơdrâu tŏ tơ'bla, pêng tŏ pah âu, pêng tŏ pah to.

English: There were three bowls made like almond blossoms on one branch, with an ornamental knob and a flower, and three bowls made like almond blossoms on the other branch, with an ornamental knob and a flower—and so for the six branches coming out of the lampstand.
Bahnar: Lăm minh pôm tơ'bla đei pêng tŏ kơchŏk pơm nhen thoi pơkao Almon e đei rơnôp păng pơkao sư 'bơ̆t tơ'bla nai kư̆m pêng tŏ kơchŏk kư̆m pơm thoi pơkao (plei) (Almon) lei-lăi.

English: And on the lampstand itself were four bowls made like almond blossoms, each with its ornamental knob and flower.
Bahnar: Akâu ŭnh kơđeng đei puăn tŏ thoi pơkao, hăm tơmơ̆ng bluh rơnôp nhen pơkao hanh nhânf.

English: There was a knob under the first two branches of the same, a knob under the second two branches of the same, and a knob under the third two branches of the same, according to the six branches extending from it.
Bahnar: Đei tơdrâu tŏ dơng tơ tơ'bla chăt đơ̆ng jơ̆ng ŭnh, rim 'bar tŏ dơng tơ'bla chăt tơ ala sư đei minh pôm rơnôp (plei).

English: Their knobs and their branches were of one piece; all of it was one hammered piece of pure gold.
Bahnar: Plei păng dơng tơ'bla ŭnh kơđeng, đe hơjơ̆m păng minh hlak maih rơgoh.

English: And he made its seven lamps, its wick-trimmers, and its trays of pure gold.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơpơh tŏ ŭnh kơđeng kơ sư, chơkep tơmam pĭt ŭnh păng pơnhan chhĕr mong rơnok, sư pơm hăm maih rơgoh.

English: Of a talent of pure gold he made it, with all its utensils.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk minh talâng g maih rơgoh pơm jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng păng tơmam yua lăm ŭnh kơđeng noh.

English: He made the incense altar of acacia wood. Its length was a cubit and its width a cubit—it was square—and two cubits was its height. Its horns were of one piece with it.
Bahnar: Sư pơm chơnang soh pơgang 'bâu phu hăm 'long keo să iĕ tŏ ăi tor sư minh hơgăt wơ̆l sư minh hơgăt, kơjung sư 'bar hơgăt chơnang ei đei puăn tŏ ake kơtă.h

English: And he overlaid it with pure gold: its top, its sides all around, and its horns. He also made for it a molding of gold all around it.
Bahnar: Sư lom hăm maih rơgoh, lom tăp dăr puăn pang păng tơ kơpal hăm ake sư, pơm minh trong gơnăp păng maih.

English: He made two rings of gold for it under its molding, by its two corners on both sides, as holders for the poles with which to bear it.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơ ala kơ trong gơnăp 'bar tŏ khuen maih tơ 'bar pah, sư pơm 'bar tŏ khuen maih răk sôr 'long tơnung wă tung sư.

English: And he made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'long ting tung noh hăm 'long keo păng lom sư hăm maih.

English: He also made the holy anointing oil and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the perfumer.
Bahnar: Sư pơm đak rơmă rơgoh păng 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng, pơm gơh hơgei.

English: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood; five cubits was its length and five cubits its width—it was square—and its height was three cubits.
Bahnar: Sư pơm chơnang soi 'buh păng 'long keo (sitim), puăn pah tŏ ăi tor sư pơđăm hơgăt, wơ̆l sư pơđăm hơgăt, kơjung pêng hơgăt.a

English: He made its horns on its four corners; the horns were of one piece with it. And he overlaid it with bronze.
Bahnar: Sư pơm puăn pah mum chơnang soi đei pơm ake kơtă hloi, ake noh lom hăm kong. Đơ̆ng noh sư pơm dôm lu tơmam yua lăm chơnang soi noh păng kong

English: He made all the utensils for the altar: the pans, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the firepans; all its utensils he made of bronze.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơmam yua lăm noh, đei gŏ bô̆i iĕ mong tơnuh, gơ'bênh, kơthao, bô̆i mong đak wă ruh, chơkrơ păng bô̆i wă mong ngar.

English: And he made a grate of bronze network for the altar, under its rim, midway from the bottom.
Bahnar: Sư pơm minh blah grang hơdrao păng kong 'măn tơ ala chơnang đơ̆ng jơ̆ng truh tơ tŏk-bŏk.

English: He cast four rings for the four corners of the bronze grating, as holders for the poles.
Bahnar: Păng sư hling pơm puăn tŏ khuen tơ puăn pah mum grang tanh păng kong, wă sôr 'long tơnung ting tung.

English: And he made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with bronze.
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'long ting tung hăm 'long keo, đơ̆ng noh lom sư hăm kong.

English: Then he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to bear it. He made the altar hollow with boards.
Bahnar: Sư sôr 'long ting tung lăm khuen 'bơ̆t 'bar pah chơnang wă ting tung sư. Sư pơm chơnang soi lăm to sư kơkhơng.

English: He made the laver of bronze and its base of bronze, from the bronze mirrors of the serving women who assembled at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk kơmĭl hăm kong đơ̆ng lu drŏ-kăn bơ̆jang 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm pơyơ̆r, pơm hĭ minh pôm kơthŭng hăm jơ̆ng sư.

English: Then he made the court on the south side; the hangings of the court were of fine woven linen, one hundred cubits long.
Bahnar: Sư pơm cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm gah gơal tor să minh-hrĕng hơgăt, gah gơal che 'bui pĕng tanh hăm brai se.

English: There were twenty pillars for them, with twenty bronze sockets. The hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver.
Bahnar: 'Bar-jĭt tŏ rơnuh păng 'bar-jĭt bơlôh păng kong păng gơwŏk hăm tơlei pơm păng hu.
