English: On the north side the hangings were one hundred cubits long, with twenty pillars and their twenty bronze sockets. The hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver.
Bahnar: Tơ gah yă-nơ̆m đei minh-hrĕng hơgăt,b 'bar-jĭt tŏ jrăng păng 'bar-jĭt tŏ bơlôh rơnuh jrăng pơm păng kong păng gơwŏk păng tơlei pơm păng hu.

English: And on the west side there were hangings of fifty cubits, with ten pillars and their ten sockets. The hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver.
Bahnar: Gah bơmơ̆t, pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt,c mơjĭt tŏ jrăng păng mơjĭt tŏ bơlôh rơnuh pơm păng hu păng gơwŏk hăm tơlei pơm păng hu.

English: For the east side the hangings were fifty cubits.
Bahnar: Gah hơlĕch pơđăm-jĭt hơgăt mơ̆n.

English: The hangings of one side of the gate were fifteen cubits long, with their three pillars and their three sockets
Bahnar: Minh pah gah 'ma kơ 'măng cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm mơjĭt-pơđăm hơgăt pêng tŏ jrăng hăm pêng tŏ bơlôh rơnuh.

English: and the same for the other side of the court gate; on this side and that were hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
Bahnar: Gah 'ngiĕo kơ 'măng cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm kư̆m dai mơjĭt-pơđăm hơgăt, pêng tŏ jrăng păng pêng tŏ bơlôh rơnuh mơ̆n.

English: All the hangings of the court all around were of fine woven linen.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng che pĕng tăp dăr kơ cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm đe tanh hăm brai se.

English: The sockets for the pillars were bronze, the hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver, and the overlay of their capitals was silver; and all the pillars of the court had bands of silver.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng jrăng păng bơlôh rơnuh đe pơm păng kong, gơwŏk hăm tơlei pơm păng hu, kơ̆l jrăng lom hăm hu, đĭ-đăng jrăng lăm cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm ei đei pơ̆n păng gơwŏk tơlei hu.

English: The screen for the gate of the court was woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and of fine woven linen. The length was twenty cubits, and the height along its width was five cubits, corresponding to the hangings of the court.
Bahnar: Che 'bơ̆t 'măng cham đe tanh păng brai jơk, 'brê hơhĭm, 'brê gôh, đe tanh păng brai se.d Tor sư 'bar-jĭt hơgăt păng kơjung sư pơđăm hơgăte thoi lu kơ che pĕng tăp dăr kơ cham.

English: And there were four pillars with their four sockets of bronze; their hooks were silver, and the overlay of their capitals and their bands was silver.
Bahnar: Jrăng puăn tŏ hăm puăn tŏ bơlôh rơnuh pơm păng kong lu jrăng păng dôm lu gơwŏk tơlei pơm păng hu

English: All the pegs of the tabernacle, and of the court all around, were bronze.
Bahnar: Hơdrơ̆ng tăp dăr yua pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng tăp dăr kơ cham đe pơm păng kong.

English: This is the inventory of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the Testimony, which was counted according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son of Aaron the priest.
Bahnar: 'Nâu đe jô̆ tơmam yua lăm pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, anih mă tah 'bar hlak tơmo chih mơjĭt khôi juăt kiơ̆ thoi Môis pơkă kơ bơngai Lêwi bơwei, chih răk đĭ-đăng 'nâu đơ̆ng Ithamar kon drŏ-nglo 'bok soi tơm Arôn pơgơ̆r.

English: Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Bêsalel kon drŏ-nglo Uri sâu Hur đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Juđa, pơm pơkeh đĭ tôm dôm tơdrong kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă boih.

English: And with him was Aholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver and designer, a weaver of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and of fine linen.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơgŭm sư Ôhôliap kon drŏ-nglo Ahisamak, đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Đan. Bơngai jang chrek, gơh chhơ̆ tơchĕng pơm dôm tơmam păng gơh tanh brai jơk 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm păng brai se.

English: All the gold that was used in all the work of the holy place, that is, the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred and thirty shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng maih mă yua boih lăm tơdrong jang pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo 'lơ̆ng,f pơtih thoi maih đơ̆ng đe pơyơ̆r, đei 'bar-jĭt tơsĭn talâng noh đei minh-rơbâu kĭ lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: And the silver from those who were numbered of the congregation was one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary
Bahnar: Hu đơ̆ng lu đe jô̆ boih đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơyơ̆r đei pêng-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng kĭ, g kiơ̆ kơ kĭ lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: a bekah for each man (that is, half a shekel, according to the shekel of the sanctuary), for everyone included in the numbering from twenty years old and above, for six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty men.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lăm minh puăt seikơl đơ̆ng rim 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng. Đĭ-đăng bơngai drŏ-nglo đe jô̆ boih iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal. Đei tơdrâu-hrĕng pêng-rơbâu, pơđăm-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo.h

English: And from the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary and the bases of the veil: one hundred sockets from the hundred talents, one talent for each socket.
Bahnar: Đei pêng-hrĕng puăn-jĭt kĭ hu, yua hling pơm minh-hrĕng tŏ bơlôh rơnuh kơ jrăng tơ'băk che anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng: Minh-hrĕng talâng pơm kơ minh-hrĕng bơlôh rơnuh, minh talâng hling kơ minh bơlôh rơnuh.

English: Then from the one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made bands for them.
Bahnar: Hăm pêng-jĭt kĭ hu na yua pơm gơwŏk, lom kơ̆l jrăng hăm gơwŏk tơlei wă pơtrơp băl lu jrăng noh.

English: The offering of bronze was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels.
Bahnar: Kong đe chĕp ba pơyơ̆r, akŭm đĭ-đăng đei 'bar-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng kĭ.i

English: And with it he made the sockets for the door of the tabernacle of meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, and all the utensils for the altar
Bahnar: Lu sư yua kong noh pơm bơlôh jrăng 'bơ̆t 'măng mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm chơnang soi pơm păng kong, hơdrao sư pơm păng kong lu tơmam yua tơ gơ'bang yua lăm chơnang soi.

English: the sockets for the court all around, the bases for the court gate, all the pegs for the tabernacle, and all the pegs for the court all around.
Bahnar: Lu bơlôh jrăng tăp dăr kơ kơdeng hăm bơlôh jrăng 'bơ̆t 'măng kơdeng păng lu hơdrơ̆ng war bơsŭn păng đĭ-đăng 'long hơdrơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ kơdeng.

English: Of the blue, purple, and scarlet thread they made garments of ministry, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Bêsalêel iŏk brai jơk 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm. Lu sư tanh che hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng 'măn kơ yua lăm tơdrong jang lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, lu sư pơm hơbĕn ao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Arôn kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang pơkă boih kơ Môis.

English: He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and of fine woven linen.
Bahnar: Bêsalêel sư pơm ao êphot hăm maih, che brai jơk, 'brê gôh 'brê hơhĭm, tanh hăm brai se.

English: And they beat the gold into thin sheets and cut it into threads, to work it in with the blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and the fine linen, into artistic designs.
Bahnar: Đe tơtang lơ hlak maih dĭng hơtăng, đơ̆ng noh chrek jing brai, wă tanh hơdai hăm brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm păng tanh hăm brai se, tanh hơlen bơse.

English: They made shoulder straps for it to couple it together; it was coupled together at its two edges.
Bahnar: Sư tanh 'bar hlak che pơm hơtăr 'băk tơ hơngiĕng, sĭt tơ êphot tơ tơnăp âu tơ'bưh tơnăp to.

English: And the intricately woven band of his ephod that was on it was of the same workmanship, woven of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and of fine woven linen, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Tơlei tơ̆n đe tanh hăm brai se sĭt tơklep 'bơ̆t ao êphot, lu sư tanh lei-lăi thoi ao păng tơklep sư tơ ao, pơm sôr sư hăm maih, brai jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, tanh hăm brai se. Kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang pơkă boih kơ Môis.

English: And they set onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold; they were engraved, as signets are engraved, with the names of the sons of Israel.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk tơmo gĭt hling maih, chrek chhơ̆ thoi tơmam kơtĭt tơdra, chrek anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael.

English: He put them on the shoulders of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Na sư tah tơmo gĭt noh lăm che hơtăr 'băk tơ hơngiĕng ao êphot, wă pơm tơmo gĭt 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael, kiơ̆ trŏ thoi Kră Yang pơkă boih kơ Môis.

English: And he made the breastplate, artistically woven like the workmanship of the ephod, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and of fine woven linen.
Bahnar: Bêsalêel sư pơm bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh tanh hơgei hlĭch dêh, thoi ao êphot, maih rang mơnhal brai jơk, 'brê gôh 'brê hơhĭm păng brai se.

English: They made the breastplate square by doubling it; a span was its length and a span its width when doubled.
Bahnar: Bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh, să iĕ tŏ ăi wơ̆l tor sư, lu sư pơm bơnal tor minh hơđa wơ̆l sư sap 'bar tăl.

English: And they set in it four rows of stones: a row with a sardius, a topaz, and an emerald was the first row
Bahnar: Lu sư pơklep đei puăn trong tơmo gĭt, trong mă mônh minh găr tơmo gôh rang Sardis, minh găr tơmo hlăng Topas, minh găr tơmo rang Carbucle.

English: the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond
Bahnar: Trong mă 'bar, minh găr tơmo jơk dreng Emoral, minh găr tơmo hlĕng hlŏng saphir, minh găr tơmo jơmŏng.a

English: the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst
Bahnar: Trong mă pêng, minh găr tơmo trong wăn Jakin, minh găr tơmo trong Agate, minh găr tơmo hlăng Amathus.

English: the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in settings of gold in their mountings.
Bahnar: Trong mă puăn minh găr tơmo gĭt bêril, minh gar tơmo rang Ônik (onik), minh găr tơmo đei trong wăn jasper. Tơmo gĭt noh đei pơklep hrâu păng maih.

English: There were twelve stones according to the names of the sons of Israel: according to their names, engraved like a signet, each one with its own name according to the twelve tribes.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơmo gĭt đei mơjĭt-'bar găr đĭ-đăng, kiơ̆ thoi dôm anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael, đe chhơ̆ chrek sư nhen thoi tơmam kơtĭt rim găr tơmo đei chrek anăn kiơ̆ mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch Isơrael.

English: And they made chains for the breastplate at the ends, like braided cords of pure gold.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm rơbưn glang păng maih rơgoh, sĭt tơ bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh.

English: They also made two settings of gold and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơm 'bar tŏ gơwŏk păng maih, gơwŏk tơ 'bar pah jih bơnal 'băk tơ kơtơh.

English: And they put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơguăt 'bar dăng rơbưn maih 'bơ̆t gơwang noh, tơ 'bar pah tơnăp bơnal kơtơh.

English: The two ends of the two braided chains they fastened in the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod in the front.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm 'bar dăng rơbưn păng maih rơgoh wă tơguăt tơ'bưh bơnal kơtơh hăm ao êphot.

English: And they made two rings of gold and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on the edge of it, which was on the inward side of the ephod.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm dơ̆ng 'bar tŏ gơwang maih sĭt tơ lăm kơ 'bar pah bơnal kơtơh tơ'bưh hăm ao êphot.

English: They made two other gold rings and put them on the two shoulder straps, underneath the ephod toward its front, right at the seam above the intricately woven band of the ephod.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm dơ̆ng 'bar tŏ gơwang maih dan 'bơ̆t ala 'bar tŏ tơlei hơtăr anăp êphot, tơ tơnăp tơ'bưh tơlei tơ̆n ao êphot.

English: And they bound the breastplate by means of its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so that it would be above the intricately woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate would not come loose from the ephod, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Sư yua tơlei brai jơk chô̆ lu khuen bơnal kơtơh hăm khuen êphot, wă kơ bơnal kơtơh kơjăp kơpal tơlei tơ̆n ao êphot đe tanh hăm brai se, wă kơ bơnal kơtơh huay kơ tơrĭ đơ̆ng ao êphot, kiơ̆ trŏ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă ăn kơ Môis boih.

English: He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm ao tai 'nguaih kơ êphot tanh hăm brai săk jơk ngăl.

English: And there was an opening in the middle of the robe, like the opening in a coat of mail, with a woven binding all around the opening, so that it would not tear.
Bahnar: Bŏk 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk ao tai wă trô̆ kơ̆l, hơko ao lem tăp dăr thoi đe reng, wă kơ sư huay kơ hiah tơbuch.

English: They made on the hem of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet, and of fine woven linen.
Bahnar: Lu sư sĭt plei gărnăt hăm brai jơk 'brê gôh, 'brê gơhĭm tăp dăr kơ tơdrơi ao hăm plei gărnăt hăm brai.

English: And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates on the hem of the robe all around between the pomegranates
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm krĕng-nĕng hăm maih rơgoh, sĭt tơdrơi tơdrơi sơlam 'bar tŏ plei gărnăt.

English: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe to minister in, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Kư̆ kơ tơtil minh pôm plei gărnăt đei chô̆ minh pôm krĕng-nĕng maih păng pơrok tăp dăr kơ tơnăp ao, mă 'măn kơ lu 'bok soi hrŭk lăm năr bơ̆jang, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă boih kơ Môis.

English: They made tunics, artistically woven of fine linen, for Aaron and his sons
Bahnar: Lu sư tanh ao tai păng brai 'bui se ăn kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư

English: a turban of fine linen, exquisite hats of fine linen, short trousers of fine woven linen
Bahnar: môk, mu wăn kơ̆l, hơbĕn lăm, kư̆m tanh hăm che 'bui brai se ngăl

English: and a sash of fine woven linen with blue, purple, and scarlet thread, made by a weaver, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: tơlei tơ̆n tanh, sĭt păng, brai se jơk, 'brê gôh, 'brê hơhĭm, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă ăn boih kơ Môis.

English: Then they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it an inscription like the engraving of a signet: HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm plăk iĕ pơklep tơ mu rơgoh 'lơ̆ng hăm maih rơgoh. Lu sư chrek tơ noh thoi đe chrek pơm tơdra kơtĭt: Rơgoh 'Lơ̆ng Ăn Kơ Kră Yang.

English: And they tied to it a blue cord, to fasten it above on the turban, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Lu sư chô̆ plăk ei hăm minh dăng tơlei kŭi jơk, wă chô̆ plăk 'bơ̆t anăp mu, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei tơtă boih kơ Môis.

English: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting was finished. And the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD had commanded Moses; so they did.
Bahnar: Thoi noh tơdrong pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm keh đang boih. Kon pơlei Isơrael pơm kiơ̆ thoi dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă hăm Môis.

English: And they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its furnishings: its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets
Bahnar: Lu sư ba ăn kơ Môis bơsŭn, bơsŭn hăm đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm noh, hơdrơ̆ng, tơ̆r, hơbăt, jrăng păng lu bơlôh rơnuh sư

English: the covering of ram skins dyed red, the covering of badger skins, and the veil of the covering
Bahnar: tơmam klơ̆p bơbŭng, pơm păng akar triu tong đak 'brê, akar ka tih păng che pĕng

English: the ark of the Testimony with its poles, and the mercy seat
Bahnar: hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p păng tơnung tung sư păng Tơnglơ̆p 'Mêm Mơnat

English: the table, all its utensils, and the showbread
Bahnar: gơ'bang păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua kơ sư păng 'bĕng rơgoh

English: the pure gold lampstand with its lamps (the lamps set in order), all its utensils, and the oil for light
Bahnar: jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng maih rơgoh hăm akâu ŭnh kơđeng, hơmet pơm keh đĭ boih, hăm lu tơmam yua lăm noh; păng đak rơmă pơlei ôliwơ yua wă tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng

English: the gold altar, the anointing oil, and the sweet incense; the screen for the tabernacle door
Bahnar: chơnang soi maih, đak 'bâu phu wă yua pik, tơmam 'bâu phu, che pĕng 'măng mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn

English: the bronze altar, its grate of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils; the laver with its base
Bahnar: chơnang soi păng grang hơdrao pơm păng kong, 'long ting tung păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm chơnang soi kơthŭng đak hăm jơ̆ng sư

English: the hangings of the court, its pillars and its sockets, the screen for the court gate, its cords, and its pegs; all the utensils for the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting
Bahnar: lu che pĕng kơdeng Bơsŭn Akŭm, jrăng hăm bơlôh rơnuh, che pĕng 'bơ̆t 'măng mơ̆t tơ kơdeng, tơlei kŭi, hơdrơ̆ng war. Hăm đĭ-đăng tơmam yua tơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: and the garments of ministry, to minister in the holy place: the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons’ garments, to minister as priests.
Bahnar: hơbĕn ao giĕng 'bok soi wă hrŭk jang lăm anih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, hơbĕn ao kơ Arôn 'bok soi tơm, hăm ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư 'măn kơ tơdrong jang 'bok soi.

English: According to all that the LORD had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla Isơrael pơm keh tôm tơdrong jang noh kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă boih kơ Môis.

English: Then Moses looked over all the work, and indeed they had done it; as the LORD had commanded, just so they had done it. And Moses blessed them.
Bahnar: Môis lăng lăng tôm tơdrong jang, 'bôh lu sư pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan pơkă boih, thoi noh na Môis bơnê sơkat ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “On the first day of the first month you shall set up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
Bahnar: Năr mă mônh lăm khei mônh ih athei pơdơ̆ng tơiung Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: You shall put in it the ark of the Testimony, and partition off the ark with the veil.
Bahnar: Dan hom pơgơ̆p tơ lăm noh păng iŏk che pĕng găn lê̆.

English: You shall bring in the table and arrange the things that are to be set in order on it; and you shall bring in the lampstand and light its lamps.
Bahnar: Iŏk tơmơ̆t gơ'bang tơ lăm, dan proh hơmet dôm lu tơmam kơpal gơ'bang, đơ̆ng noh chĕp jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng tơmơ̆t păng tơ̆k rim ŭnh kơđeng.

English: You shall also set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the Testimony, and put up the screen for the door of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Dan chơnang soi maih wă soh tơmam 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp hom pơgơ̆p păng iŏk che dăng pĕng klơ̆p 'măng mơ̆t tơ bơsŭn.

English: Then you shall set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
Bahnar: Dan chơnang soi 'buh noh 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng wă mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: And you shall set the laver between the tabernacle of meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
Bahnar: Dan kơthŭng đak tơ tŏk-bŏk sơlam Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm hăm chơnang soi đơ̆ng noh tuh đak tơ lăm noh

English: You shall set up the court all around, and hang up the screen at the court gate.
Bahnar: Pơm cham jum dăr păng pĕng che 'bơ̆t 'măng mơ̆t tơ cham.

English: “And you shall take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it; and you shall hallow it and all its utensils, and it shall be holy.
Bahnar: Ih iŏk đak rơmă 'bâu phu na pik tơ Bơsŭn păng rim kơ tơmam lăm noh; pơyơ̆r bơsŭn păng dôm lu tơmam yua lăm Bơsŭn păng Bơsŭn noh gô 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: You shall anoint the altar of the burnt offering and all its utensils, and consecrate the altar. The altar shall be most holy.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ih pik đak rơmă 'bâu phu tơ chơnang soi 'buh pơyơ̆r păng dôm tơmam yua lăm chơnang soi; pơyơ̆r chơnang soi, na chơnang soi jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tơpă.

English: And you shall anoint the laver and its base, and consecrate it.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m pik rơmă 'bâu phu tơ kơthŭng đak păng jơ̆ng sư păng pơyơ̆r kơthŭng noh.

English: “Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tabernacle of meeting and wash them with water.
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh, ih chông Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư năm jê̆ 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, na tuh hum lu sư.

English: You shall put the holy garments on Aaron, and anoint him and consecrate him, that he may minister to Me as priest.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ih pơhrŭk kơ Arôn ao 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, pik đak rơmă 'bâu phu păng pơyơ̆r sư; wă kơ sư jang kơ Inh lăm tơdrong jang 'bok soi tơm.

English: And you shall bring his sons and clothe them with tunics.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m chông ba lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn păng pơhrŭk ăn kơ lu sư ao tai

English: You shall anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may minister to Me as priests; for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.”
Bahnar: pik ăn đak rơmă 'bâu phu thoi ih pik ăn kơ 'bă lu sư wă kơ lu sư jang kơ Inh lăm tơdrong jang 'bok soi. Tơdrong pik đak rơmă 'bâu phu pôk ăn noh wă pơsĭt kơ lu sư pơm 'bok soi ling-lang lăm rim jơhnơr.

English: Thus Moses did; according to all that the LORD had commanded him, so he did.
Bahnar: Na Môis pơm kiơ̆ đĭ thoi dôm tơdrong Kră Yang đei tơtă ăn.

English: And it came to pass in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was raised up.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă mônh khei mônh lăm sơnăm mă 'bar, lu sư pơm tơiung Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: So Moses raised up the tabernacle, fastened its sockets, set up its boards, put in its bars, and raised up its pillars.
Bahnar: Môis pơdơ̆ng tơiung Bơsŭn dan dôm bơlôh rơnuh, pơ̆ng tơ̆r, roh hơbăt păng tơiung lu jrăng.

English: And he spread out the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent on top of it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Na Sư bơyar che bơbŭng tơ kơpal Bơsŭn, na sư klơ̆p tơ kơpal bơbŭng kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă kơ Môis.

English: He took the Testimony and put it into the ark, inserted the poles through the rings of the ark, and put the mercy seat on top of the ark.
Bahnar: Môis tah 'bar hlak gơ'bang chih Mơjĭt Khôi Juăt tơ lăm Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p, sư sôr 'long tơnung. Păng dan tơnglơ̆p tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tơ kơpal hom noh.

English: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, hung up the veil of the covering, and partitioned off the ark of the Testimony, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Sư tung ba hom tơmơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng pĕng che găn hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: He put the table in the tabernacle of meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil
Bahnar: Sư dan lê̆ gơ'bang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, gah yă-nơ̆m 'nguaih kơ che pĕng noh

English: and he set the bread in order upon it before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: na dan 'bĕng tơ gơ'bang, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: He put the lampstand in the tabernacle of meeting, across from the table, on the south side of the tabernacle
Bahnar: Sư dan lê̆ jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơklă hăm gơ'bang gah gơal.

English: and he lit the lamps before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Na sư tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: He put the gold altar in the tabernacle of meeting in front of the veil
Bahnar: Sư dan chơnang soi maih 'bơ̆t anăp che pĕng lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: and he burned sweet incense on it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Kơpal chơnang noh, sư soh tơmam 'bâu phu kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: He hung up the screen at the door of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk che pĕng 'bơ̆t 'măng mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And he put the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the grain offering, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Sư dan chơnang soi 'buh 'bơ̆t 'măng mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi phe 'ba tơpŭng, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: He set the laver between the tabernacle of meeting and the altar, and put water there for washing
Bahnar: Sư dan kơthŭng đak 'bơ̆t sơlam Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng chơnang soi, sư tuh đak lăm noh wă răk kơ ôp 'nhao

English: and Moses, Aaron, and his sons would wash their hands and their feet with water from it.
Bahnar: Môis, Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, yua đak 'nâu ôp jơ̆ng ti lu sư.

English: Whenever they went into the tabernacle of meeting, and when they came near the altar, they washed, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Mưh layơ lu sư wă mơ̆t tơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng năm jê̆ chơnang soi lei lu sư ôp hơrao jơ̆ng ti lu sư, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: And he raised up the court all around the tabernacle and the altar, and hung up the screen of the court gate. So Moses finished the work.
Bahnar: Tăp dăr Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng chơnang soi, sư kư̆m pơm cham păng pĕng che 'bơ̆t 'măng mơ̆t lăm cham. Thoi 'noh Môis pơm keh tôm tơdrong jang noh.

English: Then the cloud covered the tabernacle of meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng tơdrong hơdah rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'bĕnh kơ Bơsŭn

English: And Moses was not able to enter the tabernacle of meeting, because the cloud rested above it, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
Bahnar: dĭng mah Môis ưh kơ gơh kơ mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, yua kơ hơmơ̆l tơdrong hơdah rang mơnhal Kră Yang 'bĕnh kơ Bơsŭn.

English: Whenever the cloud was taken up from above the tabernacle, the children of Israel would go onward in all their journeys.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lăm dôm lu trong kon pơlei Isơrael yak năm, mưh layơ hơmơ̆l đông weh đơ̆ng kơpal Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm lei lu sư yuih Bơsŭn yak nơnăm

English: But if the cloud was not taken up, then they did not journey till the day that it was taken up.
Bahnar: mă-lei mưh hơmơ̆l ưh kơ đông weh lei lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ yak năm, dĭng mă truh tơ năr ayơ hơmơ̆l mă đông weh 'mơ̆i.

English: For the cloud of the LORD was above the tabernacle by day, and fire was over it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
Bahnar: Lăm rim trong kon pơlei Isơrael yak năm đei hơmơ̆l Kră Yang tơ kơpal Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơ kơ'năr đei hơmơ̆l gom păng kơmăng đei ŭnh lĕch pơchrang kơpal tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael.
